4236190640,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-capabilities-insight-analyst-at-mckinsey-company-4236190640?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=SQJ2mqTGSOcyeWJjIxV3nA%3D%3D&trackingId=DLMZXGydfE6uTXC6eCzVYw%3D%3D,Junior Capabilities & Insight Analyst,McKinsey & Company,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:

Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.

A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.

Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in various sectors and business functions. You’ll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.
The type of contract and the level of role will depend on your experience and qualifications. Internship contract will be available as well.
You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Milan Client Capabilities Network is part of the geographic research and knowledge group with analysts covering the main sectors of activity for McKinsey in Italy. The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.
Master's degree in economics or business engineering with record of strong academic achievement
Interest in research type of work
Up to 1 year of work experience
column2: recent graduates with relevant internship experience will be considered

Ability to work well in a team setting and across all levels within an organization
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively in both English and Italian

Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:

  • Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
  • A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
  • Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
  • World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your Impact

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in various sectors and business functions. You’ll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.

The type of contract and the level of role will depend on your experience and qualifications. Internship contract will be available as well.

You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

Kepleria si configura così come uno dei principali player italiani in questo settore, azienda appartenente ad Altea Federation con una profonda esperienza pluriennale in progetti di Data Management, Business Intelligence e Planning

Attraverso strumenti avanzati di elaborazione dei dati, accompagna i propri clienti nel viaggio per diventare “data driven company”. Tramite soluzioni Analytics, expertise di industry e processo, utilizza le tecnologie più solide e innovative per estrarre valore dai dati e metterli a disposizione a tutti i livelli dell’organizzazione, al fine di liberare nuove potenzialità e orientare le decisioni in un’ottica ispirata alla massima efficacia ed efficienza, oltre che al cost-saving.
Ogni progetto di trasformazione digitale intrapreso utilizza modelli di business agili, sostenibili e adattivi.

Siamo una FREE PLACE COMPANY, quindi operiamo da dove è più opportuno lavorare (casa, ufficio, cliente), in funzione degli obiettivi da perseguire, condividendoli con i propri riferimenti di progetto o di unità organizzativa.

relazionarsi attivamente con gli stakeholder di progetto.

Sarai affiancato da profili senior che ti aiuteranno nel gestire le criticità e potrai dare il tuo contributo avendo una certa autonomia nel ruolo, assicurandoti che il lavoro svolto sia in linea con i piani di progetto, gli standard di qualità e la sicurezza aziendale.

Secondo Stephen Covey, uno dei più importanti studiosi a livello mondiale delle tematiche dell’efficacia e della crescita personale, sono 7 le abitudini (#7 Habits) che distinguono le persone altamente efficaci. In altre parole, assertività, empatia, team working, capacità di costruire relazioni. Gestirai situazioni complesse e ti interfaccerai con molteplici attori.

Entra nella nostra squadra e scrivi la tua storia in Altea Federation!

Siamo orgogliosamente per la non discriminazione e per le pari opportunità e crediamo nel rispetto di tutte le leggi applicabili in materia.
Se hai una disabilità o una necessità speciale, non esitare a candidarti: per noi ogni differenza è una ricchezza!

4267251565,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-ai-expert-at-gruppo-fervo-4267251565?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=SQJ2mqTGSOcyeWJjIxV3nA%3D%3D&trackingId=rYA992cVPZDrhak%2BBEYqNg%3D%3D,Data analyst - AI Expert,Gruppo Fervo,"Nova Milanese, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo un gruppo di aziende specializzato nel settore Technical & Energy Management Services, con una presenza consolidata in Italia e sedi operative anche in Arabia Saudita.

Grazie alla nostra esperienza, abbiamo sviluppato un modello integrato che copre l’intero ciclo di vita degli asset immobiliari: dalla progettazione MEP alla costruzione, manutenzione, ottimizzazione energetica e gestione digitale.
Promuoviamo la decarbonizzazione del Real Estate, attraverso lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di piani di riduzione della carbon footprint.

Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Analyst con competenze in AI per unirsi alla nostra divisione ""AI"", un'unità dinamica e strategica dedicata allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti per l'efficientamento energetico e la manutenzione predittiva.
Analisi di grandi volumi di dati provenienti da sistemi di monitoraggio energetico e ambientale.
Progettazione e sviluppo di modelli predittivi (ML/AI) per l’identificazione di anomalie e il forecasting di malfunzionamenti (failure prediction).
Collaborazione con data scientist, ingegneri e team di prodotto per trasformare insight analitici in soluzioni operative.
Contributo nella creazione di dashboard e report intelligenti per il supporto decisionale.
Validazione e miglioramento continuo dei modelli, adottando un approccio data-driven e iterativo.
Laurea in Ingegneria, Statistica, Data Science, Matematica o discipline affini.
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come data analyst o data scientist.
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi per l’analisi e la modellazione (Python, SQL, R).
Esperienza concreta con librerie di machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Familiarità con tecniche di anomaly detection e predizione del guasto (failure prediction).
Conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione (Tableau, Power BI o simili).
Ti piace sperimentare, ma sempre con un occhio alla robustezza del risultato.
Lavori bene in team multidisciplinari e comunichi in modo chiaro.
Essere automuniti, il luogo di lavoro è difficilmente raggiungibile con i mezzi pubblici
Un ambiente giovane e orientato all’innovazione
Progetti ad alto impatto nel campo della sostenibilità e dell’efficienza energetica
Opportunità di crescita professionale nella nuova divisione ""AI"", strategica per il futuro dell’azienda
Formazione continua su AI, ML e DataOps
Modalità di lavoro flessibile e possibilità di smart working 1 gg alla settimana
Pacchetto retributivo in linea con le tue competenze e con il mercato
Siamo un gruppo di aziende specializzato nel settore <strong>Technical &amp
column2:
Energy Management Services, con una presenza consolidata in Italia e sedi operative anche in Arabia Saudita.

Grazie alla nostra esperienza, abbiamo sviluppato un modello integrato che copre l’intero ciclo di vita degli asset immobiliari: dalla progettazione MEP alla costruzione, manutenzione, ottimizzazione energetica e gestione digitale.

Promuoviamo la decarbonizzazione del Real Estate, attraverso lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di piani di riduzione della carbon footprint.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Analyst con competenze in AI per unirsi alla nostra divisione ""AI"", un'unità dinamica e strategica dedicata allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti per l'efficientamento energetico e la manutenzione predittiva.

Ruolo e responsabilità:

  • Analisi di grandi volumi di dati provenienti da sistemi di monitoraggio energetico e ambientale.
  • Progettazione e sviluppo di modelli predittivi (ML/AI) per l’identificazione di anomalie e il forecasting di malfunzionamenti (failure prediction).
  • Collaborazione con data scientist, ingegneri e team di prodotto per trasformare insight analitici in soluzioni operative.
  • Contributo nella creazione di dashboard e report intelligenti per il supporto decisionale.
  • Validazione e miglioramento continuo dei modelli, adottando un approccio data-driven e iterativo.

Requisiti:

Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Statistica, Data Science, Matematica o discipline affini.
  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come data analyst o data scientist.
  • Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi per l’analisi e la modellazione (Python, SQL, R).
  • Esperienza concreta con librerie di machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Familiarità con tecniche di anomaly detection e predizione del guasto (failure prediction).
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione (Tableau, Power BI o simili).
  • Ti piace sperimentare, ma sempre con un occhio alla robustezza del risultato.
  • Lavori bene in team multidisciplinari e comunichi in modo chiaro.

Altri requisiti:

  • Essere automuniti, il luogo di lavoro è difficilmente raggiungibile con i mezzi pubblici

Altre informazioni:

Cosa troverai in Fervo:

  • Un ambiente giovane e orientato all’innovazione
  • Progetti ad alto impatto nel campo della sostenibilità e dell’efficienza energetica
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale nella nuova divisione ""AI"", strategica per il futuro dell’azienda
  • Formazione continua su AI, ML e DataOps
  • Modalità di lavoro flessibile e possibilità di smart working 1 gg alla settimana
  • Pacchetto retributivo in linea con le tue competenze e con il mercato

4212585645,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-risk-analytics-at-mckinsey-company-4212585645?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=SQJ2mqTGSOcyeWJjIxV3nA%3D%3D&trackingId=xU%2FCvdLX%2FjrD5sKoaEDk8Q%3D%3D,Consultant - Risk Analytics,McKinsey & Company,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:

Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.

A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.

Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.
You will help clients develop or validate their models and assess their modeling frameworks supporting a variety of risk functions, including credit, market, insurance, ESG or model risk management.

You will be part of a team of exceptional risk analytics professionals with similarly deep industry experience and will be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders. We are therefore looking for candidates who can establish connections between sophisticated modeling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. We have a global client base and you will be exposed to a highly international environment.

You will also have the opportunity to advance McKinsey’s overall knowledge base by providing rigorous analysis to and problem solving for our proprietary knowledge investments. At more senior levels, you’ll also focus on developing new analytical approaches and techniques such as AI or GenAI, working with an outstanding knowledge structure and international network of experts in order to codify existing knowledge and develop new knowledge.

Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges on a daily basis, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills.
You’ll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team.

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.
We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients
column2: work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.
advanced quantitative degree (master's or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus

Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or “in-house” models)
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, R)
column2: knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite), Matlab or SAS would be a strong plus

4275950074,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-reporting-and-analytics-consultant-iv-business-intelligence-at-kaiser-permanente-4275950074?position=1&pageNum=10&refId=R8xp41TZD31uDkhY98gm%2Fg%3D%3D&trackingId=JGvoYbkqV4aLM6kEqyqV0Q%3D%3D,"Data Reporting and Analytics Consultant IV, Business Intelligence",Kaiser Permanente,"Pleasanton, CA","Overview

The RPMO serves the president and senior leadership team of Kaiser Foundation Hospitals and Health Plan for Northern California. We are a dynamic, innovative team solving complex operational challenges to achieve exceptional outcomes for our people, members, and communities.

This position offers the opportunity to measure the impact of transformational initiatives and expand the use of analytics to address the organization’s most persistent business challenges. It also offers the opportunity to partner with regional and local leaders to build intuitive dashboards and automate reporting processes that support strategic decision-making. As the team grows, there is potential to explore AI-driven solutions that further enhance operational performance. Ideal candidates thrive in fast-paced environments, embrace ambiguity, and are energized by the opportunity to help leaders answer critical questions that drive enterprise success.

In addition to the responsibilities listed below, this senior individual contributor Business intelligence (BI) position is also responsible for a combination of duties spanning business analytics, data mining, data visualization, and data tools and infrastructure. This includes leveraging KP practices to help the organization make sound data-driven decisions.

This position is also be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights that will help drive KPs strategic and operational business decisions. This includes using BI tools (e.g., Cognos, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) to access and analyze data sets and present analytical findings in visually driven and focused reports, summaries, dashboards, graphs, charts, and maps to provide users with detailed intelligence about the state of KPs business.
Practices self-development and promotes learning in others by proactively providing information, resources, advice, and expertise with coworkers and customers

column8: supporting team collaboration
column9: and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback.

column8: and recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities.

column3: and conducting analyses, including descriptive, correlational, inferential, and/or predictive statistics.

Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Social/Physical/Life Science, Business, or related field and Minimum five (5) years experience in data analytics or a directly related field. Additional equivalent work experience in a directly related field may be substituted for the degree requirement.

Asana is a leading company that helps teams orchestrate their work efficiently. They are seeking a Data Science Intern to assist in designing experiments, analyzing data, and building predictive models to support product and business decisions.
• Designing and analyzing experiments to measure the impact of new product features
• Investigating high-level questions like 'What are the collaborative patterns of the most successful teams using Asana?'
• Adding new metrics and aggregations to our data warehouse to make new classes of questions answerable
• Building models to predict the growth trajectory of different customer segments
• Your anticipated graduation date is between December 2026 and July 2027
• Strong technical background in computer science, statistics, math, information science, or another quantitative field
• Fluency in at least one modern language useful for data processing (e.g. Python, Scala)
• Proficiency with relational data modeling and SQL
• Expertise in statistical methods and experimental design and analysis
• Experience with distributed data processing systems (e.g. Spark, Redshift)
• Background in advanced statistical modeling (e.g. GLM, mixed effects) and/or machine learning

Asana is a software company that specializes in the fields of work management, productivity, team goals, and project execution. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Public Company. Asana has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

As a leader in end-to-end population health management solutions and services, we are continuing to grow our talented software development team. We are currently looking for a full-time Data Transformation Engineer to join our experienced team. The Data Transformation Engineer will design, configure, implement, operate, and maintain technology systems. The Data Transformation Engineer will be capable of addressing new technology, compliance, and industry standards. They will be fluent in HL7 data management and normalization. The Data Transformation Engineer will have the ability to work with teammates to accept support tickets from client partners around specific data transformation requests. They will research, review, troubleshoot, analyze, and triage tickets appropriately. They will have strong personal skills in collaborating with partner resources.
The Ideal Candidate Will Have Experience In
Provide expertise on receiving and transforming data from disparate sources
Work cross functionally within the company and externally with partners to meet data transformation, interface mapping, configuration, and validation needs
Perform risk management pertaining to interfaces and data transformation to maximize client implementation success
Track any/all open interface issues through resolution
Actively work with internal and external project team members to resolve open interface implementation items
Monitor and report on ongoing data transmission for errors or issues at all stages of data ingestion and transformation, including communication to customer
Report and escalate support issues as appropriate
Communicate and collaborate with development engineers for knowledge and assistance
Ensure interfaces and data transformation work are completed within agreed upon project schedule timelines provided by Operations
Review validation reports and address any discrepancies with the Customer
Proven working experience in interface implementation and/or working with claims/clinical data within the healthcare industry
Knowledge of value-based care, population health a plus
Ability to speak to all levels within an organization
Solid organizational skills, including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
Ability to embrace change and company growth
Proven experience managing relationships with customers technical and analytical team members
Critical thinking with problem solving skills
Required: BS Degree (or higher) or equivalent work experience
High Risk (if any of these are true)
Access to Restricted information, including PHI and PII
Access to Confidential, but not to Restricted information

To apply, simply TEXT USIC to 90206 to connect with our hiring team today.

Are you an outdoor enthusiast who enjoys independent field work and is looking to jump start your career? If you are a quality-conscious, safety focused, hard-working individual, then consider an exciting long-term career at USIC!

The USIC name and brand are highly recognized and respected for our strong commitment to quality and safety. We are looking for individuals who consider themselves problem solvers, take pride in public safety, and thrive in a fast-paced, exciting work environment. Our communities are your communities.
If you’re looking for growth, we’ve got you covered. We provide a quality training program and opportunities for advancement. No prior locating experience needed!

Our technicians spend their workdays on the go, independently working in the field using their company-provided vehicle. We use best-in-class ticket and claims management systems to ensure clear and complete mark-out services for the excavator or property owner at the work site.
Correctly, safely, and efficiently locate underground utilities, including telecommunications, electric power, cable TV, gas, water, and sewer systems.
Thoroughly search for underground utilities in a designated area, accurately marking the location, completing the necessary documentation, and photographing each locate.
These are daytime, full-time positions and overtime is required. We have a 48-hour turnaround time on most locates, which means we generally work the day after holidays and some weekends, as needed.
Why You'll Love Working for Us (Our Benefits):
100% paid training – We're invested in you, starting on your first day.
High-quality company vehicle & fuel card – All work-related expenses are paid. This means you won't be putting mileage on your personal vehicle for work.
Company laptop, phone, & equipment – Advanced technology you can count on.
DailyPay – Access your pay when you need it.
Comprehensive insurance options – A variety of excellent insurance choices including medical, dental, vision, and life.
401(k) with company match – We’ll help you save for the long term with our competitive 401(k) employer match program.
PTO & paid holidays – Even in your first year, so you can spend time with your loved ones.
Weekend & holiday on-call pay – Earn extra money while on call over the weekend or on a company holiday, even if not called out to an emergency.
Technician Incentive Plan – Bonuses based on individual quality & safety results, as well as tenure.
Career Path Program (CPP) – Unmatched in our industry. We recognize employees who strive to be the best in their roles with distinctive titles, promotions, and more.
Outstanding Marks Program – Earn points for tenure, safety, and quality milestones to spend on products of your choice from an expansive online store.
Tenure Boots Program –$200 voucher to buy a new pair of work boots on your first anniversary and every year after.

Education Partnership & Scholarship Program – Discounted tuition for USIC employees, their spouses, and dependents through Indiana Tech (courses available online nationwide). Scholarships available for employees. Credit hours for completing our utility locator training curriculum and/or for military service.
Employee discounts & perks – Outstanding discounts at major retailers and service providers.
What We Need from You (Our Requirements):
Able and willing to work outdoors in various weather conditions. Previous outdoor experience is a plus.
Available to work overtime and weekends, as needed.
Able to pass a drug screen (this is a safety-sensitive position).
Valid driver’s license and a safe driving record
Able to work in a confined space
column2: walk, bend, and lift up to 75 lbs.

Goldman Sachs is a multinational financial services firm providing securities, investment banking, and management services. As a Full-stack Software Engineer on the Data Engineering team, you will help improve the Legend data platform and curate data offerings while tackling complex engineering problems and ensuring the business's data needs are met.
• Design & develop modern data management tools to curate our most important data sets, models and processes, while identifying areas for process automation and further efficiencies
• Contribute to an open-source technology - https://github.com/finos/legend
• Drive adoption of cloud technology for data processing and warehousing
• Engage with data consumers and producers in order to design appropriate models to suit enable the business
• A Bachelor or Master degree in a computational field (Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or in a related quantitative discipline)
• 0 - 2 years of relevant work experience in a team-focused environment
• 0 - 2 years of experience in distributed system design
• 0 - 2 years of experience using Java, Python, and/or React

• Strong object-oriented design and programming skills and experience in OO languages (Java)

• Establish trusted partnerships with key contacts and users across business and engineering teams

4263478729,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-huspy-4263478729?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Q7SDK127kH%2FTIgbkCaEXRw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Huspy,European Union,"The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.
The Main Event: What You’ll Do

At Huspy, our Data team powers growth and innovation by transforming data into actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll empower both strategic decision-making and product development by delivering robust dashboards, insightful analyses, and data-driven recommendations.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards in Tableau (preferred) or similar tools to deliver clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, and analyze data using SQL and Python from platforms like Snowflake.
Optimize and scale reporting systems for efficiency and accessibility.
Monitor product KPIs such as user engagement, feature usage, and success metrics.
Conduct experiments to guide product decisions and roadmaps.
Analyze user behavior to assess feature performance and optimize rollouts.
Partner with product, engineering, and business teams to align analytics with strategic goals.
Translate business questions into analytical requirements and provide data-driven insights.
The Perfect Match: What You Bring
Experience: 5–8 years in data analytics or product analytics.
Advanced SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)
Experience with tools like Tableau, or Looker
Familiarity with product analytics tools such as Amplitude (preferred), Mixpanel, or Google Analytics
Knowledge of Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow for data warehousing and data pipelines
Strong background in hypothesis testing, and regression analysis
Proven ability to turn complex data into actionable insights
Understanding of ETL and data transformation workflows
Excellent communication skills to explain analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Collaborative mindset and experience working across departments
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field
column2: Master’s degree is a plus.

column1: Direct experience with our tech stack: Tableau, Amplitude, Snowflake, dbt, Airflow
Experience in fast-paced, data-driven environments such as startups or PropTech
Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of product and business KPIs

Are you a Data Analyst with 2 to 5 years of experience? We’re looking for you!
At darwind, we welcome motivated professionals who are eager to grow and develop their skills. You'll join an environment where people, learning, and impact come first.
You collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
You create dashboards and reports that help stakeholders make better decisions
You work closely with data engineers, business teams, and other analysts to translate questions into actionable analyses
You apply statistical methods or machine learning models to support business forecasting and planning
You ensure data quality and reliability through validation and documentation
You keep learning about new tools, technologies, and methods in the world of data
You have 2 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
You know your way around Python, SQL, and Excel, experience with R or Azure is a plus
You’ve worked with data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau
You combine analytical thinking with strong communication skills
You speak fluent Dutch and have a good knowledge of French and English
You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to take ownership of your work
Projects that match your skills and help you grow
Coaching and mentoring by experienced data professionals
Training and certifications based on your ambitions
An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, meal allowance, and the choice between a company car with fuel card or the federal mobility budget
Flexibility: work at the client’s site, at the darwind office, or from home
And most of all: joy at work, autonomy, and a team you can count on
Let’s talk, we’re looking forward to meeting you!

Ready to dive deep into data and make an impact as a Data Analyst?

Are you a Data Analyst with 2 to 5 years of experience? We’re looking for you!

At darwind, we welcome motivated professionals who are eager to grow and develop their skills. You'll join an environment where people, learning, and impact come first.


What will you do?

  • You collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
  • You create dashboards and reports that help stakeholders make better decisions
  • You work closely with data engineers, business teams, and other analysts to translate questions into actionable analyses
  • You apply statistical methods or machine learning models to support business forecasting and planning
  • You ensure data quality and reliability through validation and documentation
  • You keep learning about new tools, technologies, and methods in the world of data


Who are we looking for?

  • You have 2 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
  • You know your way around Python, SQL, and Excel, experience with R or Azure is a plus
  • You’ve worked with data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau
  • You combine analytical thinking with strong communication skills
  • You speak fluent Dutch and have a good knowledge of French and English
  • You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to take ownership of your work


What can you expect?

  • Projects that match your skills and help you grow
  • Coaching and mentoring by experienced data professionals
  • Training and certifications based on your ambitions
  • An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, meal allowance, and the choice between a company car with fuel card or the federal mobility budget
  • Flexibility: work at the client’s site, at the darwind office, or from home
  • And most of all: joy at work, autonomy, and a team you can count on


Sounds like something for you?

Let’s talk, we’re looking forward to meeting you!

Start date: As soon as possible

Are you a highly analytical Data Analyst with a passion for data quality, reporting, and bridging the gap between business and IT? For a leading player in the financial sector, we are looking for a driven Data Analyst who wants to grow in a dynamic environment transitioning from legacy systems to modern cloud solutions.
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of analysts, developers, and a Scrum Master, where collaboration, continuous improvement, and coaching are central.
This is a 2-year coaching program where you’ll be guided by experienced professionals, with the option to integrate into the client organization upon successful completion.
Act as a bridge between business stakeholders and the data team to gather and translate reporting requirements into technical solutions.
Support business needs by delivering structured, cleansed, and high-quality data from various systems and sources.
Develop and maintain reporting solutions, including examples such as a Customer 360° view.
Contribute to the transition from SAS-based systems to a modern Azure cloud environment.
Perform ETL tasks and write complex SQL queries to extract and transform data.
Cleanse and prepare data to ensure consistency, accuracy, and usability.
Design and implement data models to support business intelligence and analytics.
Structure and consolidate data from multiple sources into coherent datasets.
Document processes and workflows using BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation).
Collaborate within an Agile Scrum team to deliver incremental value.
Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Experience with SQL, data modeling, and data quality.
Familiarity with ETL processes and preferably experience with reporting tools such as Qlik Sense or similar.
Knowledge of or strong interest in Azure-based data solutions.
Strong analytical and communication skills – you know how to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Experience with BPMN is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch or French, with a good command of English.
A 2-year coaching program in a stimulating and evolving environment.
Intensive support and personal development, with room for autonomy and initiative.
The opportunity to integrate with the client after the program.
A hybrid working setup based in Brussels.
Collaboration within a motivated and multidisciplinary team shaping the future of data-driven decision-making.
Ready to grow in an environment where coaching, impact, and development opportunities are key? We’d love to hear from you — let’s explore the possibilities together.

Location: Brussels (hybrid)

Start date: As soon as possible


Introduction

Are you a highly analytical Data Analyst with a passion for data quality, reporting, and bridging the gap between business and IT? For a leading player in the financial sector, we are looking for a driven Data Analyst who wants to grow in a dynamic environment transitioning from legacy systems to modern cloud solutions.

You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of analysts, developers, and a Scrum Master, where collaboration, continuous improvement, and coaching are central.

This is a 2-year coaching program where you’ll be guided by experienced professionals, with the option to integrate into the client organization upon successful completion.


Your responsibilities

  • Act as a bridge between business stakeholders and the data team to gather and translate reporting requirements into technical solutions.
  • Support business needs by delivering structured, cleansed, and high-quality data from various systems and sources.
  • Develop and maintain reporting solutions, including examples such as a Customer 360° view.
  • Contribute to the transition from SAS-based systems to a modern Azure cloud environment.
  • Perform ETL tasks and write complex SQL queries to extract and transform data.
  • Cleanse and prepare data to ensure consistency, accuracy, and usability.
  • Design and implement data models to support business intelligence and analytics.
  • Structure and consolidate data from multiple sources into coherent datasets.
  • Document processes and workflows using BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation).
  • Collaborate within an Agile Scrum team to deliver incremental value.


What we’re looking for

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Experience with SQL, data modeling, and data quality.
  • Familiarity with ETL processes and preferably experience with reporting tools such as Qlik Sense or similar.
  • Knowledge of or strong interest in Azure-based data solutions.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills – you know how to translate business needs into technical solutions.
  • Experience with BPMN is a plus.
  • Fluent in Dutch or French, with a good command of English.


What we offer

  • A 2-year coaching program in a stimulating and evolving environment.
  • Intensive support and personal development, with room for autonomy and initiative.
  • The opportunity to integrate with the client after the program.
  • A hybrid working setup based in Brussels.
  • Collaboration within a motivated and multidisciplinary team shaping the future of data-driven decision-making.


Interested?

Ready to grow in an environment where coaching, impact, and development opportunities are key? We’d love to hear from you — let’s explore the possibilities together.

4231545537,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-laco-4231545537?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=OOR8zDNRb3%2BlWpNTsJK1KQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,LACO,"Brussels Region, Belgium","LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.
Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:
Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.
Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.
Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …
📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?
Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.
LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data &
column2: AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data &amp
column3:
AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.


🛠️ Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

  • Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
  • Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
  • Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
  • Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI &
column4:
Microsoft Fabric.


🎯 Wat wij zoeken:

  • Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
  • Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
  • Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
  • Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
  • Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
  • Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.


Extra punten als je ook …

  • Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
  • Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
  • Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.


💡 Wat wij bieden:

  • Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
  • Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
  • Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
  • Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
  • Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …


📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
You dive into a large amount of data :
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

Position Title: Data Analyst

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Duration: 6 months

Languages: Dutch and English

Work mode: Hybrid


Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst for a challenging assignment within an organization with a strong social impact. The team you will be working on will be responsible for providing reports and dashboards that provide management and diverse teams with insights to monitor performance and identify issues early. In addition, you provide data for strategic decisions and support AI initiatives by making relevant datasets available.


Your responsibilities

  • Developing and improving interactive dashboards and reports.
  • Analyzing complex data sets to discover trends and insights.
  • Be the point of contact for the business within a functional domain.
  • Coordinating work within a team of ±5 people.
  • Translating business requirements into technical analyses and documentation.
  • Supporting strategic decision-making through data-driven advice.
  • Collaborate with agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, story refinement, and backlog management.


Required profile

Essential:

  • At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL (writing queries independently).
  • Experience in setting up dashboards and reports (e.g. with MicroStrategy, OBI or similar BI tools).
  • Understanding of data analysis architectures (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systems).
  • Experience with data modeling (3NF, data vault, dimensional).
  • Knowledge of Agile and Scrum (story point estimation, backlog, refinement).
  • Experience with Jira and Confluence.
  • Analytically strong, problem-solving skills and good communication skills.
  • Fluent in Dutch, with a good command of English.


Desired:

  • Experience with unstructured data and large data volumes.
  • Knowledge of data virtualization tools and event-driven architecture.
  • Basic knowledge of Python (being able to read code).
  • Experience with SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka and Apache NiFi.
  • Knowledge of ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is a plus.
  • Experience in the role of Product Owner within an agile team.
  • Insight into trends and evolutions within data analysis.


Pros:

  • Knowledge of the labour market context is an asset.
  • Experience in an advisory role to management and stakeholders.
  • Hands-on experience with AI initiatives and data support.


Skills:

  • Familiar with tools such as Apache NiFi, Kafka, and data virtualization.
  • Experience with BI reporting and dashboarding (OBI, MicroStrategy or similar)
  • Knowledge of data modeling (3rd normal form, Data Vault, dimensional)
  • Basic knowledge of AI and how data can be used for statistical insights.
  • Coordinating work within a team (±5 people)
  • Strong communication skills (Dutch &
column2: English).

As a Product Data Analyst, you play a key role in structuring and ensuring the quality of product data at Facq. In the short term, you will actively contribute to our strategic migration project to SAP S/4HANA, ensuring data quality, consistency, and proper integration. In the medium term, you will help implement a PIM (Product Information Management) system in collaboration with IT, e-commerce, marketing, and product teams.
This position is a great opportunity for a recent graduate who is detail-oriented, structured, and comfortable with numbers and digital tools.
Collect, structure, and analyze data from supplier contracts, pricing grids, and sales history.
Identify inconsistencies, duplicates, and anomalies in existing databases.
Create dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI) to support decision-making.
Work closely with business and IT teams to ensure a smooth SAP migration.
Participate in data validation tests (UAT) before go-live.
Document data governance rules and cleansing processes.
Contribute to the development of new Product Data Management processes with internal teams (IT, e-commerce, product & marketing).
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, ideally in business, IT, supply chain, or equivalent.
Comfortable with digital tools and quick to learn (SAP, AS400, Copilot AI, etc.).
Accuracy, attention to detail, and error detection skills.
Fluent in French or Dutch, with professional English.
A strategic role at the heart of the company’s digital transformation.
A stimulating environment to learn and grow.

Product Data Analyst Junior


Your mission

As a Product Data Analyst, you play a key role in structuring and ensuring the quality of product data at Facq. In the short term, you will actively contribute to our strategic migration project to SAP S/4HANA, ensuring data quality, consistency, and proper integration. In the medium term, you will help implement a PIM (Product Information Management) system in collaboration with IT, e-commerce, marketing, and product teams.

This position is a great opportunity for a recent graduate who is detail-oriented, structured, and comfortable with numbers and digital tools.


Your responsibilities

  • Collect, structure, and analyze data from supplier contracts, pricing grids, and sales history.
  • Identify inconsistencies, duplicates, and anomalies in existing databases.
  • Create dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI) to support decision-making.
  • Work closely with business and IT teams to ensure a smooth SAP migration.
  • Participate in data validation tests (UAT) before go-live.
  • Document data governance rules and cleansing processes.
  • Contribute to the development of new Product Data Management processes with internal teams (IT, e-commerce, product &
column2:
marketing).


Your profile

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, ideally in business, IT, supply chain, or equivalent.
  • Analytical mindset, structured and quality-oriented.
  • Excellent command of Excel.
  • Comfortable with digital tools and quick to learn (SAP, AS400, Copilot AI, etc.).
  • Accuracy, attention to detail, and error detection skills.
  • Fluent in French or Dutch, with professional English.


Why join Facq?

  • A strategic role at the heart of the company’s digital transformation.
  • A supportive and dynamic team.
  • A stimulating environment to learn and grow.

Welcome to Starcasino – Pioneers in Casino Entertainment

With over 30 years of experience, Starcasino is a leading, family-owned Belgian company in the casino and iGaming industry. Our brands—including Starcasino.be, Hotwin.be, Solcasino.es, and Starcasino.nl—are well known across Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. With more than 10 physical locations and a vibrant online presence, we're always looking for fresh energy to support our mission of delivering next-level gaming experiences.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our data & insights team. Your primary responsibility will be to support business stakeholders with clear and actionable insights using Metabase. You'll play a key role in helping our teams make smarter decisions based on real data.

Work closely with marketing, product, and operations teams to provide insights and performance tracking
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and platform trends
Assist in A/B testing and experiment evaluation
Ensure data quality and help optimize internal reporting processes
A degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Experience with Metabase (personal projects or internships are welcome)
Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow within a data-driven environment

DynaFin is a consulting company with 15 years of experience in delivering high quality services to one single sector: Financial Services. We have built a team of > 150 financial services experts in Belgium, Luxembourg and France, passionate to support the sustainable transformation of the financial industry.
DynaFin advises this key sector of the global economy to boost its operating performance and innovate for the future.

Since 2017, DynaFin is part of Alan Allman Associates, a worldwide ecosystem of 20 strong brands specialized in strategy and digital transformation, representing 3.200 Consultants. We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong expertise in data warehousing and modelling to support data-driven initiatives within a banking environment. The analyst will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and delivery teams to translate complex business needs into reliable and scalable data solutions.


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and challenge business requirements and translate them into structured functional and technical specifications
  • Collaborate with Solution Architects to ensure alignment with existing data architecture
  • Model and document data structures using 3NF and dimensional modelling (Kimball methodology)
  • Support the design, validation, and optimisation of ETL processes
  • Conduct impact analysis and formulate clear solution proposals
  • Maintain consistent and structured documentation of requirements, models, and solutions
  • Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)
  • Contribute to knowledge sharing, peer reviews, and team improvement efforts
  • Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
  • Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards


Profile:

  • Master’s degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
  • Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
  • Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
  • Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
  • Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus
  • Able to work independently and provide structured input to project teams
  • Precise, analytical, and solution-focused approach
  • Fluent in Dutch (mandatory), with a good command of English or French

column2:

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
We look forward to meeting you!

Are you a skilled Data Analyst ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in data analysis and interpretation to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to uncover insights and trends that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business leaders to understand data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Utilize statistical methods and machine learning techniques to analyze data and predict future trends.
Provide recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic planning and operational improvements.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings to support transparency and knowledge sharing.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and business intelligence.

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in data analysis and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong track record of analyzing and interpreting complex datasets.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and reporting solutions.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural and dynamic team environment.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System &
column2:

Je zal een sleutelrol spelen in het analyseren van data en het ontwikkelen van inzichten die bijdragen aan strategische en operationele beslissingen.
Analyseren van grote datasets met behulp van statistische en analytische technieken
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van duidelijke, onderhoudbare en herbruikbare datamodellen
Visualiseren van data en het vertalen ervan naar begrijpelijke rapporten en dashboards
Presenteren van inzichten aan stakeholders via heldere storytelling en visualisatietechnieken
Opzetten en implementeren van data governance processen en procedures
Je beschikt over aantoonbare ervaring in de volgende domeinen:
Power BI of een vergelijkbare visualisatietool
MS SQL Server en/of MS Fabric (Data Warehousing)
Opzetten van data governance, processen en procedures
Ervaring of kennis in Data Mesh, Git, CI/CD en Unit Testing is een plus
We zoeken een professional die niet alleen sterk is in data, maar ook in samenwerking en communicatie, je bent:
In staat om complexe data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen
Professioneel, correct en respectvol in je communicatie en gedrag
Vlot in het samenwerken binnen teams, met aandacht voor waarden als vriendelijkheid, betrouwbaarheid, positiviteit en verantwoordelijkheid
Geëngageerd om gedurende de volledige looptijd van het project kwalitatief werk te leveren

Voor een langdurige opdracht binnen een dynamische IT-omgeving zoeken we een ervaren Data Analyst die zijn of haar analytische vaardigheden wil inzetten binnen diverse Business Intelligence-projecten.


Functieomschrijving

Je zal een sleutelrol spelen in het analyseren van data en het ontwikkelen van inzichten die bijdragen aan strategische en operationele beslissingen.

Je verantwoordelijkheden omvatten onder andere:

  • Analyseren van grote datasets met behulp van statistische en analytische technieken
  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van duidelijke, onderhoudbare en herbruikbare datamodellen
  • Visualiseren van data en het vertalen ervan naar begrijpelijke rapporten en dashboards
  • Presenteren van inzichten aan stakeholders via heldere storytelling en visualisatietechnieken
  • Opzetten en implementeren van data governance processen en procedures


Profiel

Technische vaardigheden

Je beschikt over aantoonbare ervaring in de volgende domeinen:

  • Power BI of een vergelijkbare visualisatietool
  • MS SQL Server en/of MS Fabric (Data Warehousing)
  • SQL in functie van datamodellering
  • Opzetten van data governance, processen en procedures
  • Ervaring of kennis in Data Mesh, Git, CI/CD en Unit Testing is een plus


Soft Skills

We zoeken een professional die niet alleen sterk is in data, maar ook in samenwerking en communicatie, je bent:

  • In staat om complexe data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen
  • Professioneel, correct en respectvol in je communicatie en gedrag
  • Vlot in het samenwerken binnen teams, met aandacht voor waarden als vriendelijkheid, betrouwbaarheid, positiviteit en verantwoordelijkheid
  • Geëngageerd om gedurende de volledige looptijd van het project kwalitatief werk te leveren


Praktische Informatie

  • Locatie: Regio Brussel
  • Startdatum: 1 juli 2025
  • Contract: Freelance of consultancy
  • Werkregime: Voltijds
  • Ervaring vereist: 5 tot 10 jaar


Interesse? Solliciteer via LinkedIn.

luc@bimona.be

4265160081,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-equans-belux-4265160081?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=GLDo9diPwaMo%2FJFregPGng%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Equans BeLux,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?
With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards - it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.
To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact - all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.
Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels
As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems...)
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios
Job requirements What you bring to the table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English
Ready to shape the way data drives HR?
Terms of employment Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.
You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.
Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:
a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)
Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?
We look forward to welcoming you!

4274055071,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-analyst-%E2%80%93-remote-first-at-epi-company-4274055071?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=BGbtYGO%2BWMKkUM2PmdT91Q%3D%3D,BI Analyst – Remote-First,EPI Company,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today’s digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever.

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.

Join us as our next Business Intelligence Analyst, bridging Finance and Data to convert raw figures into actionable insights, owning the SQL + Python pipelines in Azure and Databricks that fuel our financial dashboards, billing engines, and senior management insights. You will work closely with finance analysts, business stakeholders, and other technical teams to deliver data-driven insights and make data-informed decisions.

You’ll join a team of 3 talented Data Analytics experts based in the Netherlands, within the Finance department. Each team member brings unique skills and perspectives, fostering a rich learning environment.
SQL, Power BI, Azure Cloud, Python, Databricks
Build & enhance financial reporting: Design new dashboards, reports, and self-service datasets for P&L, cash-flow, and margin analysis
Maintain operational calculations: Own monthly billing, revenue-recognition, and commission-calculation pipelines. Implement automated data-quality checks and reconciliation controls
Data modeling & pipeline engineering: • Develop medallion-architecture tables in Databricks (bronze/silver/gold)
Stakeholder collaboration: Translate finance requirements into technical specs. Train finance analysts on new datasets and BI tools
Continuous improvement & governance: Champion cost-optimization and FinOps best practices in Cloud platforms
Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth
🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements
+3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
Understanding of financial analytics and reporting
🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:
A first call with one of our recruiters
Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
A technical interview with the hiring manager
A final interview with the Chief of Finance
Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse
You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges
🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today’s digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever.

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.


🔎 What's in it for you

Join us as our next Business Intelligence Analyst, bridging Finance and Data to convert raw figures into actionable insights, owning the SQL + Python pipelines in Azure and Databricks that fuel our financial dashboards, billing engines, and senior management insights. You will work closely with finance analysts, business stakeholders, and other technical teams to deliver data-driven insights and make data-informed decisions.

You’ll join a team of 3 talented Data Analytics experts based in the Netherlands, within the Finance department. Each team member brings unique skills and perspectives, fostering a rich learning environment.

  • SQL, Power BI, Azure Cloud, Python, Databricks
