  • Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


    • 🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

    • +3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
    • Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
    • Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
    • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
    • A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
    • Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
    • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

    Nice to have:

    • Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
    • Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
    • Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


    🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

    1. A first call with one of our recruiters
    2. Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
    3. A technical interview with the hiring manager
    4. A final interview with the Chief of Finance
    5. Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse


    ⛔ Turn back if …

    • You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
    • You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges


    Otherwise apply!


    🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

    EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Product Analyst to join their team remotely. This role focuses on supporting product teams with
analytics, reporting, and actionable insights to drive strategic decisions.
• Contract: B2B in Europe or regular employment in the UK/Gibraltar
• Experience with R, Python, or similar for data analysis and manipulation.
• Excellent SQL skills and experience building dashboards in Tableau.
• Effective communicator with the capability to explain technical analyses and insights to nontechnical audiences.

• Actively participate in business initiatives from the product perspective, including evaluating potential business impact, defining data and reporting needs, and developing frameworks to measure success.
• Design and implement reporting solutions in Tableau and other tools to analyze the performance of product features, customer journeys, and behavioral metrics.
• Scope, plan, and perform A/B tests and various analyses, translating results into clear, actionable recommendations for product stakeholders.

• Take ownership of maintaining and enhancing reporting systems and dashboards used by product teams.

A leading company in the online gaming and betting industry is looking for a mid-to-senior level

Product Analyst to join their team remotely. This role focuses on supporting product teams with

analytics, reporting, and actionable insights to drive strategic decisions.


• Contract: B2B in Europe or regular employment in the UK/Gibraltar

• Up to €70,000 / £60,000


Desired experience:

• 5+ years in data roles

• 2+ years in iGaming or sportsbook.

• Experience with R, Python, or similar for data analysis and manipulation.

• Excellent SQL skills and experience building dashboards in Tableau.

• Effective communicator with the capability to explain technical analyses and insights to nontechnical audiences.


Main Responsibilities:

• Actively participate in business initiatives from the product perspective, including evaluating potential business impact, defining data and reporting needs, and developing frameworks to measure success.

• Design and implement reporting solutions in Tableau and other tools to analyze the performance of product features, customer journeys, and behavioral metrics.

• Scope, plan, and perform A/B tests and various analyses, translating results into clear, actionable recommendations for product stakeholders.

• Contribute to the development and deployment of a robust analytics layer for A/B testing processes.

• Take ownership of maintaining and enhancing reporting systems and dashboards used by product teams.

4277629006,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-beyond-data-group-4277629006?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=E5jorF5IvNg0AnXIF2QBrQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Beyond Data Group,"Ixelles, Brussels Region, Belgium","🎯 Vacature – Microsoft Data Consultant
Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken met data?

Bij Beyond Data Group geloven we dat betere beslissingen leiden tot betere bedrijven. Data is voor ons geen einddoel, maar een middel om échte impact te maken. Daarom helpen we organisaties hun data te structureren, te begrijpen én te activeren — van ruwe brondata tot heldere inzichten. Met de juiste combinatie van technologie en mensen maken we data werkbaar, tastbaar en waardevol.
Wil jij graag het volledige dataproces beheren — van A tot Z — en échte meerwaarde creëren?
Je bouwt schaalbare dataplatformen op Azure (Data Lake, SQL DB, Synapse, Fabric).
Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert ETL-pijplijnen met o.a. Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python en SQL.
Je vertaalt businessbehoeften naar werkbare dataproducten.
Je zorgt voor monitoring, data quality en robuuste pipeline-performance.
Je bent vertrouwd met Microsoft-technologieën zoals Power BI, Databricks, Azure Data Factory of Microsoft Fabric.
Je denkt niet in tools, maar in oplossingen.
Je neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid en werkt vlot samen met zowel technische als business stakeholders.
Interesse in AI en hoe dit data-analyse kan versterken? Top — daar denken we graag samen over na.
Projecten van A tot Z — van integratie en modellering tot visualisatie.
Klanten die jou zien als een échte partner.
Een hecht team waarin kennisdeling en samenwerking vanzelfsprekend zijn.
Ruimte om te groeien — technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema’s zoals AI, ....
Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.
Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).
We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen méér zijn dan technische implementaties — ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.
Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst én openstaan voor innovatie.
Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde — voor klant én collega.
📍 Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.
Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?
👉 Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek

🎯 Vacature – Microsoft Data Consultant


Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken met data?


Bij Beyond Data Group geloven we dat betere beslissingen leiden tot betere bedrijven. Data is voor ons geen einddoel, maar een middel om échte impact te maken. Daarom helpen we organisaties hun data te structureren, te begrijpen én te activeren — van ruwe brondata tot heldere inzichten. Met de juiste combinatie van technologie en mensen maken we data werkbaar, tastbaar en waardevol.


Over de Rol

Wil jij graag het volledige dataproces beheren — van A tot Z — en échte meerwaarde creëren?


Wat ga je doen

  • Je bouwt schaalbare dataplatformen op Azure (Data Lake, SQL DB, Synapse, Fabric).
  • Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert ETL-pijplijnen met o.a. Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python en SQL.
  • Je vertaalt businessbehoeften naar werkbare dataproducten.
  • Je zorgt voor monitoring, data quality en robuuste pipeline-performance.

Wat breng jij mee

  • Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in data-projecten.
  • Je bent vertrouwd met Microsoft-technologieën zoals Power BI, Databricks, Azure Data Factory of Microsoft Fabric.
  • Je denkt niet in tools, maar in oplossingen.
  • Je neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid en werkt vlot samen met zowel technische als business stakeholders.
  • Interesse in AI en hoe dit data-analyse kan versterken? Top — daar denken we graag samen over na.

Wat wij bieden

  • Projecten van A tot Z — van integratie en modellering tot visualisatie.
  • Klanten die jou zien als een échte partner.
  • Een hecht team waarin kennisdeling en samenwerking vanzelfsprekend zijn.
  • Ruimte om te groeien — technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
  • Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema’s zoals AI, ....
  • Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.


Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).

We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen méér zijn dan technische implementaties — ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.

Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst én openstaan voor innovatie.

Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde — voor klant én collega.


📍 Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.


Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?

👉 Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek

4258752569,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-alken-maes-4258752569?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wu45pRMYBxdFO7PRGNRNEg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Alken-Maes,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Alken-Maes has a centralized team for Business Intelligence (BI). This team’s primary responsibility is to accelerate insights collection, creation & delivery to internal stakeholders. In this team, Business & Data Analysts work closely together. This allows us to develop fit-for-purpose solutions in a consistent manner.

What started as volume vs. market tracking, has grown into a broader mission: helping our business make better decisions, faster. The goal? Expand our impact and bring data magic to more corners of Alken-Maes, while learning from other HEINEKEN OpCos along the way.
As a Data Analyst, you help shape our ambition to become a truly data-driven company. You’ll start as a key business partner for Sales & Marketing.
Ensure our Power BI reports run smoothly: reliable, clear, fast, and insightful.
Constantly improve our reporting landscape: smarter data sources, better visualizations, sharper insights.
Coach colleagues to explore data on their own, turning dashboards into daily habits.
Use data to support, challenge and inspire our business stakeholders with actionable information and insights about our (commercial) tactics.
Support campaigns and commercial initiatives by uncovering what (doesn’t) work through concrete numbers and clear insights.
Inspire teams with what’s possible: proactively sharing new tools, views, or data sources that could unlock smarter ways of working.
Help translate consumer behavior and commercial performance into actionable plans that grow our brands in Off-Trade (supermarkets) and On-Trade (bars, restaurants, festivals).
2. Maintain existing reporting landscape & run several data-driven projects to deliver actionable insights based on key business questions
Participate in the development of our data-driven learning agenda.
Engage a fruitful and effective collaboration with Global Analytics teams to be on top of Global models’ deployment.
Maintain and improve recurring reporting in Power BI, always looking for ways to make it cleaner, faster, and more relevant.
Work closely with business stakeholders to deeply understand their needs and turn them into dashboards that help them work better.
Turn results of analytics into actionable insights.
Help business users get more confident in using dashboards, tools and insights independently.
You hold a Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, Analytics, Marketing or a related field.
You bring 2–4 years of professional experience, with at least 2 years hands-on in a data analyst or BI-related role.
Visualization Tools : Power BI preferred, others acceptable.
Your experience has taught you how to:
Manage a reporting landscape: ensure quality, work on continuous improvement for recurring reporting, convert business requirements into tangible reports/dashboards.
Connect & collaborate with stakeholders: it’s the responsibility of people that speak ‘data’ to communicate this simply to business stakeholders.
Take ownership of projects: own the delivery of projects.
You’re a bright analytical thinker and problem solver with eye for detail.
You’re a natural communicator: you can explain complex data to non-technical audiences with ease and confidence.
You take ownership of your work: you’re someone who gets things moving and delivers.
You are flexible in changing environments.
You have a good knowledge of English or Dutch.
Most of all: you’re curious, eager to learn and ready to grow… just like us.
Trust, challenge and support from experienced managers and professionals who know how to develop people, teams and take organizations to the next level.
We are the market challenger. This means we are a dynamic, local organization
column2: with the benefits of belonging to the larger, international HEINEKEN family.

column1: Awesome colleagues who enjoy a refreshing Cristal or Desperados 0% after work.
The opportunity to make your mark and take the initiative. (Which, according to our colleagues, is one of the greatest advantages of working at Alken-Maes).
A coaching environment, giving you an extraordinary learning opportunity.
And of course, a competitive package and other nice conditions.

4273308396,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/%F0%9F%94%A5senior-data-analyst%F0%9F%94%A5-power-bi-at-we-source-talent-4273308396?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=B6ORpI7gTZ90AZvivc3tmA%3D%3D,🔥Senior Data Analyst🔥 - Power BI,We Source Talent,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"🔥Senior Data Analyst
A prestigious global consultancy located in Brussels seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a significant engagement..

Senior Data Analyst to analyse data using statistical and analytical techniques, obtain insights, and support data-driven decisions. The role involves developing maintainable data models and implementing data modelling governance with associated processes and procedures. The analyst must possess strong data visualisation and storytelling skills to present findings clearly to clients. Optional experience with Git, CI/CD, unit testing, or data mesh is advantageous.
Analyse complex datasets using statistical and analytical techniques to generate actionable business insights
Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models that are easily understood and utilised by stakeholders
Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to communicate findings effectively to clients and management
Establish and implement data modelling governance frameworks, processes, and procedures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision making across various BI projects
Ensure data quality, integrity, and compliance with organisational standards
Present analytical findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences
3yrs+ experience with MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric Data Warehouse
3yrs+ experience with SQL in the context of data modelling -

A prestigious global consultancy located in Brussels seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a significant engagement..


Role Summary:

Senior Data Analyst to analyse data using statistical and analytical techniques, obtain insights, and support data-driven decisions. The role involves developing maintainable data models and implementing data modelling governance with associated processes and procedures. The analyst must possess strong data visualisation and storytelling skills to present findings clearly to clients. Optional experience with Git, CI/CD, unit testing, or data mesh is advantageous.



Job Description:

  • Analyse complex datasets using statistical and analytical techniques to generate actionable business insights

  • Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to communicate findings effectively to clients and management

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision making across various BI projects
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and compliance with organisational standards
  • Present analytical findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences

  • 3yrs+ experience with MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric Data Warehouse

4258826684,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-qc-at-akkodis-4258826684?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=stg7sV7rpUZNYX3ZXeuZhw%3D%3D,Data analyst QC,Akkodis,"Brabant, Walloon Region, Belgium","About us:

Akkodis is an organization with more than 1,000 engineering, scientific and digital experts in Belgium. Our mission is clear: create a smarter future together! We are a one-stop-shop for engineering, IT, Life Science, and new technologies. Our combined passion for talent and technology allows us to look at the world differently.

With our 360° offer we support companies in all sectors in implementing Smart Industry solutions, from the up and reskilling of entire teams to the delivery of complete projects. Our added value? We make incredible happen!
What do you do all day?

As a Business Analyst, within the 'Lab Data Operations' department, you are in charge of analyzing the risks of data traceability of the testing methods used in the QC department of a global biopharmaceutical company. You work under the supervision of a Project Manager, and you are in daily contact with many players in the QC environment. It's a hybrid position that allows you to combine work at home and on customer site.

You are also an integral part of an Akkodis platform, within our customer teams, which means you'll have daily follow-up and support from people who know your work environment. In addition, you will also be encouraged to propose initiatives to diversify the activities of this platform and improve its functioning. Just as, depending on your availability and level of expertise, you could provide support to other Akkodis platforms.
As Business analyst, you are in charge to:
Understand how data are captured and generated from analytical methods by analyzing the QC department's internal procedures and conducting laboratory observations with operational teams.
Create DPM (Data Process Mapping) of analytical methods to visually represent the data flow.
Identify and list in a DVA (Data Vulnerability Assessment) the GMP/GDP data (raw data and metadata) involved in the method's process.
Assess data vulnerability (based on criticality, technical/procedural controls in place, etc.).
Assess risks to determine the controls to implement (if any are lacking).
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to the project.
Participate to the administrative tasks of the team (complete follow-up files, continuous improvement, etc.) and weekly follow-up meetings.
You have scientific background with knowledge in laboratory analysis technics, like biochemistry, physicochemistry, microbiology and/or cell biology.
You have excellent analytical and synthesis skills to interpret complex data and propose appropriate solutions.
You are familiar with the QC environment of pharmaceutical companies.
You have knowledge of cGMP expectations and, especially, in data integrity.
You have experience or affinity with data management.
You are proficiency in French and English, both written and spoken.
You know how to handle pressure situations, and you could respond resiliently to an emergency event.
You have strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication abilities, team spirit, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multidisciplinary environment.
You are organized, proactive, solution-oriented, open-minded, and flexible.
Which can be seen as a plus:
You are familiar with the use of laboratory softwares and/or equipments.
You master the Microsoft® Office software, and you have already used Microsoft Visio.
You already have experience using SAP and/or Documentum/Veeva.
What’s the offer you can’t refuse?
As an AKKODIS Team member, you will be:
Onboarded in your position via a buddy process and supported in your career by your Business Manager.
Actor of your training plan and your personal and professional development.
Benefit from a full time permanent AKKODIS contract with competitive salary package including several extra-legal benefits.
In a nice work environment & atmosphere within an international group.
Invited to attractive events calendar including afterwork, life sciences meeting, and other professional gatherings.

About us:

Akkodis is an organization with more than 1,000 engineering, scientific and digital experts in Belgium. Our mission is clear: create a smarter future together! We are a one-stop-shop for engineering, IT, Life Science, and new technologies. Our combined passion for talent and technology allows us to look at the world differently.

With our 360° offer we support companies in all sectors in implementing Smart Industry solutions, from the up and reskilling of entire teams to the delivery of complete projects. Our added value? We make incredible happen!


What do you do all day?

As a Business Analyst, within the 'Lab Data Operations' department, you are in charge of analyzing the risks of data traceability of the testing methods used in the QC department of a global biopharmaceutical company. You work under the supervision of a Project Manager, and you are in daily contact with many players in the QC environment. It's a hybrid position that allows you to combine work at home and on customer site.


You are also an integral part of an Akkodis platform, within our customer teams, which means you'll have daily follow-up and support from people who know your work environment. In addition, you will also be encouraged to propose initiatives to diversify the activities of this platform and improve its functioning. Just as, depending on your availability and level of expertise, you could provide support to other Akkodis platforms.



Your responsibilities:

As Business analyst, you are in charge to:

  • Understand how data are captured and generated from analytical methods by analyzing the QC department's internal procedures and conducting laboratory observations with operational teams.
  • Create DPM (Data Process Mapping) of analytical methods to visually represent the data flow.
  • Identify and list in a DVA (Data Vulnerability Assessment) the GMP/GDP data (raw data and metadata) involved in the method's process.
  • Assess data vulnerability (based on criticality, technical/procedural controls in place, etc.).
  • Assess risks to determine the controls to implement (if any are lacking).
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to the project.
  • Participate to the administrative tasks of the team (complete follow-up files, continuous improvement, etc.) and weekly follow-up meetings.



Your profile:

  • You have scientific background with knowledge in laboratory analysis technics, like biochemistry, physicochemistry, microbiology and/or cell biology.
  • You have excellent analytical and synthesis skills to interpret complex data and propose appropriate solutions.
  • You are familiar with the QC environment of pharmaceutical companies.
  • You have knowledge of cGMP expectations and, especially, in data integrity.
  • You have experience or affinity with data management.
  • You are proficiency in French and English, both written and spoken.
  • You know how to handle pressure situations, and you could respond resiliently to an emergency event.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication abilities, team spirit, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multidisciplinary environment.
  • You are organized, proactive, solution-oriented, open-minded, and flexible.
  • Which can be seen as a plus:
  • You are familiar with the use of laboratory softwares and/or equipments.
  • You master the Microsoft® Office software, and you have already used Microsoft Visio.
  • You already have experience using SAP and/or Documentum/Veeva.



What’s the offer you can’t refuse?

As an AKKODIS Team member, you will be:

  • Onboarded in your position via a buddy process and supported in your career by your Business Manager.
  • Actor of your training plan and your personal and professional development.
  • Benefit from a full time permanent AKKODIS contract with competitive salary package including several extra-legal benefits.
  • In a nice work environment &
column2:
atmosphere within an international group.
  • Invited to attractive events calendar including afterwork, life sciences meeting, and other professional gatherings.

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.
Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery
Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English
A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

4275328400,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-consultant-at-sia-4275328400?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=IHXaaQnNO6aMyLYNPBFOJw%3D%3D,Data Analytics Consultant,Sia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity.

With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.

As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.
You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.
Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.
Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.
Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.
Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.
Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.
Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.
Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).
Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.
A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.
Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.
Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.
Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.
Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.
Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.
Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.
Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.
Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.
Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.
Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.

Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.

We are seeking a dedicated and talented Senior Data Analyst who possesses a robust analytical mindset and strong technical expertise. This role is perfect for those who excel at translating complex data into significant, actionable insights that facilitate data-driven decision-making.
You analyze large datasets using statistical and analytical techniques to extract actionable insights.
You design and maintain scalable, understandable, and reusable data models.
You create and present dashboards and reports using visualization tools.
You apply data storytelling techniques to clearly communicate key findings to stakeholders.
You define governance structures and standard procedures related to data modeling.

You are skilled in SQL for data modeling purposes.
You understand data modeling governance, including process and procedure definition.
You are able to present data in a clear, engaging, and business-oriented manner.

Join a thriving team where your analytical skills will be pivotal in transforming data into strategic insights within a fast-paced, intelligence-driven environment.

We are seeking a dedicated and talented Senior Data Analyst who possesses a robust analytical mindset and strong technical expertise. This role is perfect for those who excel at translating complex data into significant, actionable insights that facilitate data-driven decision-making.

  • You analyze large datasets using statistical and analytical techniques to extract actionable insights.
  • You design and maintain scalable, understandable, and reusable data models.
  • You create and present dashboards and reports using visualization tools.
  • You apply data storytelling techniques to clearly communicate key findings to stakeholders.
  • You define governance structures and standard procedures related to data modeling.


What are we looking for?

  • You have between 5 to 10 years of experience in data analysis.
  • You are proficient with Power BI (or equivalent data visualization tools).
  • You possess experience with MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric Data Warehousing.
  • You are skilled in SQL for data modeling purposes.
  • You understand data modeling governance, including process and procedure definition.
  • You are able to present data in a clear, engaging, and business-oriented manner.
  • You are proficient in English.

Avertim is a uniquely positioned Management Consulting Group that bridges the gap between Strategy and Operations. Our mission is to translate the strategy of our clients into actionable projects and enable the alignment between Business, Technology and Management.

Founded in 2007, and headquartered on Brussels’ famous Louise Avenue, Avertim has grown into a European consultancy group with more than 350 consultants and offices in Belgium, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.

To accelerate the growth of our consulting activities in the Belgian market, we are currently looking for Senior Consultants able to support the development of Avertim’s consulting activities in the Energy & Transport sector.

We take pride in holding the EcoVadis Platinium certification, a testament to our commitment to sustainable and ethical business practices. This commitment extends to every individual within our organization, and we encourage all our stakeholders to contribute to our collective efforts behind our 3 causes: health, education and environment
Besides our vibrant work environment, we offer a competitive compensation package including:
20 + 9 days of paid holidays + possibility to buy 5 additional days via the cafetarian plan
Company car or green mobility package
Full hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package
Have a look at our Life Page to get to know us more!

At Avertim, we value talent and mindset. No difference will be made during the recruitment process and applicants will receive consideration for employment whatever their gender, marital status, religion, age, color, sexual orientation, nationality or disability, …
For more information, visit Avertim's official website.

Being an Avertimer means that you will act as a trusted partner to help our customers successfully achieve their transformation programs.


How? By translating their strategy into actionable projects and enable Business, Technology and Management alignment through Avertim’s three key service lines: increase performance, drive innovation and leverage compliance.



Your Job


As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support one of our major clients in the context of various Business Intelligence initiatives. Your role will be to:

  • Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques to generate insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Design and maintain sustainable, understandable, and usable data models.
  • Present insights clearly through data visualization and storytelling techniques.
  • Set up data modeling governance, including related processes and procedures.


As an Avertimer, you will get the opportunity to:


  • Develop yourself in a place where individuals and ideas matter.
  • Engage in a career path providing you with the ability to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.
  • Immerse yourself into a vibrant, fast-growing team and nurturing work environment.
  • Be part of an experienced international community of Avertimers and enjoy a network of cross-industry expertise.
  • Keep on learning from your peers and develop your skills.


Your Background


  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and translate business needs into functional requirements.
  • You have proven experience in functional analysis, requirements gathering, process modeling, or solution design.
  • You are comfortable acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams.
  • You are structured, detail-oriented, and focused on delivering value.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in a similar role, either in consulting or within an organization.
  • Power BI or equivalent visualization tools
  • MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric DWH
  • SQL for data modeling purposes
  • Governance and process setup for data modeling


Nice to Have


  • You are familiar with modeling and documentation tools (UML, BPMN, Visio, Sparx, ARIS…).
  • You have knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince2, PMI…) and related tools (Jira, Confluence, Bizagi…).
  • You have an interest in or experience with the energy, transport, or public services sectors.
  • You are passionate about digital transformation, process optimization, and business innovation.



About us


Avertim is a uniquely positioned Management Consulting Group that bridges the gap between Strategy and Operations. Our mission is to translate the strategy of our clients into actionable projects and enable the alignment between Business, Technology and Management.


Founded in 2007, and headquartered on Brussels’ famous Louise Avenue, Avertim has grown into a European consultancy group with more than 350 consultants and offices in Belgium, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.


To accelerate the growth of our consulting activities in the Belgian market, we are currently looking for Senior Consultants able to support the development of Avertim’s consulting activities in the Energy &

We take pride in holding the EcoVadis Platinium certification, a testament to our commitment to sustainable and ethical business practices. This commitment extends to every individual within our organization, and we encourage all our stakeholders to contribute to our collective efforts behind our 3 causes: health, education and environment

Wij zoeken een ervaren Data Analist voor een uitdagende opdracht binnen een organisatie met een sterke maatschappelijke impact. Het team waarin je terechtkomt is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van rapporten en dashboards waarmee het management en diverse teams inzichten verkrijgen om prestaties te monitoren en problemen vroegtijdig te signaleren. Daarnaast lever je data aan voor strategische beslissingen en ondersteun je AI-initiatieven door relevante datasets beschikbaar te stellen.
Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van interactieve dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van complexe datasets om trends en inzichten te ontdekken.
Aanspreekpunt zijn voor de business binnen een functioneel domein.
Coördineren van werkzaamheden binnen een team van ±5 personen.
Vertalen van business requirements naar technische analyses en documentatie.
Ondersteunen van strategische besluitvorming door middel van datagedreven advies.
Samenwerken met agile teams en bijdragen aan sprintplanning, story refinement en backlogbeheer.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Sterke kennis van SQL (zelfstandig queries schrijven).
Ervaring met het opstellen van dashboards en rapportages (bijvoorbeeld met MicroStrategy, OBI of vergelijkbare BI-tools).
Begrip van data-analyse-architecturen (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systemen).
Ervaring met data modelleren (3NF, data vault, dimensioneel).
Kennis van Agile en Scrum (story point estimatie, backlog, refinement).
Analytisch sterk, probleemoplossend vermogen en goede communicatieskills.
Vloeiend in Nederlands, met een goede beheersing van Engels.
Ervaring met unstructured data en grote datavolumes.
Kennis van data virtualisatietools en event-driven architectuur.
Ervaring met SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka en Apache NiFi.
Kennis van ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.
Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een agile team.
Inzicht in trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse.
Kennis van de arbeidsmarktcontext is een troef.
Ervaring in een adviserende rol naar management en stakeholders.
Hands-on ervaring met AI-initiatieven en data-ondersteuning.
Een langdurig freelance project met maatschappelijke impact.
Samenwerking met een professioneel, multidisciplinair team.
Een omgeving waarin innovatie en data centraal staan.
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (deels onsite, deels remote).
Stuur je CV en een korte motivatie. We nemen snel contact met je op.

Vacature: Data Analist (Freelance)


Wij zoeken een ervaren Data Analist voor een uitdagende opdracht binnen een organisatie met een sterke maatschappelijke impact. Het team waarin je terechtkomt is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van rapporten en dashboards waarmee het management en diverse teams inzichten verkrijgen om prestaties te monitoren en problemen vroegtijdig te signaleren. Daarnaast lever je data aan voor strategische beslissingen en ondersteun je AI-initiatieven door relevante datasets beschikbaar te stellen.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

  • Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van interactieve dashboards en rapportages.
  • Analyseren van complexe datasets om trends en inzichten te ontdekken.
  • Aanspreekpunt zijn voor de business binnen een functioneel domein.
  • Coördineren van werkzaamheden binnen een team van ±5 personen.
  • Vertalen van business requirements naar technische analyses en documentatie.
  • Ondersteunen van strategische besluitvorming door middel van datagedreven advies.
  • Samenwerken met agile teams en bijdragen aan sprintplanning, story refinement en backlogbeheer.


Gevraagd profiel


Essentieel:

  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.
  • Sterke kennis van SQL (zelfstandig queries schrijven).
  • Ervaring met het opstellen van dashboards en rapportages (bijvoorbeeld met MicroStrategy, OBI of vergelijkbare BI-tools).
  • Begrip van data-analyse-architecturen (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systemen).
  • Ervaring met data modelleren (3NF, data vault, dimensioneel).
  • Kennis van Agile en Scrum (story point estimatie, backlog, refinement).
  • Ervaring met Jira en Confluence.
  • Analytisch sterk, probleemoplossend vermogen en goede communicatieskills.
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands, met een goede beheersing van Engels.


Gewenst:

  • Ervaring met unstructured data en grote datavolumes.
  • Kennis van data virtualisatietools en event-driven architectuur.
  • Basiskennis van Python (code kunnen lezen).
  • Ervaring met SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka en Apache NiFi.
  • Kennis van ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.
  • Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een agile team.
  • Inzicht in trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse.


Pluspunten:

  • Kennis van de arbeidsmarktcontext is een troef.
  • Ervaring in een adviserende rol naar management en stakeholders.
  • Hands-on ervaring met AI-initiatieven en data-ondersteuning.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een langdurig freelance project met maatschappelijke impact.
  • Samenwerking met een professioneel, multidisciplinair team.
  • Een omgeving waarin innovatie en data centraal staan.
  • Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (deels onsite, deels remote).


Interesse?

Stuur je CV en een korte motivatie. We nemen snel contact met je op.

Nous sommes le premier industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)

Une entreprise reconnue ""Great Place To Work""
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales
Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.
Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur ""Diversité"" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.
Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
En Tant Que Data Analyst Vous Maitrisez
Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst.

4246250662,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-senior-h-f-at-extia-4246250662?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=HGLT%2FFEqqC%2FbndkYzMWHNg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Senior (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou master, vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou master, vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:
Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature

4261416278,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4261416278?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3WBiRMxcPEP8ed%2BJXxeGbA%3D%3D,Remote: Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,Belgium,"Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident in Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

You may also confirm your interest and send your CV directly via email to mailyn.esguerra@telusdigital.com with the subject line: Application for [Job Title] – LinkedIn, to ensure your application is promptly received and reviewed.

4263210720,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-quality-analyst-at-laco-4263210720?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=rgVSBCG5ZO%2FsPItd38Q%2F8w%3D%3D,Data Quality Analyst,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.
As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll support our clients with their data quality needs:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!


Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll support our clients with their data quality needs:


  • Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
  • Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
  • Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
  • Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
  • Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
  • Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS


  • You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
  • You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
  • You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
  • You have proven experience with data quality projects.
  • You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
  • You know all about the SQL.
  • You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER


  • Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
  • We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
  • Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


ABOUT US


So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.


Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

4271293003,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-mobile-games-at-skillsearch-4271293003?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=v6hRKqwq7YK%2BuqRnEdWbCw%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Mobile Games),Skillsearch,European Union,"Data Analyst mid level – Games (Marketing & UA Focus)

We're looking for a data analyst to join a mobile games publisher and developer. This will be the first data hire on the team and you'll be driving analytics across the marketing and user acquisition efforts. This is a hands-on, individual contributor role within a growing mobile games studio - ideal for someone eager to build the analytics function from the ground up.
Own reporting, dashboarding, and performance tracking for UA and marketing
Analyze mobile game metrics and player behaviour
Set up tracking and attribution systems
Deliver clear, actionable insights to support UA and creative testing strategy
Work closely with UA and product teams
Strong experience with Google Analytics, Excel/Sheets, and ideally BI tools
Comfortable working independently and taking initiative
Understanding of mobile gaming metrics and player funnels
No management duties – this is a full individual contributor role

column2: but also flexible for Europe-based candidates (with 1–2 days/month travel)

column1: This will be a contract role for anyone based outside of Saudi Arabia

column2:
UA Focus)


About the Role:

We're looking for a data analyst to join a mobile games publisher and developer. This will be the first data hire on the team and you'll be driving analytics across the marketing and user acquisition efforts. This is a hands-on, individual contributor role within a growing mobile games studio - ideal for someone eager to build the analytics function from the ground up.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Own reporting, dashboarding, and performance tracking for UA and marketing
  • Analyze mobile game metrics and player behaviour
  • Set up tracking and attribution systems
  • Deliver clear, actionable insights to support UA and creative testing strategy
  • Work closely with UA and product teams


What You’ll Need:

  • Strong experience with Google Analytics, Excel/Sheets, and ideally BI tools
  • Comfortable working independently and taking initiative
  • Understanding of mobile gaming metrics and player funnels
  • No management duties – this is a full individual contributor role


Working Setup:

  • Hybrid: KSA preferred (2x/month in-person)
column3:
but also flexible for Europe-based candidates (with 1–2 days/month travel)
  • This will be a contract role for anyone based outside of Saudi Arabia

We’re looking for a hands-on Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling eCommerce team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.

If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that’s hungry for your expertise.

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.
This is a full-time, contractor role.
Architect the company’s entire BI stack and define best practices from day one

Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team
Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch - no legacy systems to fight against
Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance

Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data
Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms
Analytical & Strategic: You connect the dots across funnel stages, ROI metrics, and ad performance to guide decision-making
Self-Starter: Comfortable working independently and building systems from the ground up in a fast-paced environment

Tech Interview: Deep dive into your technical abilities and past experience

Final Chat: We’ll align expectations, goals, and finalize the next steps

Tired of inheriting someone else’s messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way?


We’re looking for a hands-on Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling eCommerce team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.


If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that’s hungry for your expertise.


YOUR MISSION

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.

This is a full-time, contractor role.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

  • Architect the company’s entire BI stack and define best practices from day one
  • Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, and more
  • Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth
  • Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

  • Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch - no legacy systems to fight against
  • Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance
  • Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights
  • Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions
  • Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance
  • Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders
  • Work cross-functionally with teams across marketing, tech, and leadership to improve data visibility and measurement


WHO YOU ARE

  • Experience: 3+ years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles with exposure to data infrastructure and performance reporting
  • Builder Mentality: You’ve worked in (or thrive in) low-data-maturity environments and know how to get results without perfect tools
  • Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data
  • Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms
  • Analytical &

  • Software Background: Bonus if you have a foundation in software engineering to collaborate more effectively with developers

4273214543,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-consultant-at-harvey-nash-4273214543?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Z0J9Y3Y699I0e%2B%2FzmS%2BWWA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Consultant,Harvey Nash,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","BI Consultant - KPI Dashboard Designer – Operational Planning
For our client, a leading engineering consultancy specialized in railway infrastructure and mobility projects, we are currently seeking a KPI dashboard designer
📍 Location: Brussels (with occasional travel within Belgium)
🕒 Work setup: Hybrid (On-site presence required for meetings as needed)

We are looking for a KPI Dashboard Designer to support our Operational Planning department on a temporary basis. In this role, you will play a key part in designing, developing, and improving data-driven dashboards and reports to support strategic decision-making.

Our team is responsible for coordinating planned disruptions on the railway network to enable infrastructure works, and for long-term planning of rolling stock with limited availability. You will work closely with an internal subject matter expert who will support you with business context and content.
Design, develop, and improve dashboards and reports for the Operational Planning department
Map key business processes to define accurate performance measurement points (KPIs)
Define and implement KPIs aligned with the department's strategic goals
Identify and consolidate existing relevant reports across the company
Translate stakeholder needs into impactful visualizations and data analyses
Act as project lead and report directly to the department manager
Deliver a complete, structured, and tailored KPI dashboard/reporting solution by the end of the mission
Strong knowledge of Power BI and relevant MS Office applications
Experience with data modeling and building analytics frameworks
Programming skills (e.g., Python) for extracting data from databases
Ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders
Strong team spirit and communication skills
Critical thinking and a structured, solution-oriented work style
Flexibility to navigate a multi-stakeholder environment
Fluent FR or NL with a good understanding of the other national language

BI Consultant - KPI Dashboard Designer – Operational Planning


For our client, a leading engineering consultancy specialized in railway infrastructure and mobility projects, we are currently seeking a KPI dashboard designer


📍 Location: Brussels (with occasional travel within Belgium)

🕒 Work setup: Hybrid (On-site presence required for meetings as needed)


We are looking for a KPI Dashboard Designer to support our Operational Planning department on a temporary basis. In this role, you will play a key part in designing, developing, and improving data-driven dashboards and reports to support strategic decision-making.


🧩 About the Department

Our team is responsible for coordinating planned disruptions on the railway network to enable infrastructure works, and for long-term planning of rolling stock with limited availability. You will work closely with an internal subject matter expert who will support you with business context and content.


🎯 Your Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and improve dashboards and reports for the Operational Planning department
  • Map key business processes to define accurate performance measurement points (KPIs)
  • Define and implement KPIs aligned with the department's strategic goals
  • Identify and consolidate existing relevant reports across the company
  • Translate stakeholder needs into impactful visualizations and data analyses
  • Act as project lead and report directly to the department manager
  • Deliver a complete, structured, and tailored KPI dashboard/reporting solution by the end of the mission

🛠️ Technical Skills Required

  • Strong knowledge of Power BI and relevant MS Office applications
  • Experience with data modeling and building analytics frameworks
  • Programming skills (e.g., Python) for extracting data from databases
  • Ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders

🤝 Soft Skills

  • Strong team spirit and communication skills
  • Critical thinking and a structured, solution-oriented work style
  • Flexibility to navigate a multi-stakeholder environment
  • Fluent FR or NL with a good understanding of the other national language

4277633885,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/microsoft-data-analyst-at-beyond-data-group-4277633885?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=iT4BwP9%2B4athWL2kbygAFA%3D%3D,Microsoft Data Analyst,Beyond Data Group,"Ixelles, Brussels Region, Belgium","🎯 Vacature – Microsoft Data Consultant
Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken met data?

Bij Beyond Data Group geloven we dat betere beslissingen leiden tot betere bedrijven. Data is voor ons geen einddoel, maar een middel om échte impact te maken. Daarom helpen we organisaties hun data te structureren, te begrijpen én te activeren — van ruwe brondata tot heldere inzichten. Met de juiste combinatie van technologie en mensen maken we data werkbaar, tastbaar en waardevol.
Wil jij graag het volledige dataproces beheren — van A tot Z — en échte meerwaarde creëren?
Je bouwt schaalbare dataplatformen op Azure (Data Lake, SQL DB, Synapse, Fabric).
Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert ETL-pijplijnen met o.a. Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python en SQL.
Je vertaalt businessbehoeften naar werkbare dataproducten.
Je zorgt voor monitoring, data quality en robuuste pipeline-performance.
Je bent vertrouwd met Microsoft-technologieën zoals Power BI, Databricks, Azure Data Factory of Microsoft Fabric.
Je denkt niet in tools, maar in oplossingen.
Je neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid en werkt vlot samen met zowel technische als business stakeholders.
Interesse in AI en hoe dit data-analyse kan versterken? Top — daar denken we graag samen over na.
Projecten van A tot Z — van integratie en modellering tot visualisatie.
Klanten die jou zien als een échte partner.
Een hecht team waarin kennisdeling en samenwerking vanzelfsprekend zijn.
Ruimte om te groeien — technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema’s zoals AI, ....
Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.
Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).
We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen méér zijn dan technische implementaties — ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.
Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst én openstaan voor innovatie.
Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde — voor klant én collega.
📍 Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.
Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?
👉 Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek
