Digital Content Consultant,CCS Technologies IT (P) Ltd.,"Kottayam, Kerala, India","About CCS

CCS Technologies has decades of experience delivering technology-driven solutions for their customers. Based out of Kerala, India and with offices in the US and Middle East, we are on a growth path like never before. Working alongside a close-knit team with tremendous exposure to various technologies, this is a place where you will have plenty of opportunities to learn, contribute, and grow!
What you can expect from the job

As a Trainee Digital Content Consultant, you will be under the guidance of our Lead Consultant and have the chance to enhance your skills in creating compelling product catalogs. This position is ideal for individuals with a keen eye for detail and a passion for crafting engaging product descriptions, who are eager to specialize in the field of catalog writing. Review data and information provided in the content as per the guidelines

Strong knowledge in language vocabulary and grammar
Basic skills in Adobe Photoshop and InDesign
Basic skills in SEO for websites
Knowledge of ISMS principles and best practices

Founded in 2017, Vismaya Consulting & Management Services (VCMS) is dedicated to supporting individuals and industries in the fields of Quality Health, Safety, and Environment. The company has successfully completed various consultancy projects, IOSH and IA batches, and HSE and warehouse audits. VCMS remains committed to delivering high-quality solutions to enhance safety and environmental standards in various industries.

This full-time on-site role, across Kerala, Chennai, and Bengaluru. This role will also involve conducting market research, preparing presentations, and negotiating contracts with potential clients.
Strong Business Development, Sales, and Account Management skills
Experience in client relationship management and customer service
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
Market research and strategic planning abilities
Knowledge of Quality Health, Safety, and Environment standards is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field
Ability to work independently and effectively within a team
Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets

Business Developer – Solar EPC (Alappuzha)


Company Name: Golden Ray

Location: Alappuzha, Kerala

Experience: 1 to 2 Years OR Ex-founders / Self-employed professionals

Salary: ₹1,80,000 – ₹4,50,000 per annum + Commissions + ESOPs (Performance-based)

Industry Type: Renewable Energy / Solar EPC

Functional Area: Sales, Business Development

Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent

Education:

Open to All Educational Backgrounds

(No specific degree required – candidates with interpersonal or sales skills are encouraged to apply)


Job Description


Golden Ray is a trusted Solar EPC company with 7+ years of experience delivering high-quality rooftop solar systems across Kerala. We're looking for driven Business Developers to take full ownership of the Alappuzha market.


This role is ideal for:

  • Candidates with 1–2 years of sales experience OR
  • Ex-founders/freelancers who want to scale with a mission-driven brand.


Key Responsibilities


  • Own the Alappuzha territory and drive customer acquisition.
  • Generate leads through local networking, WhatsApp outreach, field visits, and referrals.
  • Meet homeowners, explain solar benefits, and close deals.
  • Use CRMs and mobile tools to manage follow-ups and smart selling.
  • Coordinate with the internal Customer Relationship team for proposal tracking and documentation.
  • Provide regular feedback and market insights to improve our go-to-market approach.


Candidate Profile


  • 1–2 years of experience in field sales (solar, real estate, insurance, appliances, or services)
  • OR
  • Prior experience as a founder, freelancer, or self-employed seller
  • Excellent interpersonal and persuasion skills
  • Able to communicate clearly in Malayalam (mandatory)
column2:
English is a plus
  • Comfortable using WhatsApp, mobile apps, and CRM tools
  • Motivated, independent, and passionate about making a difference
  • Willing to travel locally and take full ownership of territory performance


    • Perks and Benefits


    • Salary: ₹1.8 to ₹4.5 LPA + commissions
    • ESOP opportunity for top performers
    • Growth to Team Lead / Territory Manager roles
    • AI-enabled sales training and digital tools
    • Work with a purpose-led team creating real impact across Kerala


    Career Growth Path


    • Area Sales Manager
    • Territory Lead
    • Regional Expansion Head
    • Channel Development Manager


    How to Apply

    Send your resume here or career@goldenray.co.in

    Shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 working days.

Indian Institute of Information Technology, Kottayam (IIITK) is an Institution of National Importance under Ministry of Education, Government of India and is located in Valavoor, Palai, in the Kottayam District of Kerala.

This is a full-time, on-site role for a Postdoctoral Researcher focused on UAV security. The role is based in Kottayam. The Postdoctoral Researcher will be responsible for conducting advanced research in the area of UAV security, performing data analysis, and contributing to publications. The role also involves laboratory work, teaching, and mentoring students.
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or a closely related field, with a research focus on UAV Security, Cybersecurity, or related domains.
Demonstrated proficiency in laboratory skills, experimental design, and prototyping for UAV or wireless systems.
Strong foundation in Cryptography and secure communication protocols.
Proven research experience with publications in reputed journals and conferences.
Prior teaching or mentoring experience at the undergraduate or postgraduate level.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly present research findings.
Strong independent research capabilities and the ability to collaborate effectively within a multidisciplinary team.

🌶️ Position: Spices Manager cum Quality Control Head
🎓 Qualification: M.Sc./B.Sc. Chemistry or Food Science
📅 Experience: 3+ years in the spices industry (LCMS/GCMS, Shimadzu preferred)

Be the guardian of spice quality at a fast-growing, 100% export-focused food facility. Work with world-class machines, global certifications, and a passionate team making Indian spices shine worldwide!
Handle Shimadzu LCMS & GCMS for deep testing of oils, residues, aflatoxins.
Release COAs with pride – your results ship worldwide!
Master SOPs, sampling, and new method validations.
Maintain FSSAI, EU, ISO, HACCP, and traceability standards.
Inspect spices like turmeric, cumin, and pepper at every stage.
Test aroma, color, oils, microbes—your senses + science!
Guide the process team on quality magic.
Work with R&D to craft spice blends, extracts, and oils.
Suggest smarter shelf life, tastier blends, better tech.
Lead lab and QA staff with energy.
Train them. Grow them. Celebrate wins.
Own quality dashboards, NC reports, supplier issues.
Be the voice of quality in meetings.
Active compounds: Cinnamaldehyde, Sabinene, Zingiberene, Curcuminoids
Passion for clean labels, traceability, and food safety
From Manager to Quality Head – own your growth in an international facility exporting to global leaders in the food & wellness space.

Mathew & Jacob, Chartered Accountants is a prominent provider of Accounting & Assurance services. We offer a comprehensive range of financial services tailored to meet various client needs. For more information about our services, please visit our website at www.mathewandjacob.org. Stay connected with us through our Facebook and Instagram pages for updates and contact information.

This is a full-time, on-site role for an Articled Assistant located in Adoor. The Articled Assistant will perform a range of accounting and auditing tasks including preparing financial statements, conducting audits, and assisting in tax planning. Responsibilities also include maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring compliance with various regulations, and providing support for client financial queries.
Knowledge of Accounting Principles and Financial Reporting
Skills in Auditing and Assurance Services
Proficient/Interest in learning about Tax Planning and Compliance
Ability to work independently and as a part of a team
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Qualified the CA Intermediate Examinations (Both Group)
Experience in using accounting software is a plus
As part of your articleship training, you will gain comprehensive practical exposure in the following core areas:
* Preparation of financial statements as per Schedule III
* Handling depreciation and fixed asset registers
* Statutory audits of companies, firms, and trusts
* Bank audits (Statutory, Concurrent, Stock & Revenue Audits)
* Income Tax Return filing and planning
* MCA filings – AOC-4, MGT-7, MGT-14, DIR-3 KYC
* Practical training in Zoho Books, Tally Prime, and other ERP tools
* Exposure to cloud-based accounting and compliance systems
* Document management using Google Workspace and Zoho Suite
* Business process automation & virtual CFO support
* Exam support and study leave in line with ICAI norms
* Eagerness to learn and take ownership
* Willingness to travel locally for audit assignments

4275614222,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-audit-manager-change-delivery-malaysia-india-at-acca-careers-4275614222?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=dD7qGL97pzo%2B2lur%2FWW18Q%3D%3D&trackingId=BfNNtv6vKwXMB9SGlojr%2Bw%3D%3D,Senior Audit Manager - Change Delivery (Malaysia/India),ACCA Careers,"Cherthala, Kerala, India","Job Summary
Failure to effectively manage Change may lead to adverse client outcomes, breaches of regulatory requirements that could attract regulatory scrutiny, and/or damage the Group’s reputation.

Group Internal Audit (GIA) in Standard Chartered Bank is looking for an exceptional and dynamic Senior Audit Manager to join our Change Transformation Group Internal Audit (GIA) team within the Technology and Operations portfolio.

This global role includes executing audits across Ways of Working (WOW), project lifecycle, Classic and Agile delivery, project governance, reporting and monitoring, scheduling, resource management and financial management.

This role will get to work on more complex audits such as cross-functional and multi-location high risk audits and will also provide you the opportunities to interact and engage with both Group and Country Stakeholders
Maintain an awareness of the Group's business strategy and model, and an understanding of the Group’s Transformation priorities.
Perform, support, or lead where directed, the planning, fieldwork, and reporting of internal audit engagements to deliver agreed assurance objectives to established GIA standards and timelines.
Deliver quality audit reports that are effectively written with practical, actionable, measurable and value-added recommendations.
Share knowledge, skills and experience with team members and the wider GIA and provide advisory to internal auditors from both Business and Technology on Change Management.

Assist in standardisation and documentation of processes, risks, and controls and work with internal stakeholders to build a comprehensive and simple test procedures for Change Management. Liaise with Change Management standard owners where required.
Assist to track and consolidate all Change related audit issues raised by GIA, Regulators or Monitors and provide periodic updates to internal GIA Management and senior risk committees of the Bank.
Apply an in-depth understanding of, and compliance with, GIA methodology standards and the GIA system in all areas of assigned GIA activity.
Evaluate quantitative and qualitative data (using data analytics) to diagnose underlying issues, patterns and root causes.
Monitor and track assigned audit issues and action plans, and report overdue items to the Head of Audit (HOA) for resolution.
Execute audits in-line with the Group Internal Audit methodology.
Build good working relationships with the business audit teams to facilitate execution of integrated audit work.
Complete relevant risk assessment activities in a timely and effective manner, including the completion of Risk Assessment template.
Assist in continuous auditing and monitoring of key risks in Change Management.
Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group's arrangements to deliver effective Transformation governance, oversight, and controls.
Strong background in audit (with a focus on Change delivery and Agile concepts) with a minimum of 7 years of experience preferably in the Banking and Financial services industry.
Knowledge and experience in Change Management (e.g. Project Management Planning, Agile Practitioner) is required.
Attention to detail and curiosity. Strong analytical skills and eager to learn.
Excellent writing and articulation skills to succinctly communicate complicated technical issues in business terms.
Strong interpersonal skills for building and maintaining credibly effective working relationships with counterparts in Group Internal Audit and business stakeholders.
High degree of responsibility, self-motivated, requiring minimal supervision.
Ability to collect and objectively analyse and apply information, “thinking out of the box” where necessary, in supporting the planning, fieldwork or reporting of results of audit engagements.
Displays initiative and knows when and how to seek guidance. Willingness and capacity to learn on the job.
Bachelor's or university degree in any related discipline.
Professional Audit Certification (CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP etc.) and experience in executing a risk-based Audit Methodology, or a similar methodological approach.
Professional Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, Agile Scrum Master, PMI-ACP) in Change Management preferred.
Business proficiency in English (Verbal and Written)

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.

Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.

Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills,global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.

Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.
Candidates must be resident in Malaysia, or have the right to work in Malaysia.

Job Summary

Failure to effectively manage Change may lead to adverse client outcomes, breaches of regulatory requirements that could attract regulatory scrutiny, and/or damage the Group’s reputation.

  • Group Internal Audit (GIA) in Standard Chartered Bank is looking for an exceptional and dynamic Senior Audit Manager to join our Change Transformation Group Internal Audit (GIA) team within the Technology and Operations portfolio.
  • This global role includes executing audits across Ways of Working (WOW), project lifecycle, Classic and Agile delivery, project governance, reporting and monitoring, scheduling, resource management and financial management.
  • This role will get to work on more complex audits such as cross-functional and multi-location high risk audits and will also provide you the opportunities to interact and engage with both Group and Country Stakeholders

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain an awareness of the Group's business strategy and model, and an understanding of the Group’s Transformation priorities.
  • Perform, support, or lead where directed, the planning, fieldwork, and reporting of internal audit engagements to deliver agreed assurance objectives to established GIA standards and timelines.
  • Deliver quality audit reports that are effectively written with practical, actionable, measurable and value-added recommendations.
  • Share knowledge, skills and experience with team members and the wider GIA and provide advisory to internal auditors from both Business and Technology on Change Management.
  • Assist in standardisation and documentation of processes, risks, and controls and work with internal stakeholders to build a comprehensive and simple test procedures for Change Management. Liaise with Change Management standard owners where required.
  • Assist to track and consolidate all Change related audit issues raised by GIA, Regulators or Monitors and provide periodic updates to internal GIA Management and senior risk committees of the Bank.
  • Apply an in-depth understanding of, and compliance with, GIA methodology standards and the GIA system in all areas of assigned GIA activity.
  • Evaluate quantitative and qualitative data (using data analytics) to diagnose underlying issues, patterns and root causes.
  • Monitor and track assigned audit issues and action plans, and report overdue items to the Head of Audit (HOA) for resolution.
  • Execute audits in-line with the Group Internal Audit methodology.
  • Build good working relationships with the business audit teams to facilitate execution of integrated audit work.
  • Complete relevant risk assessment activities in a timely and effective manner, including the completion of Risk Assessment template.
  • Assist in continuous auditing and monitoring of key risks in Change Management.
  • Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group's arrangements to deliver effective Transformation governance, oversight, and controls.

Skills and Experience

  • Strong background in audit (with a focus on Change delivery and Agile concepts) with a minimum of 7 years of experience preferably in the Banking and Financial services industry.
  • Knowledge and experience in Change Management (e.g. Project Management Planning, Agile Practitioner) is required.
  • Attention to detail and curiosity. Strong analytical skills and eager to learn.
  • Excellent writing and articulation skills to succinctly communicate complicated technical issues in business terms.
  • Strong interpersonal skills for building and maintaining credibly effective working relationships with counterparts in Group Internal Audit and business stakeholders.
  • High degree of responsibility, self-motivated, requiring minimal supervision.
  • Ability to collect and objectively analyse and apply information, “thinking out of the box” where necessary, in supporting the planning, fieldwork or reporting of results of audit engagements.
  • Displays initiative and knows when and how to seek guidance. Willingness and capacity to learn on the job.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or university degree in any related discipline.
  • Professional Audit Certification (CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP etc.) and experience in executing a risk-based Audit Methodology, or a similar methodological approach.
  • Professional Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, Agile Scrum Master, PMI-ACP) in Change Management preferred.
  • Business proficiency in English (Verbal and Written)

About Standard Chartered

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.

Together We

  • Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
  • Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
  • Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

What we offer

In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.

  • Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
  • Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
  • Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
  • Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills,global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
  • A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
  • Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

Recruitment Assessments

Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

Candidates must be resident in Malaysia, or have the right to work in Malaysia.

Data Analyst (Contract-to-Hire)


Location: Zurich (On-site)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 3 months (with potential for permanent hire)

Workload: 100%


About the Role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
  • Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.


Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
  • Proven experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles.
  • Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
  • Familiarity with Python or R.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).


Additional Information


This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities
Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics
Power BI knowledge is a plus
Ability to connect with cross functional teams

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central &

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).

Responsabilités

  • Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
  • Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
  • Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
  • Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
  • Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses
  • Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs

Profil

  • Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
  • Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
  • Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
  • Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
  • Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
  • Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
  • Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
  • Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
  • Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst (H/F) to join our team on a hybrid, part-time basis. As a Data Analyst, you will collect, organize, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to support strategic and operational initiatives. You will collaborate with various teams to design dashboards, create reports, and provide recommendations that drive informed decision-making.

The hybrid arrangement allows you to complete analysis tasks remotely while attending on-site sessions for collaborative projects and key presentations as required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Stay informed about new analytical tools and best practices.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights

Global business travel medical and accident insurance

EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities


  • Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
  • Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
  • Provide Level 3 support for these products
  • Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company’s data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
  • Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
  • Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau


Requirements


  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
  • Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
  • Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
  • Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
  • Fluent in French


We offer


  • 5 weeks of vacation
  • EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Extended pension plan
  • Daily sickness allowance insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Global business travel medical and accident insurance
  • Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
  • *All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
  • Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
  • We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
  • For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
  • - Swiss nationals
  • - EU/EFTA nationals
  • - Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
  • - Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

4253185810,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-product-analytics-at-getyourguide-4253185810?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=uWycuUOKyrhyxlaBUW%2BqAg%3D%3D,"Data Analyst, Product Analytics",GetYourGuide,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission—improving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You’ll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.
Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations
Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.
How We Set You Up For Success
Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.
We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission—improving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You’ll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.

You will

  • Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
  • Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
  • Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.

Who You Are

  • 2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations

Nice to have

  • Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
  • Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
  • Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
  • The opportunity to contribute to the
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • GetYourGuide vouchers.

And more…

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Embark on an exciting journey with us at eClerx Switzerland AG, where you’ll take centre stage as a within eClerx’s growing global delivery organization. Your mission? Help deliver analytics and actionable insights for one of our long term, financial services, clients here in Switzerland.

1+ years of experience in data analytics or data science
Experience in Financial Services and financial instruments
Experience in CRM, financial instruments or contract datasets.
Ability to work with structured and unstructured data.
Experience using LLMs for data summarization, document intelligence, or research enhancement.
Familiarity with vector databases and embedding techniques.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.
MUST have a valid Swiss working permit or carry an EU national passport
CH/EU status must be declared on your CV, otherwise your application will be automatically rejected.

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable & telecom, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, software and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India's leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 17,000+ people across its global sites in the US, Canada, UK, Australia, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, Dubai and Singapore, along with its delivery centers in India and Thailand. For more information, visit www.eclerx.com

eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. We are also committed to protecting and safeguarding your personal data. Please find our policy here

Job Description

Junior Data Analyst – International Banking

____________________________________________________________

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Type: Full-time

Vertical: Financial Markets

_______________________________________________________________________

Summary

Embark on an exciting journey with us at eClerx Switzerland AG, where you’ll take centre stage as a within eClerx’s growing global delivery organization. Your mission? Help deliver analytics and actionable insights for one of our long term, financial services, clients here in Switzerland.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and contractual data
  • Collaborate with colleagues to build data-driven models, reporting and actionable insights
  • Present findings in a clear, concise manner for internal consumption
  • Oversee and track the implementation of actionable insights within a PMO framework

Ideal Experience

  • 1+ years of experience in data analytics or data science
  • Proficiency in programming (Python, SQL)
  • Experience in Financial Services and financial instruments
  • Experience in CRM, financial instruments or contract datasets.
  • Ability to work with structured and unstructured data.
  • Familiarity with cloud services.

Bonus Points

  • Experience using LLMs for data summarization, document intelligence, or research enhancement.
  • Familiarity with vector databases and embedding techniques.

Soft Skills

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.

CH Work Permit

  • MUST have a valid Swiss working permit or carry an EU national passport
  • CH/EU status must be declared on your CV, otherwise your application will be automatically rejected.

About EClerx

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable &
column2: telecom, retail, fashion, media &amp
column3: entertainment, manufacturing, travel &amp
column4:
leisure, software and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India's leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 17,000+ people across its global sites in the US, Canada, UK, Australia, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, Dubai and Singapore, along with its delivery centers in India and Thailand. For more information, visit www.eclerx.com

eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.

As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.
• Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.
• Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.
• Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).
• Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).
• Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.
• Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.
• Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).
• Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.
• Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.
• Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.
• Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.
Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.
Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).
Native French and English (C1 level required).
Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset
Commitment to quality and continuous improvement
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).
Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.
Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

About us:


Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.


As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.


Your responsibilities:


• Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.

• Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.

• Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).

• Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).

• Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.

• Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.

• Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).

• Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.

• Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.

• Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.

• Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.


Your Profile:


Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.

Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.


Skills and Knowledge:

Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).

Database knowledge (SQL)

Advanced Excel

Native French and English (C1 level required).

Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset


Soft Skills:

Administrative rigor and analytical mind

Commitment to quality and continuous improvement

Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).

Initiative and autonomy

Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.

Strength and resilience


Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

4277600026,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-international-air-transport-association-iata-4277600026?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=74VxfOpjhaYimbbInfoTjQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,International Air Transport Association (IATA),"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Employment Type: Permanent
Why you will love working here
At IATA, we represent over 350 airlines worldwide, striving to make aviation safer, smarter, more sustainable, and inclusive.

Our Values are not just words on a page - they are the energy behind everything we do: ONE IATA - We collaborate across teams, TRUSTED - We do the right thing, INNOVATIVE - We make tomorrow better, INCLUSIVE - We embrace diverse perspectives.
With over 30,000 courses available, we believe in continuous learning and support your growth in an ever-changing industry.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are our priorities. We are certified by the Equal Salary Foundation, offering equal pay and family-friendly policies.
We encourage community involvement through volunteering and strive to make tomorrow better for aviation and our communities. We offer time off so you can support causes important to you.
We promote work-life balance with flexible work options, including remote and hybrid work, a generous 'work from abroad' policy, and you get your birthday off!
About The Team You Are Joining

Part of the Information and Data (I&D) Division, Data Governance team works to define and implement state-of-the-art data practices within our organization to make data and analytics more accessible, trustworthy, and actionable. Our goal is to maximizes the investment in data and analytics initiatives by promoting the proper use of analytics in business processes, ensuring accurate insights based on quality data, reducing risks with security, and guiding the prioritization of projects so the right information is available at the right time.

Reporting to the Senior Manager Data Governance and Modelling, the Data Analyst will be involved in the processes of cleansing, analysing, interpreting, and displaying data using different approaches and business intelligence tools and assisting in uncovering key insights that lead to better informed decision-making.
What Your Day Would Be Like

As a Data Analyst, the incumbent will be working with business teams and other information technology professionals to support data collection processes, interpret various forms of data and present them in a useful and easy-to-understand manner . The responsibilities of the Data Analyst will:
Develop and maintain data collection pipelines, data analytics and other processes that leverage statistical methodology
Analyse data and explore it for insights using statistical methods to test hypotheses, identify trends, and make predictions
Interpret data, analyse results, generate information and insights from data sets and identify trends and patterns
Perform analysis of data and write technical reports and presentations

Assess quality of data and participate in data cleansing and preparation, including, but not limited to, removing errors, identifying outliers, and transforming data into a format that can be analysed
Create dashboards and reports that communicate insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with other employees, including engineers and programmers, to determine areas of improvement in relation to data.
We would love to hear from you if
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer/data science, mathematics, information management, statistics or related fields
Professional experience in a similar position
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (Snowflake, SQL etc), programming (R, XML, Python), and ETL framework
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
Fluent reading, writing and speaking abilities in English.
Learn more about IATA’s role in the industry, our benefits, and the team at iata/careers/ . We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Employment Type: Permanent

Contract Duration

 Why you will love working here

At IATA, we represent over 350 airlines worldwide, striving to make aviation safer, smarter, more sustainable, and inclusive.

  • Our Values are not just words on a page - they are the energy behind everything we do: ONE IATA - We collaborate across teams, TRUSTED - We do the right thing, INNOVATIVE - We make tomorrow better, INCLUSIVE - We embrace diverse perspectives.
  • With over 30,000 courses available, we believe in continuous learning and support your growth in an ever-changing industry.

  • We promote work-life balance with flexible work options, including remote and hybrid work, a generous 'work from abroad' policy, and you get your birthday off!

4275943662,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/fintech-data-analyst-ai-consultant-at-nexeria-talent-4275943662?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=bSG9d5n7hZq4vEBTc1ABUw%3D%3D,FinTech Data Analyst / AI Consultant,Nexeria Talent,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Title: FinTech Data Analyst / AI Consultant

We are seeking a tech-savvy and analytically driven FinTech Data Analyst / AI Consultant to join our team. This hybrid role is ideal for professionals passionate about financial technology, data science, and the strategic use of AI to drive product innovation and business growth in the financial sector.
Analyze structured and unstructured financial data to generate insights for internal and client-facing use
Develop and deploy AI/ML models to solve real-world business problems in areas such as fraud detection, credit scoring, and customer segmentation
Work closely with product, engineering, and finance teams to identify data-driven opportunities
Translate analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for stakeholders
Help ensure data compliance and security standards (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) are upheld
Stay current with FinTech trends, emerging AI tools, and financial regulations
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Finance, Computer Science, or a related field
Solid experience with Python, R, or SQL
column2: familiarity with AI/ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow)

column1: Understanding of financial products, services, or markets
Strong analytical skills and experience working with large datasets
Previous FinTech or consulting experience is a strong plus

📩 If you're passionate about the intersection of finance, data, and AI, and want to help shape the future of digital finance, we encourage you to apply with your resume and a brief summary of your relevant work or projects.

4278330683,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-business-analyst-power-bi-specialist-at-reliefweb-4278330683?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=wJntGHNSkkidqsM6T2QX7g%3D%3D,Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist,ReliefWeb,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Switzerland
Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist
Join MSF OCG as a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist!
We are looking for passionate candidates ready to contribute to our humanitarian mission.
Below, you will find the job details and the qualifications we are looking for.
Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don’t fulfil every listed qualification.
We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.
MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Médecins Sans Frontières is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).
The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? At MSF Switzerland, we're looking for a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist to play a key role in shaping our self-service data platform and enterprise reporting.

In this role, you’ll wear two hats. First, as a Business Analyst, you’ll work closely with different departments to understand their reporting needs, listening, analyzing, and documenting requirements to ensure we’re solving the right problems. Then, you’ll switch gears and become our Power BI expert, building intuitive reports, clean datasets, and powerful semantic models using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.

You won’t be working in isolation. You’ll be a vital part of a cross-functional project team alongside our Data Architect, Data Engineers, and key stakeholders, you will be part of the BRIDGE (Bringing Resources & Intelligence for Dynamic Global Engagement) project team, integrated to the DIP (Data, Innovation and Project) section, which is part of the DSI (Direction of the Systems of Information).
You’ll help make sure everything we build aligns with both business goals and our data governance standards, thus influencing the adoption of the new dashboards.
If you're ready to dive into a meaningful data journey and make a real difference through your work, we’d love to hear from you.
Fixed-term contract for 12 months, with potential for renewal based on evolving project requirements.
Business Needs Collection: Collect, analyze, and structure reporting needs across departments and domains.
Requirements Documentation: Translate business requirements into documented reporting specifications and data needs.
Request Prioritization: Prioritize and organize reporting requests and ensure traceability from request to solution.
Governed Reporting Design: Participate in the design and evolution of a governed reporting environment using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
Report & Dashboard Implementation: Build and deploy interactive, user-friendly reports and dashboards tailored to business objectives.
Certified Dataset Development: Develop and maintain certified, reusable datasets aligned with enterprise data standards.
Content Documentation: Document reporting content, usage guidelines, and data logic to ensure transparency and consistency.
User Support & Training: Actively contribute to user onboarding, training, and support for self-service data tools.
Tertiary degree, university degree, or equivalent in data analytics, information systems, business intelligence, or a related field
Certifications in Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, or related tools are an asset
You have at least 4 years of experience in roles that blend business analysis with data-focused project delivery.
You’re confident translating complex business questions into clear, impactful reporting solutions.
You’ve had hands-on involvement in BI development—building datasets and contributing to dashboards.
English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).
Gather and structure reporting requirements from multiple business domains
Translate operational and analytical needs into functional specifications
Ensure alignment between business needs and existing data capabilities
Build and maintain interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
Design and manage reusable datasets and semantic models in Power BI and support data quality
Leverage Microsoft Fabric, Pw BI platform for modelling, orchestration, and platform integration
Align reporting solutions with enterprise data governance and architecture
Document all deliverables (datasets, visuals, business rules, KPIs, usage)
Contribute to user onboarding, training sessions, and guidance material
Ensure consistency and clarity in metrics and data definitions across reports
Work as part of a broader data project team, supporting implementation milestones
Collaborate with the Data Architect, Data Engineers, and business stakeholders
Support cross-functional testing, feedback cycles, and continuous improvement
Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 94’440.- to CHF 108’348.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.
Candidates are invited to submit their application exclusively through our recruitment platform, following these guidelines:
Documents must be submitted in either English or French.
We reserve the right to close this vacancy earlier if we receive a sufficient number of quality applications.
All applications will be treated confidentially.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

  • Support cross-functional testing, feedback cycles, and continuous improvement

Terms of employment

  • Full-time position 100% (40h/week)
  • Fixed-term contract, 12 months
  • Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
  • Ideal start date: 15th of September 2025
  • Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 94’440.- to CHF 108’348.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
  • Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
  • Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
  • Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.

How to apply

Candidates are invited to submit their application exclusively through our recruitment platform, following these guidelines:

  • CV (maximum 2 pages)
  • Cover letter (maximum 1 page)
  • Documents must be submitted in either English or French.

The application deadline is 17th August 2025

We reserve the right to close this vacancy earlier if we receive a sufficient number of quality applications.

APPLY

All applications will be treated confidentially.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

Job details

  • Switzerland

City Geneva Source

  • Médecins Sans Frontières en Suisse

Career category

  • Information Management

Years of experience

  • 5-9 years
