4278048606,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/finance-insights-data-analysis-analyst-at-roche-4278048606?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=wYhwWQWowzRXiVPNb0clfQ%3D%3D,Finance Insights & Data Analysis Analyst,Roche,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

At Roche, our Finance Centers of Excellence have led the way in breaking down silos, removing hierarchies, and working in new ways. We’ve learned from our successes and from the things that haven’t gone so well. We’re better equipped to look at interfaces and synergies, and to understand the risks of creating new silos. The eCoE is focusing on three areas delivering a high-level of financial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset that enables agility and flexibility for stakeholders. The eCoE is a talent engine for Finance through capability and network building.

Within the eCOE, the R&D Outcome Based Community (OBC) focuses on delivering a high-level of fifinancial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset to influence and support R&D investments at Roche.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented R&D Benchmarking Analyst to support our R&D organization. This role focuses on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting internal and external data to benchmark R&D performance, costs, timelines, and success rates in molecule development. You will play a critical role in shaping R&D strategy through competitive intelligence, pipeline assessment, and knowledge management.
Conduct R&D benchmarking studies focused on preclinical and clinical development phases across therapeutic areas and molecule types
Main point of contact for external benchmark analysis providing, collecting, validating and analyzing benchmark data points to/from our selected external provider
Analyze molecule development costs, timelines, success rates, using internal project data and external sources
Support cross-functional teams by providing actionable insights to improve pipeline productivity and decision-making
Develop and maintain internal databases and dashboards on R&D metrics, competitive programs, and industry trends
Collaborate with portfolio management, therapeutic area leads, and external providers to contextualize benchmarking insights
Track industry best practices and innovations in drug discovery, translational research, and clinical development
Synthesize large datasets and scientific knowledge into concise reports and presentations for senior leadership
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance, Pharmacy, Medicine, or related field
2–5 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&D, competitive intelligence, or management consulting (with pharma focus)
Strong understanding of molecule development stages (discovery to early/late-phase clinical development)
Familiarity with R&D KPIs: time-to-launch, timelines, cost of failure, cycle times, etc
Excellent data analysis and visualization skills (Excel, PP, SAC,...)
Strong communication skills with ability to translate complex data into strategic insights

You have the ability to turn data into insights, comfortable with zooming in and out on details and granularity depending on the situation. You are a collaborative team player with ability to deal with ambiguous situations and deliver in a networked setup. You are courageously authentic with ability to speak up and point out opportunities.
The role is located in Basel.

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
Let’s build a healthier future, together.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

4271818237,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-research-analyst-at-sts-digital-group-4271818237?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=ooR7Aoxh%2B6Qy7Q0Z2lc1Xg%3D%3D,Quantitative Research Analyst,STS Digital Group,"Zurich, Switzerland","Quantitative Analyst

We are seeking a motivated Quantitative Analyst to join our quantitative trading team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with quantitative researchers on designing, testing, and refining algorithmic trading strategies while leveraging quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques in the cryptocurrency market. This is an excellent opportunity to work at the cutting edge of quantitative finance and help us serve an expanding and increasingly sophisticated client base.
Apply advanced statistical methods and financial modeling to systematic option market-making and risk management.
Conduct volatility surface modeling and calibration, option (exotics) pricing, liquidity analysis, and other related analyses.
Design, refine, and optimize algorithmic trading strategies by designing efficient order placement and scheduling algorithms, integrating short-term alpha signals to minimize slippage.
Utilize internal trading data and perform post-trade analysis to validate trading performance and recommend improvements tailored to the trading strategies.
Collaborate with portfolio and risk management teams to develop and implement tools for performance analysis and risk management.

Collaborate with the trading desk to research and evaluate new trading ideas and opportunities within the cryptocurrency market, leveraging large datasets and advanced statistical methods to automate trading decisions and improve existing strategies.
Contribute to documentation, ensuring that all processes, algorithms, and models are clearly described for internal stakeholders.
Strong academic foundation in quantitative finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills, including proficiency in statistical modeling, derivatives pricing, and volatility surface analysis.
Familiarity with algorithmic trading, order book flow, and options trading is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively within cross-functional teams.
Collaborative mindset to work with developers and other analysts to implement trading ideas and analytical tools.
Genuine interest in cryptocurrency markets and algorithmic trading and eagerness to learn, solve complex problems, and adapt quickly in a rapidly evolving environment.

Quantitative Analyst


Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated Quantitative Analyst to join our quantitative trading team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with quantitative researchers on designing, testing, and refining algorithmic trading strategies while leveraging quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques in the cryptocurrency market. This is an excellent opportunity to work at the cutting edge of quantitative finance and help us serve an expanding and increasingly sophisticated client base.


Key Responsibilities

  • Apply advanced statistical methods and financial modeling to systematic option market-making and risk management.
  • Conduct volatility surface modeling and calibration, option (exotics) pricing, liquidity analysis, and other related analyses.
  • Design, refine, and optimize algorithmic trading strategies by designing efficient order placement and scheduling algorithms, integrating short-term alpha signals to minimize slippage.
  • Utilize internal trading data and perform post-trade analysis to validate trading performance and recommend improvements tailored to the trading strategies.
  • Collaborate with portfolio and risk management teams to develop and implement tools for performance analysis and risk management.
  • Collaborate with the trading desk to research and evaluate new trading ideas and opportunities within the cryptocurrency market, leveraging large datasets and advanced statistical methods to automate trading decisions and improve existing strategies.
  • Contribute to documentation, ensuring that all processes, algorithms, and models are clearly described for internal stakeholders.


Requirements

  • Strong academic foundation in quantitative finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
  • Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills, including proficiency in statistical modeling, derivatives pricing, and volatility surface analysis.
  • Exceptional Python programming skills.
  • Familiarity with algorithmic trading, order book flow, and options trading is beneficial but not mandatory.
  • Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Collaborative mindset to work with developers and other analysts to implement trading ideas and analytical tools.
  • Genuine interest in cryptocurrency markets and algorithmic trading and eagerness to learn, solve complex problems, and adapt quickly in a rapidly evolving environment.

Analyst,Proclinical Staffing,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Analyst:in für operative Prozesse (80-100%) - Gesundheitsdienstleister

Ein innovatives Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen sucht eine analytisch starke und kommunikationsfreudige Persönlichkeit zur Verstärkung des Teams im Bereich Operations & Partner Management. Die Position ist ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung zu besetzen.
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung eines Netzwerks externer medizinischer Fachpersonen.
Du gestaltest aktiv die Zusammenarbeit mit Partner:innen, führst Vertragsverhandlungen und entwickelst neue Kooperationsmodelle.
Du analysierst wirtschaftliche Kennzahlen und leitest daraus Optimierungspotenziale ab - z.?B. in Bezug auf Infrastruktur, Leistungen oder Abrechnungsmodelle.
Du arbeitest eng mit internen Abteilungen wie Finanzen, IT und Klinikmanagement zusammen und fungierst als zentrale Schnittstelle.
Du entwickelst Standards und Prozesse weiter und sorgst für deren transparente Dokumentation.
Du erstellst Reports und Dashboards auf Basis von Daten aus ERP-, CRM- und BI-Systemen.
Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaft, Gesundheitsökonomie, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit komplexen Datenanalysen und sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse (inkl. Pivot, Power Query
column2: VBA von Vorteil).

column1: Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von BI-Tools (z.?B. Power BI) sowie ERP- und CRM-Systemen.
Idealerweise erste Berührungspunkte mit medizinischen IT-Systemen und ein gutes Verständnis für Abläufe im Gesundheitswesen.
Kommunikationsstärke, Verhandlungsgeschick und ein lösungsorientierter Arbeitsstil.
Eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Eigenverantwortung.
Ein unterstützendes Team mit offener Feedbackkultur.
Ein zentral gelegener Arbeitsplatz mit guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Verkehr.
Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Nur Ergiydiren unter der n.ergiydiren@proclinical.com.
Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.
Proclinical Staffing ist außerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

4273270995,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-intern-m-f-x-d-6-months-100%25-at-swiss-re-4273270995?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=5O2jgoesKcrGleScHInPlw%3D%3D,"Data & Insights Intern (m/f/x/d, 6 months, 100%)",Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life & Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

As a Data & Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life & Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.
Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
Develop deep understanding of Life & Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries
The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data & Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life & Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life & Health Products and the Head of Life & Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.
We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements
Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English
These Are Additional Nice To Haves
Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields
We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!
The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.
Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life &amp
column2:
Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

About The Role

As a Data &
column3: Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life &amp
column4:
Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
  • Develop deep understanding of Life &
column5:
Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
  • Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
  • Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
  • Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries

    • The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

    About The Team

    Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data &
column6: Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life &amp
column7: Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life &amp
column8: Health Products and the Head of Life &amp
column9:
Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

About You

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.

We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements

  • Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
  • Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
  • Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
  • Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English

These Are Additional Nice To Haves

  • Actuarial background or coursework
  • Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
  • Additional language proficiencies beyond English
  • Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields

What next?

We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!

The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. 4269632767,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-data-analyst-at-sii-group-switzerland-4269632767?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=tlFDSB605fEVTXm%2BE3qyEA%3D%3D,Data Scientist / Data Analyst,SII Group Switzerland,"Nyon, Vaud, Switzerland","Qui nous sommes

SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :
> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries
> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées
Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !
Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.
Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.
5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.
Date de début : dès que possible

Qui nous sommes


SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :


>
column2:
Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

>
column3:
Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

>
column4:
Un système qualité performant

>
column5:
Des services adaptables et évolutifs


Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.



Missions


  • Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
  • Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
  • Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
  • Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
  • Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
  • Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
  • Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
  • Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
  • Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.



Profil


  • 5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
  • Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
  • Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
  • Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
  • Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
  • Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
  • Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
  • Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.



Informations complémentaires


  • Date de début : dès que possible
  • Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
  • Durée : Long terme
  • Langue : Français et anglais
  • Nationalité européenne requise

4252367398,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-data-analyst-customer-satisfaction-80-100%25-f-m-d-at-hitachi-energy-4252367398?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=v%2FFWXsue3M7q65E%2BOqfvDQ%3D%3D,Intern Data Analyst Customer Satisfaction 80 - 100% (f/m/d),Hitachi Energy,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","The Opportunity

Are you passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer satisfaction? We are offering a six-month internship focused on developing innovative solutions for improving customer experience. Join our team and contribute to a project that will enable organizations to systematize and prioritize customer experience improvement initiatives.
Conduct data reviews and perform gap analysis to evaluate the structure, quality, and completeness of current datasets
Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives
Analyze the accuracy and maturity of current datasets and propose methods to test and validate the framework
Lay the foundation for future predictive models
Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders
Currently enrolled in a Master's program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
Good in Python or R for data analysis
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team

Our diverse and inclusive work environment encourages collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring that every team member has the opportunity to grow Join us and be part of a company that is shaping the future of sustainable energy solutions.

Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader in electrification, powering a sustainable energy future through innovative power grid technologies with digital at the core. Over three billion people depend on our technologies to power their daily lives.

With over a century in pioneering mission-critical technologies like high-voltage, transformers, automation, and power electronics, we are addressing the most urgent energy challenge of our time – balancing soaring electricity demand, while decarbonizing the power system.
Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ over 50,000 people in 60 countries and generate revenues of around $16 billion USD. We welcome you to apply today.

The Opportunity

Are you passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer satisfaction? We are offering a six-month internship focused on developing innovative solutions for improving customer experience. Join our team and contribute to a project that will enable organizations to systematize and prioritize customer experience improvement initiatives.

How You'll Make An Impact

  • Conduct data reviews and perform gap analysis to evaluate the structure, quality, and completeness of current datasets
  • Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
  • Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives
  • Analyze the accuracy and maturity of current datasets and propose methods to test and validate the framework
  • Lay the foundation for future predictive models
  • Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders

Your Background

  • Currently enrolled in a Master's program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
  • Good in Python or R for data analysis
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
  • Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team


More About Us

Our diverse and inclusive work environment encourages collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring that every team member has the opportunity to grow Join us and be part of a company that is shaping the future of sustainable energy solutions.

Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader in electrification, powering a sustainable energy future through innovative power grid technologies with digital at the core. Over three billion people depend on our technologies to power their daily lives.

With over a century in pioneering mission-critical technologies like high-voltage, transformers, automation, and power electronics, we are addressing the most urgent energy challenge of our time – balancing soaring electricity demand, while decarbonizing the power system.

Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ over 50,000 people in 60 countries and generate revenues of around $16 billion USD. We welcome you to apply today.

4264113332,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264113332?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=czboEqGn8SOGnwmawQtnJA%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Lugano, Ticino, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &
column2:
German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


    • Assessment

    In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. 4268584291,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sword-group-4268584291?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=q84O7kSoZ%2FdTNGSQ7OdvdA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Sword Group,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.
Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.
Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.
Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.
Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.
Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.
Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.
Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.
Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.
Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.
Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.
Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).
Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.
Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.
Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.
Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.


Responsabilités du poste

  • Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.

  • Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.

  • Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.

  • Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.

  • Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.

  • Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.

  • Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.

  • Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.

Prérequis

  • Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.

  • Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.

  • Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.

  • Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).

  • Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.

  • Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.

  • Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.

  • Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.

Rejoindre Sword, c’est…
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

4274327282,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-data-analysis-zurich-at-ey-4274327282?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=t6X9%2B5pHr9veDvNUIt%2BZ0Q%3D%3D,Consultant Data Analysis - Zurich,EY,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.
In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world’s capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients’ businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.
Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.
To qualify for the role you must have
A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world’s leading professional services firms.
We are looking forward to receiving your application.
Take the next step and apply for this position online.

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.

In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world’s capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients’ businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
  • Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
  • Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
  • Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
  • Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in German and English.

More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world’s leading professional services firms.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Take the next step and apply for this position online.

4276595702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-digital-analytics-consultant-h-f-geneva-at-fifty-five-4276595702?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=h7aFCwYcvpPpfKkS5u9P4A%3D%3D,Senior Digital Analytics Consultant H/F (Geneva),fifty-five,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)
Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
1 to 3 years experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media
Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry

This policy applies to all terms and conditions

4264136745,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-center-operations-analyst-at-servicenow-4264136745?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=pHcwfm9sUo2qxmcxwfV9wQ%3D%3D,Data Center Operations Analyst,ServiceNow,"Opfikon, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.
This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.
What You Get To Do In This Role
Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure.
Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.
To be successful in this role you have:
4+ years of experience in data center operations management
Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.
Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.
What You Can Expect From Us

At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone – including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs – we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:
Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Job Description

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.

This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.

What You Get To Do In This Role

  • Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
  • Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
  • Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
  • Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
  • Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
  • Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
  • Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
  • Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
  • Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
  • Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical &
column2:
Electrical infrastructure.
  • Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
  • Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
  • Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.

    • Qualifications

    To be successful in this role you have:

    • 4+ years of experience in data center operations management
    • Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
    • Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
    • Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
    • Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
    • Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
    • Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
    • General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
    • Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
    • Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
    • Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
    • A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
    • Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.

    Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.

    What You Can Expect From Us

    At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone – including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

    Benefits

    In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs – we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:

    • Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
    • Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
    • Parental leave programs.
    • Childcare and caregiving benefits.
    • A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
    • A global, cross-functional mentoring program.
      • We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.
    Additional Information

    Work Personas

    We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

    Equal Opportunity Employer

    ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

    Accommodations

    We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

    Export Control Regulations

    For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

4264119168,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264119168?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=v1hzGttAWINma8kPL7YjsQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Nidwalden, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.
Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:
Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus
🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkräfte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus


🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!
