4265338517,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-intern-at-vf-corporation-4265338517?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=XIGapWkTsrORhfYShRcIPw%3D%3D,Data Engineer Intern,VF Corporation,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.
Must be graduating within or after November 2025
These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.
By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.
Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.
What will make a candidate successful?
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.
Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.
A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.
We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:
The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.
We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!
ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:

  • EU / EEA citizenship
  • Must be graduating within or after November 2025

These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
  • Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
  • Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
  • Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
  • Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.

What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?

  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
  • Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
  • Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
  • Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
  • Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

Competences Required:

  • Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
  • Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
  • Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
  • Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.

A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:

  • The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
  • The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
  • An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
  • An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
  • A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

What’s In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:

  • Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
  • Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
  • Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
  • Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
  • Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
  • On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

Free to Be, Inclusion &
column2:
Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.
This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.
How will you make an impact?
Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-Gâne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:
Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?
University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus
High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment
Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.
We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.

This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-Gâne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:

  • Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
  • Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
  • Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
  • Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
  • Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
  • Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
  • Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
  • Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies

  • University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
  • Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
  • Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
  • Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
  • Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
  • Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
  • Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus

Personal, Methodological And Social Skills

  • High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
  • Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
  • Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
  • Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment

WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.

  • We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
  • We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
  • We care for the world we live in.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.
What to expect in your first 6 Months
Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.
Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.
A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column2: Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.

column1: Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes

column2: proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

column1: This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.
Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit
We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits
We look forward to your direct online application.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data &
column2:
Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
  • Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

  • A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column3:
Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
  • Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
  • Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
  • Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
  • Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
  • Fluency in English
column4:
proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information

  • This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
  • Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
  • This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.

Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.

4264108608,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264108608?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=hi7obtZu%2Brjv8y%2FI4MGfcA%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Winterthur, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4269393519,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393519?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=m7tsbSfnZbP95tINi8yexg%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

Présente dans les activités du traitement de l’eau depuis plus de 60 ans, Alpha WasserTechnik AG est une société basée à Nidau, région bilingue par excellence, et propose en Suisse des solutions innovantes pour le traitement des eaux usées communales et industrielles, avec les prestations qui y sont rattachées. Alpha WasserTechnik AG est une société fille de la holding Membratec Groupe SA, leader dans le domaine du traitement de l'eau, en fournissant des solutions innovantes face aux enjeux sociétaux.
Vous êtes à la recherche d’un nouveau challenge ? Alpha Wassertechnik cherche pour son département administratif un-e :

Soutenir la gestion administrative des ressources humaines, principalement les opérations liées aux salaires, aux assurances sociales, aux contrats de travail et aux aspects administratifs y relatifs,
Gérer le logiciel du temps de travail et suivre les plannings et les demandes de congés,
Participer à l’élaboration de la documentation interne (divers règlements),
Entretenir des contacts étroits avec les collaborateurs, être à l’écoute de leurs besoins, les conseiller sur les aspects RH en collaboration avec la responsable RH et la Direction,
Aider à l’organisation d’évènements externes et internes,
Participer à divers projets, en particulier dans le domaine de la communication et de la digitalisation.
Formation commerciale complète et/ou formation d’assistant-e RH,
Maîtrise des bonnes pratiques RH et connaissance des assurances sociales, gestion des salaires ainsi que du droit du travail suisse,
Expérience confirmée et concluante dans un poste similaire,
Langue maternelle française, bonne maîtrise de l’allemand,
Esprit de synthèse et facilité rédactionnelle avec une très bonne maîtrise de l’orthographe,
Excellente maîtrise des outils informatiques (MS-Office) et agilité digitale,
Vous êtes organisé-e, polyvalent(e) et proactif-ve,

column2: la qualité et la fiabilité sont vos maîtres mots.

column1: Un cadre de travail agréable situé à Nidau à quelques centaines de mètres de la gare,
Une activité diversifiée au sein de l’administration du Groupe,
Une ambiance de travail dynamique dans une société en plein développement,
Des possibilités de se former et d’évoluer.
Date d’engagement : septembre 2025 ou à convenir. Merci d'adresser vos offres écrites avec CV et lettre de motivation directement via le portail

About

Présente dans les activités du traitement de l’eau depuis plus de 60 ans, Alpha WasserTechnik AG est une société basée à Nidau, région bilingue par excellence, et propose en Suisse des solutions innovantes pour le traitement des eaux usées communales et industrielles, avec les prestations qui y sont rattachées. Alpha WasserTechnik AG est une société fille de la holding Membratec Groupe SA, leader dans le domaine du traitement de l'eau, en fournissant des solutions innovantes face aux enjeux sociétaux.

Vous êtes à la recherche d’un nouveau challenge ? Alpha Wassertechnik cherche pour son département administratif un-e :

Assistant-e RH et administratif-ve (60-80%)

Vos missions principales

  • Soutenir la gestion administrative des ressources humaines, principalement les opérations liées aux salaires, aux assurances sociales, aux contrats de travail et aux aspects administratifs y relatifs,
  • Gérer le logiciel du temps de travail et suivre les plannings et les demandes de congés,
  • Participer à l’élaboration de la documentation interne (divers règlements),
  • Participer au processus de recrutement,
  • Entretenir des contacts étroits avec les collaborateurs, être à l’écoute de leurs besoins, les conseiller sur les aspects RH en collaboration avec la responsable RH et la Direction,
  • Aider à l’organisation d’évènements externes et internes,
  • Participer à divers projets, en particulier dans le domaine de la communication et de la digitalisation.

Aptitudes requises

  • Formation commerciale complète et/ou formation d’assistant-e RH,
  • Maîtrise des bonnes pratiques RH et connaissance des assurances sociales, gestion des salaires ainsi que du droit du travail suisse,
  • Expérience confirmée et concluante dans un poste similaire,
  • Langue maternelle française, bonne maîtrise de l’allemand,
  • Esprit de synthèse et facilité rédactionnelle avec une très bonne maîtrise de l’orthographe,
  • Excellente maîtrise des outils informatiques (MS-Office) et agilité digitale,
  • Vous êtes organisé-e, polyvalent(e) et proactif-ve,
  • Vous respectez la confidentialité
column2:
la qualité et la fiabilité sont vos maîtres mots.

Nous offrons

  • Un cadre de travail agréable situé à Nidau à quelques centaines de mètres de la gare,
  • Une activité diversifiée au sein de l’administration du Groupe,
  • Une ambiance de travail dynamique dans une société en plein développement,
  • Des possibilités de se former et d’évoluer.

Date d’engagement : septembre 2025 ou à convenir. Merci d'adresser vos offres écrites avec CV et lettre de motivation directement via le portail

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Unter einem traditionsreichen Namen hat Kempinski, Hoteliers seit 1897, die Welt auf der Suche nach faszinierenden Destinationen bereist, ohne dabei seine Traditionen und sein europäisches Erbe je zu vergessen. Die großzügigen Resorts sowie die stylischen City- und Wellnesshotels spiegeln einen individuellen und einzigartigen Charakter wider, speziell für Gäste, die 5-Sterne Service und Luxus bei ihren geschäftlichen oder privaten Reisen zu schätzen wissen.

About

Unter einem traditionsreichen Namen hat Kempinski, Hoteliers seit 1897, die Welt auf der Suche nach faszinierenden Destinationen bereist, ohne dabei seine Traditionen und sein europäisches Erbe je zu vergessen. Die großzügigen Resorts sowie die stylischen City- und Wellnesshotels spiegeln einen individuellen und einzigartigen Charakter wider, speziell für Gäste, die 5-Sterne Service und Luxus bei ihren geschäftlichen oder privaten Reisen zu schätzen wissen.

4276595702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-digital-analytics-consultant-h-f-geneva-at-fifty-five-4276595702?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=JXdrifoAdRh3%2B657ZnEsUw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FdYbhVX9%2BakS2ZbvcUFlMQ%3D%3D,Senior Digital Analytics Consultant H/F (Geneva),fifty-five,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)
Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
1 to 3 years experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media
Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry

This policy applies to all terms and conditions

fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
  • Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
  • Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
  • Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables

  • Working with web analytics tools
  • Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media

Skills and Interests

  • Fluent in French &

herzliche Familienfreundlichkeit mit einem erstklassigen Wellnessangebot und exzellentem

Service. Wir glauben fest daran, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden der Schlüssel zu diesem Erfolg sind. Deshalb investieren wir in ein Arbeitsumfeld, das nicht nur fördert, sondern auch unterstützt. About

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.
This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.
How will you make an impact?
Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-Gâne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:
Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?
University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus
High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment
Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.
We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.

This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-Gâne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:

  • Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
  • Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
  • Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
  • Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
  • Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
  • Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
  • Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
  • Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies

  • University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
  • Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
  • Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
  • Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
  • Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
  • Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
  • Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus

Personal, Methodological And Social Skills

  • High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
  • Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
  • Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
  • Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment

WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.

  • We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
  • We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
  • We care for the world we live in.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

HOTELIS ist das wichtigste Schweizer Unternehmen, aktiv in der Rekrutierung und Selektion von Talenten für Dauer- und Temporärstellen in der Hotellerie und Restauration. Unsere Kompetenzen erlauben uns, den privilegierten Partner von zahlreichen Hotels erstklassiger Kategorien, Restaurants, Cateringunternehmen (Events, Stadien und Ausstellungsmessen) und Gemeinschaftsgastronomie zu sein.

Nutzen Sie Die Gelegenheit, Ihre Leidenschaft Für Erstklassigen Service Bei Unserem Renommierten Kunden Im Herzen Der Bundeshauptstadt Bern Zum Ausdruck Zu Bringen, Im Rahmen Einer Festanstellung, Per Juli Oder Nach Vereinbarung, In Der Funktion Als

Als leidenschaftlicher Gastgeber (all) sorgen Sie für eine erstklassige Gästebetreuung und höchste Zufriedenheit durch proaktive Kommunikation. Sie stellen einen reibungslosen Serviceablauf sicher. Sie beraten und bedienen die Gäste kompetent, mit viel Freude und Charme. Sie planen und gestalten das Tagesgeschäft mit und sind mitverantwortlich für die Angebotsplanung. Des Weiteren sind Sie für die Umsetzung und Einhaltung der hohen Servicestandards und der HACCP Richtlinien verantwortlich wie auch für die Betreuung und Ausbildung der Lernenden.ERFORDERLICHES PROFIL:

Sie sind gelernter Restaurantfachmann/-frau EFZ oder bringen eine ähnliche Qualifikation mit. Sie verfügen über bewährte Erfahrung im Service und haben bereits erste Führungserfahrungen gesammelt. Sie sind eine engagierte und serviceorientierte Persönlichkeit mit einem hohen Qualitätsanspruch und ausgeprägter Dienstleistungsbereitschaft. Ihr gepflegtes Auftreten und Ihre exzellenten Umgangsformen machen Sie zu einem geschätzten Gastgeber (all). Auch in hektischen Situationen behalten Sie stets den Überblick. Sie sprechen fliessend Deutsch. Jede weitere Sprache ist von Vorteil.
eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem renommierten Betrieb
Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, die in voller Diskretion behandelt wird.

About

EINFÜHRUNG:

HOTELIS ist das wichtigste Schweizer Unternehmen, aktiv in der Rekrutierung und Selektion von Talenten für Dauer- und Temporärstellen in der Hotellerie und Restauration. Unsere Kompetenzen erlauben uns, den privilegierten Partner von zahlreichen Hotels erstklassiger Kategorien, Restaurants, Cateringunternehmen (Events, Stadien und Ausstellungsmessen) und Gemeinschaftsgastronomie zu sein.

Nutzen Sie Die Gelegenheit, Ihre Leidenschaft Für Erstklassigen Service Bei Unserem Renommierten Kunden Im Herzen Der Bundeshauptstadt Bern Zum Ausdruck Zu Bringen, Im Rahmen Einer Festanstellung, Per Juli Oder Nach Vereinbarung, In Der Funktion Als

Gastgeber (all) 60-100%

Aufgabenbeschreibung

Als leidenschaftlicher Gastgeber (all) sorgen Sie für eine erstklassige Gästebetreuung und höchste Zufriedenheit durch proaktive Kommunikation. Sie stellen einen reibungslosen Serviceablauf sicher. Sie beraten und bedienen die Gäste kompetent, mit viel Freude und Charme. Sie planen und gestalten das Tagesgeschäft mit und sind mitverantwortlich für die Angebotsplanung. Des Weiteren sind Sie für die Umsetzung und Einhaltung der hohen Servicestandards und der HACCP Richtlinien verantwortlich wie auch für die Betreuung und Ausbildung der Lernenden.ERFORDERLICHES PROFIL:

Sie sind gelernter Restaurantfachmann/-frau EFZ oder bringen eine ähnliche Qualifikation mit. Sie verfügen über bewährte Erfahrung im Service und haben bereits erste Führungserfahrungen gesammelt. Sie sind eine engagierte und serviceorientierte Persönlichkeit mit einem hohen Qualitätsanspruch und ausgeprägter Dienstleistungsbereitschaft. Ihr gepflegtes Auftreten und Ihre exzellenten Umgangsformen machen Sie zu einem geschätzten Gastgeber (all). Auch in hektischen Situationen behalten Sie stets den Überblick. Sie sprechen fliessend Deutsch. Jede weitere Sprache ist von Vorteil.

Wir Bieten Ihnen

  • eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem renommierten Betrieb
  • die Möglichkeit, sich intern weiterzuentwickeln
  • interne und externe Vergünstigungen

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?

Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, die in voller Diskretion behandelt wird.

4274304035,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/e-commerce-customer-service-specialist-at-damiani-group-4274304035?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=JXdrifoAdRh3%2B657ZnEsUw%3D%3D&trackingId=eSonQsIdcEz%2F3yXuA%2Fz%2FAA%3D%3D,E-Commerce Customer Service Specialist,DAMIANI Group,"Mendrisio, Ticino, Switzerland","Il Gruppo Damiani è un’eccellenza italiana della gioielleria e dell’orologeria di alta gamma, riconosciuto a livello internazionale per la qualità artigianale, il design sofisticato e i valori di famiglia che ne guidano da sempre la crescita. Il gruppo include alcuni dei marchi più prestigiosi del settore:Damiani, Salvini, Rocca, Bliss, Venini e Calderoni.
Il/La candidato/a selezionato/a avrà l’opportunità di contribuire allo sviluppo dei canali digitali per diversi brand del gruppo, in un contesto dinamico e in forte espansione.
Gestire il customer service pre e post vendita per gli store online dei brand del gruppo, garantendo una customer experience in linea con i valori e il posizionamento di ciascun marchio.
Fornire supporto tempestivo e professionale ai clienti via email, telefono, live chat e social media, risolvendo problematiche legate a ordini, spedizioni, resi, pagamenti e prodotti.
Collaborare con il team Digital Marketing per assicurare una comunicazione coerente con i clienti attraverso le piattaforme social.
Supportare il team CRM nell’integrazione e nella coerenza dei diversi canali di contatto, contribuendo alla gestione di campagne e flussi automatizzati.
Aggiornare e mantenere la documentazione interna su procedure, FAQ e strumenti customer-facing.
Collaborare con i reparti logistica, operations, retail e IT per garantire un servizio fluido ed efficiente.
Contribuire al monitoraggio dei KPI di customer care e all’identificazione di aree di miglioramento dell’esperienza cliente.
1–2 anni di esperienza in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in ambito e-commerce o retail di lusso.
Ottime capacità comunicative scritte e orali, in italiano e inglese
Attitudine al problem solving, empatia e forte orientamento al cliente.
Familiarità con tool e piattaforme di customer service (Zendesk, Salesforce, o equivalenti).
Interesse per il mondo del lusso, del digital e per le dinamiche omnicanale.
Disponibilità a lavorare 1 o 2 sabati al mese, secondo turnazione e necessità stagionali.
Ingresso in un contesto strutturato, dinamico e multiculturale, con la possibilità di crescita professionale all’interno di un gruppo leader del settore.
Inserimento in una realtà internazionale di prestigio, con una forte cultura aziendale e attenzione al capitale umano.
Ambiente dinamico, orientato all’innovazione e alla trasformazione digitale
Opportunità di lavorare a stretto contatto con brand iconici del lusso italiano.

Il Gruppo Damiani è un’eccellenza italiana della gioielleria e dell’orologeria di alta gamma, riconosciuto a livello internazionale per la qualità artigianale, il design sofisticato e i valori di famiglia che ne guidano da sempre la crescita. Il gruppo include alcuni dei marchi più prestigiosi del settore:Damiani, Salvini, Rocca, Bliss, Venini e Calderoni.


Il/La candidato/a selezionato/a avrà l’opportunità di contribuire allo sviluppo dei canali digitali per diversi brand del gruppo, in un contesto dinamico e in forte espansione.


Responsabilità principali

  • Gestire il customer service pre e post vendita per gli store online dei brand del gruppo, garantendo una customer experience in linea con i valori e il posizionamento di ciascun marchio.
  • Fornire supporto tempestivo e professionale ai clienti via email, telefono, live chat e social media, risolvendo problematiche legate a ordini, spedizioni, resi, pagamenti e prodotti.
  • Collaborare con il team Digital Marketing per assicurare una comunicazione coerente con i clienti attraverso le piattaforme social.
  • Supportare il team CRM nell’integrazione e nella coerenza dei diversi canali di contatto, contribuendo alla gestione di campagne e flussi automatizzati.
  • Aggiornare e mantenere la documentazione interna su procedure, FAQ e strumenti customer-facing.
  • Collaborare con i reparti logistica, operations, retail e IT per garantire un servizio fluido ed efficiente.
  • Contribuire al monitoraggio dei KPI di customer care e all’identificazione di aree di miglioramento dell’esperienza cliente.


Requisiti

  • 1–2 anni di esperienza in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in ambito e-commerce o retail di lusso.
  • Ottime capacità comunicative scritte e orali, in italiano e inglese
  • Attitudine al problem solving, empatia e forte orientamento al cliente.
  • Familiarità con tool e piattaforme di customer service (Zendesk, Salesforce, o equivalenti).
  • Interesse per il mondo del lusso, del digital e per le dinamiche omnicanale.
  • Precisione, proattività, spirito collaborativo.


Altri dettagli

  • Sede di lavoro: Mendrisio, Svizzera.
  • Disponibilità a lavorare 1 o 2 sabati al mese, secondo turnazione e necessità stagionali.
  • Ingresso in un contesto strutturato, dinamico e multiculturale, con la possibilità di crescita professionale all’interno di un gruppo leader del settore.


Cosa offriamo

  • Inserimento in una realtà internazionale di prestigio, con una forte cultura aziendale e attenzione al capitale umano.
  • Ambiente dinamico, orientato all’innovazione e alla trasformazione digitale
  • Opportunità di lavorare a stretto contatto con brand iconici del lusso italiano.

Der Alpenblick ist der perfekte Ausgangspunkt um eine der schönsten Gegenden der Schweiz zu erleben. Dank der Gemütlichkeit unseres 400 Jahre alten Berner Oberländer Hauses werden Ihre Ferien ein tolles Erlebnis!

Unser Erfolgsrezept? Top Service auf höchstem Niveau, authentisch und bloss nicht steif! Durch die Qualität unserer mehrfach ausgezeichneten Küche, sowie unserer Weinkarte mit Ihrem einzigartigen Schweizer Wein Angebot wird jeder Aufenthalt ein Genuss

Das Gourmetstübli wurde mit 1 Stern Michelin und 16 Punkten Gault Millau ausgezeichnet und gehört zu den besten Restaurants im Jungfraugebiet. In unserer Dorfstube bieten wir regionale Küche und unsere Gartenterrasse lädt ein zu einem genussvollen Aufenthalt im Freien.
Gemütliche Zimmer im rustikalen Stil , zum Wohnen und Sich-wohl-fühlen, darunter Familienzimmer und Suiten bieten den idealen Rahmen für massgeschneiderte Ferien.
Mise-en-place und Nachbereitung sowie selbstverantwortliche Organisation des Arbeitsplatzes
Vorbereitung und Zubereitung der erforderlichen mise en place,für Etagen,Küchen und Offic
Mithilfe bei der Organisation eines reibungslosen Ablaufes in der Etage und Lengerie
Einhaltung aller Hygienevorschriften laut HACCP sowie Gewährleistung der Arbeitssicherheit
Sie verfügen über fundierten Fachkenntnisse indiesen bereichen.
Sie sind erfahren und kreativ und motiviert in einer herrlichen Region zu leben und zu arbeiten.
Flexibilität, grosses Verantwortungsbewusstsein und hohe Einsatzbereitschaft zeichnen Sie aus.
Sie können sich in der deutschen Sprache verständigen.
Zeitgemässe Arbeitsbedingungen in einem modernen Umfeld
Gutes Arbeitsklima in einem jungen und motivierten Team
Freiraum für Veränderungen und Innovationen im gastronomischen Bereich

4268363569,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-at-safra-4268363569?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=E18eieG9Lp%2FUeM3oBxx%2FmQ%3D%3D&trackingId=deK8NcDjrHq2oOGuiVySAw%3D%3D,Analista de Dados,Safra,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","VENHA FAZER PARTE DO SAFRA!

A Safra Financeira é um segmento do Banco Safra com a missão de oferecer produtos como Financiamento de Veículos, Empréstimo FGTS e Crédito Consignado com excelência e segurança para correntistas e não correntistas. Nosso norte é transformar os sonhos dos clientes em nossa realidade.
O Analista será responsável pela estruturação da inteligência e gestão de dados para geração de dashboards, insights de negócio e produtos.

Estudar e revisar as esteiras internas (Crédito, Pricing, Pagamento, Fraudes, etc) para melhoria nas jornadas de originação nos canais internos (Turbo, WhatsApp, Site, etc) e canais externos (parceiros integrados via API).
Participação na construção de novos modelos de negócio com parceiros estratégicos para a operação de Veículos.
Prática em fechamento gerencial e conciliações
Experiência com indicadores, construção e manuseio de relatórios e bases de dados
Experiência na extração de bases para estudo (criação de query para consultas no SAS, Cloudera)
Capacidade analítica para tomada de decisão e geração de insights para a gerência
Administração de empresas, Ciências contábeis, Engenharias, Economia, Matemática, estatística.
Trilhas de capacitação acadêmica e técnica
Condições especiais em nossos produtos financeiros
JSafra Clube – (descontos em farmácia, lazer, bem estar e saúde, educação, colônia de férias no litoral Sul – SP).

VENHA FAZER PARTE DO SAFRA!


A Safra Financeira é um segmento do Banco Safra com a missão de oferecer produtos como Financiamento de Veículos, Empréstimo FGTS e Crédito Consignado com excelência e segurança para correntistas e não correntistas. Nosso norte é transformar os sonhos dos clientes em nossa realidade.


Responsabilidades e Atribuições

  • O Analista será responsável pela estruturação da inteligência e gestão de dados para geração de dashboards, insights de negócio e produtos.
  • Estudar e revisar as esteiras internas (Crédito, Pricing, Pagamento, Fraudes, etc) para melhoria nas jornadas de originação nos canais internos (Turbo, WhatsApp, Site, etc) e canais externos (parceiros integrados via API).
  • Participação na construção de novos modelos de negócio com parceiros estratégicos para a operação de Veículos.


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Prática em fechamento gerencial e conciliações

4239908778,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-junior-s%C3%A3o-paulo-sp-at-shopee-4239908778?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=E18eieG9Lp%2FUeM3oBxx%2FmQ%3D%3D&trackingId=azzGVjbyh6WMVjwMufyqtQ%3D%3D,Analista de Dados Junior- São Paulo/ SP,Shopee,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","About The Team

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

O Analista de Dados Júnior de Own Flex tem como missão primordial conduzir análises meticulosas e monitorar de forma ativa os resultados das operações logísticas. Este profissional é desafiado a enfrentar os obstáculos com iniciativa e a oferecer insights perspicazes, contribuindo significativamente para a otimização contínua da eficiência operacional.
Como será o seu dia a dia
Realizar análises detalhadas dos dados operacionais, identificando padrões, tendências e áreas de oportunidade para melhoria
Monitorar continuamente os indicadores de desempenho logístico, alertando proativamente sobre desvios e anomalias que possam afetar a eficiência das operações
Colaborar com as equipes operacionais para identificar e implementar soluções que otimizem os processos logísticos e melhorem o desempenho geral
Desenvolver e manter sistemas de monitoramento e relatórios automatizados para facilitar a análise e a tomada de decisões baseadas em dados
Participar ativamente em discussões sobre estratégias e iniciativas para aprimorar a eficiência operacional
Fornecer suporte analítico para projetos específicos, ajudando a avaliar o impacto das mudanças propostas nas operações logísticas
Manter-se atualizado sobre as melhores práticas do setor e as tendências emergentes em análise logística, buscando constantemente novas maneiras de agregar valor à organização.
Análises robustas e precisas que fornecem insights valiosos para melhorar a eficiência das operações logísticas
Identificação proativa de áreas de oportunidade e recomendações para otimização
Desenvolvimento e manutenção de sistemas de monitoramento automatizados.
O que você precisa para assumir o desafio
Ensino superior completo (Administração, Logística, Engenharia ou áreas correlatas)
Conhecimento intermediário em Pacote Microsoft Office/Google e SQL
Desejável conhecimento em ferramentas de automação, como Python
Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes
Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local
Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.
VEM FAZER HISTÓRIA COM A GENTE.
O QUE TE FAZ ÚNICO, NOS FAZ MELHORES! 🧡

4150286242,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-j%C3%BAnior-de-dados-preven%C3%A7%C3%A3o-%C3%A0-fraude-at-shopee-4150286242?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=E18eieG9Lp%2FUeM3oBxx%2FmQ%3D%3D&trackingId=beTTJUYaMGm87NvVHCVpUg%3D%3D,Analista Júnior de Dados - Prevenção à Fraude,Shopee,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","About The Team

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor. Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Estamos buscando uma (a) analista júnior de dados para apoiar a tomada de decisões relacionadas às iniciativas de prevenção à fraudes. Com a orientação do gestor, esse profissional ajudará a propor abordagens criativas, buscar dados e interpretar informações estatísticas para responder questões complexas e gerar insumos importantes para as discussões do time.
Como será o seu dia a dia
Estruturar e conduzir análises de dados para apoiar a construção de novas regras e modelos de fraude ou propor mudanças nas regras e modelos existentes
Construir análises de impacto para justificar a implementação de novas funcionalidades que possam melhorar nossas defesas contra fraude
Estruturar, construir e manter dashboards para acompanhar ativamente as perdas por fraude e identificar riscos potenciais
Apoiar o gerente na criação de apresentações impactantes para comunicar efetivamente as principais descobertas dentro de seu escopo
Buscar outras equipes (dentro ou fora da equipe de Prevenção à Fraude) para obter as melhores práticas relacionadas à análise de dados e pedir apoio quando necessário
Apoiar outras equipes da Shopee fornecendo informações, conduzindo análises e resolvendo problemas pontuais que estejam dentro de seu escopo de trabalho
Ajudar na criação de metas para fraude no marketplace, monitorar indicadores e enviar alertas quando necessário (por exemplo, para mudar prioridades visando alcance de metas)
Realizar estudos de benchmarking externos para reunir as melhores práticas relacionadas à Análise de Dados na Prevenção à Fraude.
O que você precisa para assumir o desafio
Formação em andamento ou completa em cursos de Engenharia, Ciências da Computação, Administração de Empresas ou áreas relacionadas
Conhecimento intermediário no Pacote Office, principalmente Excel/Sheets
Conhecimento avançado em SQL (Experiência em outras linguagens de programação é um diferencial)
Experiência em Prevenção de Fraude é um diferencial
Inglês avançado (será testado durante o processo de seleção).
Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes
Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.
