Licensed Clinical Psychologists — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.
You’re a fully-licensed Clinical Psychologist at a Master’s level or above with PSY, PSYP, or PsyD licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.
Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.
Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.

Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

We make it easy for mental health providers to take insurance by credentialing you with the nation’s largest networks, handling billing and admin paperwork, and helping you earn more stable income with higher rates. With Headway, you can finally focus on what matters most: providing life-changing care. We’ll take care of the rest.

About

4275948762,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-quantitative-analyst-at-imagine-staffing-technology-an-imagine-company-4275948762?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=M7%2BBPIDm%2Fmm7JUuN8PfVAw%3D%3D&trackingId=Kz2gL1CwAx%2F53942GzwM3w%3D%3D,Senior Data Quantitative Analyst,"Imagine Staffing Technology, An Imagine Company",United States,"Job Title: Senior Data Quantitative Analyst
No C2C, C2H or Visa Sponsorship available

Are you a talented Senior Data Quantitative Analyst looking for a dynamic and innovative work environment where your skills and creativity can truly shine? Join our client’s forward-thinking team, where they are committed to conducting complex statistical analysis to understand and quantify business problems to make a tangible impact in a rapidly evolving industry. Apply now to be a part of a company that not only values your expertise but also empowers you to achieve your full potential!
Tasks That Will Lead To Your Success
Explore, mine, and profile data across multiple large complex datasets to gain and interpret insights for use in statistical and quantitative analytics.

column2: document and store code to enable higher speed to impact.

column1: Conduct complex data manipulation and analysis with common programming languages. Consolidate results for business consumption with guidance from senior team members.

Track and report performance of multiple portfolios/ campaigns. Identify deviations from expectations, explain variances and explore interactions between interconnected portfolios. Consolidate variances for business consumption with guidance from senior team members.

Perform complex quantitative analysis to understand and quantify business problems leveraging statistical methods. Develop simple visualizations to explore and explain data. Draft exhibits and supporting materials for sharing analysis results with senior business leaders.
Work with Data Visualization Analysts to develop interactive visualizations and dashboards.
Qualifications That Will Help You Thrive

Minimum of an Associates degree and 5 years data analysis experience, or in lieu of a degree, a combined minimum of 7 years higher education and/or work experience, including a minimum of 5 years data analysis experience
Proficiency in SAS and\or Python for data manipulation and analysis
Experience in Financial Services is preferred
Capable of working on multiple projects of a complex nature.
Excellent problem-solving skills to assist in issue resolution.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with prior experience presenting to the target audience.

Job Title: Senior Data Quantitative Analyst

Location: Remote

Hire Type: Contingent

Work Model: Remote


No C2C, C2H or Visa Sponsorship available


Nature &
column2:
Scope:

Positional Overview


Are you a talented Senior Data Quantitative Analyst looking for a dynamic and innovative work environment where your skills and creativity can truly shine? Join our client’s forward-thinking team, where they are committed to conducting complex statistical analysis to understand and quantify business problems to make a tangible impact in a rapidly evolving industry. Apply now to be a part of a company that not only values your expertise but also empowers you to achieve your full potential!

Role &
column3:
Responsibility:

Tasks That Will Lead To Your Success

  • Explore, mine, and profile data across multiple large complex datasets to gain and interpret insights for use in statistical and quantitative analytics.
  • Modify data warehouses as necessary
column4:
document and store code to enable higher speed to impact.
  • Mentor less experienced team members.
  • Conduct complex data manipulation and analysis with common programming languages. Consolidate results for business consumption with guidance from senior team members.
  • Track and report performance of multiple portfolios/ campaigns. Identify deviations from expectations, explain variances and explore interactions between interconnected portfolios. Consolidate variances for business consumption with guidance from senior team members.
  • Perform complex quantitative analysis to understand and quantify business problems leveraging statistical methods. Develop simple visualizations to explore and explain data. Draft exhibits and supporting materials for sharing analysis results with senior business leaders.
  • Work with Data Visualization Analysts to develop interactive visualizations and dashboards.


    • Skills &
column5:
Experience:

Qualifications That Will Help You Thrive

  • Minimum of an Associates degree and 5 years data analysis experience, or in lieu of a degree, a combined minimum of 7 years higher education and/or work experience, including a minimum of 5 years data analysis experience
  • 5+ years hand on SQL experience
  • Proficiency in SAS and\or Python for data manipulation and analysis
  • Experience in Financial Services is preferred
  • Capable of working on multiple projects of a complex nature.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills to assist in issue resolution.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with prior experience presenting to the target audience.

The mission of the New York Police Department is to enhance the quality of life in our city by working in partnership with the community to enforce the law, preserve peace, protect the people, reduce fear, and maintain order. The NYPD strives to foster a safe city by incorporating Neighborhood Policing into all facets of Department operations and solve the problems that create crime and disorder through an interdependent relationship between people and its police, and by pioneering strategic innovation.
The Human Resources Division, Staffing Administration Section seeks a qualified candidate for Staff Analyst, I to assist with Department operations.
The Staff Analyst, I will be responsible for reviewing and analyzing assigned communications for civilian promotions, upgrades, title changes and salary adjustments
column2: reviewing a candidate's eligibility by analyzing resumes, licenses, certifications, and other education or experience
column3: preparing a justification including the candidate's current duties and proposed new duties, and ensuring they rise to the appropriate title and level
column4: preparing a monthly promotion grid and submitting Employee Transactions (ETs) for review and approval by the Deputy Commissioner, Management and Budget and Mayor's Office of Management and Budget
column5: and maintaining and updating the Civilian Tracking Transaction System (CTTS) with the most current information. The Staff Analyst, I will review all employee records upon receipt of OMB approval to ensure record has been updated accurately
column6: and will liaise with the Department of Citywide Administrative Services on various human resource issues.

4275945221,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-engineer-at-jobright-ai-4275945221?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=M7%2BBPIDm%2Fmm7JUuN8PfVAw%3D%3D&trackingId=Q6r9hr3IbPy8aS04DSNVMQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Engineer,Jobright.ai,"New York, United States","Verified Job On Employer Career Site

Optimum Media is an innovative multiscreen advertising sales and media consultancy business servicing various clients across the United States. They are seeking a talented Data Engineer to design and develop frameworks, tools, and processes for ingesting and processing data, while collaborating with the Analytics, Product, and Operations teams to enhance the data landscape and quality of data pipelines.
• Hands-on SQL coding experience and the ability to write advanced queries for data structuring and job processing
• Demonstrated experience working with large relational databases and an advanced understanding of data warehouse operations (Google BigQuery, Redshift, or other MPP database)
• Python-based script programming for process automation
• Hands-on experience working with Apache Airflow (Cloud Composer), Rest APIs
• Proficiency with Linux environments and bash scripting
• ELT and ETL jobs scheduling using cron
• Understanding streaming and batch processing paradigm
• Good knowledge of cloud providers like Google Cloud, AWS or Azure
• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools and code repositories such as GIT (Bitbucket)
• Ability to communicate with analytics engineers and data science teams to provide data processing and scripting solutions for projects on short timescales
• Discipline in documenting processes and architecture/infrastructure development
• Bachelor's /Master’s Degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Information Science/Mathematics or related field or equivalent job experience
• 2+ years of experience with SQL, relational databases, and data warehouses
• 2+ years of experience of engineering knowledge in data processing.
• 2+ years of experience with Python scripting
• Must have experience in cloud base technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure)
• Experience with Bash or similar scripting in Linux environments
• Experience creating documentation and architecture diagrams.
• Demonstrated experience using both schema driven and schema-free cloud-based storage solutions and platform implementation in a technical and analytical role
• Experience with benchmarking/tuning for performance across different platforms
• Familiarity with tools designed for efficiently transferring bulk data and parallel processing of data stored across data environments
• Experience building API connections and transferring large data sets between internal systems and vendor systems a plus
• Basic statistical analysis or statistical modeling experience with R or Python a plus
• Ideal candidates have experience working in Media, Television or Digital Marketing
• Experience working with Snowflake-data driven warehouses
• Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with PySpark jobs (Glue jobs, Serverless PySpark on GCP)
• Experience with distributed data technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, Apache Beam)
• Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with DataFlow jobs (Apache Beam)

Optimum Media provides innovative, data-driven multiscreen advertising solutions reaching every DMA in the U.S. Founded in 2018, the company is headquartered in Long Island City, New York, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Optimum Media has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

4275944973,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consumer-experience-data-analyst-at-adventhealth-4275944973?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=M7%2BBPIDm%2Fmm7JUuN8PfVAw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2F2S1LRZUBvtqgIQF281JNA%3D%3D,Consumer Experience Data Analyst,AdventHealth,"Orlando, FL","All the benefits and perks you need for you and your family:
Paid Days Off from Day One

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. Its about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.
The Community You'll Be Caring For

Located on a lush tropical campus, our flagship hospital, 1,368-bed AdventHealth Orlando. Serves as the major tertiary facility for much of the Southeast, the Caribbean and South America. AdventHealth Orlando houses one of the largest Emergency Departments and largest cardiac catheterization labs in the country. We are already one of the busiest hospitals in the nation, providing service excellence to more than 32,000 inpatients and 125,000 outpatients each year

The Consumer Experience Analyst will be an integral part of the Corporate Services Consumer Experience team within AdventHealth. In this role, you will have a successful track record of breaking down complex business ideas, analyzing data inputs and delivering key Consumer focused information to a variety of audiences. You will need to partner with managers, researchers, technologists, and operators to deliver impactful analysis supporting solutions for our Consumers. AdventHealth will depend on you to help drive solutions, processes, and technologies to create the greatest impact on the overall Consumer experience. The Consumer Experience Analyst works closely with Consumer team colleagues to research, develop, and influence product solutions and key Consumer efforts based on team strategy and vision. This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with technology, design, operations, analytics and executive teams to bring solutions to market. You will have the opportunity to summarize research, report on data driven insights, research and document consumer friction points as well as bring creative thinking to complex solutions.
Responsible for understanding, and analyzing a variety of data inputs and research related to key consumer promise and aspirational initiatives
Proven success record in analyzing, developing, building and executing first-in-class services and/or experiences
Translates the product vision into a set of detailed, comprehensive product requirements such as user stories, business rules and acceptance criteria.
Ensures the execution of creative assets developed in support of initiatives to ensure adherence to strategic vision.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, including experience in using hard data and metrics to support assumptions, product requirements, activation and solutioning.

Ensures new capabilities, improvements and/or enhancements are well integrated and vetted within the AdventHealth ecosystem including proactively partnering and collaborating with impacted upstream/downstream matrixed areas.
Proven ability to think strategically, execute methodically and manage competing priorities simultaneously.
Thoroughly tests and validates accuracy of all work product.
Attends cross functional Consumer project meetings to help drive priority decisions and remove roadblocks.
Supports multiple cross-functional Consumer teams to ensure a solid understanding of the defined scope.
Conducts research, analysis and mystery shops as needed in support of solving Consumer pain points and performance gaps.
Research and synthesize Consumer insight inputs to effectively develop communications for
Summarize and present research findings using digestible language and illustrations
Organize agendas and key action items from meetings with large groups of cross functional participants and executive stakeholders.
Minimum 2 years of experience working as a business analyst, product analyst or similar role, with at least 1 year in a leadership role
Ability to think strategically and turn ideas into action, with a positive outlook, personal initiative and accountability.
Exceptional verbal and written communication and project leadership skills, including an ability to communicate effectively to cross-functional teams.
Strong presentation and documentation skills to build research summaries, communications and product models for executive review.
Demonstrated ability to identify, understand, and drive resolution of complex critical issues.

Proven ability as a team player able to collaborate with and achieve actionable results through others, plus the ability to build strong and sustainable relationships, and the capability to interact within all levels of an organization.
Experience interviewing and communicating with third party vendors and external technology services to elevate product solutions to the team.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, synergizing many inputs into effective action plans or communications

This facility is an equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local anti-discrimination laws, regulations and ordinances. The salary range reflects the anticipated base pay range for this position. Individual compensation is determined based on skills, experience and other relevant factors within this pay range. The minimums and maximums for each position may vary based on geographical location.

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not tolerate discrimination based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, age or disability/handicap with respect to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion, wages, benefits and other terms and conditions of employment.

All the benefits and perks you need for you and your family:

Benefits from Day One

Paid Days Off from Day One

Career Development

Whole Person Wellbeing Resources

Mental Health Resources and Support

Our Promise To You

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. Its about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.

Location: 601 EAST ROLLINS STREET, Orlando, 32803

The Community You'll Be Caring For

AdventHealth Orlando houses one of the largest Emergency Departments and largest cardiac catheterization labs in the country. Job Summary

The Consumer Experience Analyst will be an integral part of the Corporate Services Consumer Experience team within AdventHealth. In this role, you will have a successful track record of breaking down complex business ideas, analyzing data inputs and delivering key Consumer focused information to a variety of audiences. You will need to partner with managers, researchers, technologists, and operators to deliver impactful analysis supporting solutions for our Consumers. AdventHealth will depend on you to help drive solutions, processes, and technologies to create the greatest impact on the overall Consumer experience. The Consumer Experience Analyst works closely with Consumer team colleagues to research, develop, and influence product solutions and key Consumer efforts based on team strategy and vision. This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with technology, design, operations, analytics and executive teams to bring solutions to market. You will have the opportunity to summarize research, report on data driven insights, research and document consumer friction points as well as bring creative thinking to complex solutions.

You Will Be Responsible For

  • Responsible for understanding, and analyzing a variety of data inputs and research related to key consumer promise and aspirational initiatives
  • Proven success record in analyzing, developing, building and executing first-in-class services and/or experiences
  • Translates the product vision into a set of detailed, comprehensive product requirements such as user stories, business rules and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensures the execution of creative assets developed in support of initiatives to ensure adherence to strategic vision.
  • Proven analytical and quantitative skills, including experience in using hard data and metrics to support assumptions, product requirements, activation and solutioning.
  • Ensures new capabilities, improvements and/or enhancements are well integrated and vetted within the AdventHealth ecosystem including proactively partnering and collaborating with impacted upstream/downstream matrixed areas.
  • Proven ability to think strategically, execute methodically and manage competing priorities simultaneously.

Qualifications

What Will You Need:

Education And Experience Required

  • Bachelor's Required
  • Minimum 2 years of experience working as a business analyst, product analyst or similar role, with at least 1 year in a leadership role
  • Ability to think strategically and turn ideas into action, with a positive outlook, personal initiative and accountability.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication and project leadership skills, including an ability to communicate effectively to cross-functional teams.
  • Strong presentation and documentation skills to build research summaries, communications and product models for executive review.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify, understand, and drive resolution of complex critical issues.
  • Proven ability as a team player able to collaborate with and achieve actionable results through others, plus the ability to build strong and sustainable relationships, and the capability to interact within all levels of an organization.
  • Experience interviewing and communicating with third party vendors and external technology services to elevate product solutions to the team.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, synergizing many inputs into effective action plans or communications

This facility is an equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local anti-discrimination laws, regulations and ordinances. Ti piacerebbe lavorare come Data Analyst Junior nella Direzione IT di BNL?

Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in più di 70 paesi con circa 199 mila collaboratori. Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.


Siamo alla ricerca di un* giovane talent* da inserire nel nostro team IT dedicato alle attività di Data Platform. Se sei appassionat* di tecnologia, ami risolvere problemi e vuoi crescere in un contesto dinamico e innovativo, questa è l’opportunità giusta per te!


Cosa farai concretamente?

  • Sarai parte attiva di un progetto innovativo in ambito Data Platform che punta alla realizzazione di una nuova piattaforma dati centralizzata denominata “Data Hub”
  • Avrai la possibilità di lavorare con tecnologie cloud native attraverso un ecosistema di strumenti eterogeni che consentono la trasmissione e la manipolazione del dato
  • Ti confronterai su tematiche funzionali afferenti all’ambito dei servizi di investimento attraverso attività di analisi, sviluppo ed elaborazione del dato
  • Potrai collaborare con team di sviluppo, operation e business per garantire la continuità dei servizi
  • Documentazione delle attività e aggiornamento della knowledge base


Il/la candidato/a ideale:

  • Ha una laurea in discipline STEM (preferibilmente Informatica o Ingegneria)
  • Ha una conoscenza di base sulle tematiche: architetture dati, data engineering, data management, sviluppo software ETL
  • È orientat* al problem solving e al lavoro in team
  • Ha buone capacità comunicative e voglia di imparare


Cosa offriamo:

  • Formazione continua e affiancamento
  • Ambiente giovane e collaborativo
  • Possibilità di crescita professionale in ambito IT e Digital


La nostra offerta:

Il contratto previsto è a tempo determinato di 6 mesi (CCNL del credito)


Sede di lavoro

Roma


In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.

4259841903,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-enel-group-4259841903?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=xEZAzitMfClHCaJHptPhUA%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,Enel Group,"Rome, Latium, Italy","If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a “Business Data Analyst” to join our “Customer Intelligence” team!

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.What You’ll do• Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.• Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.• Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.• Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.• Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.• Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.

Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:• Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.• Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.• Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over • Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.• Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.• Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.• Curiosity and continuous learning.• Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights. • Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.• Degree in an economic or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).• A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus. • 4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist• Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.• Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.• Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).• Advanced experience with SQL.• Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.• Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.Fluent English, speaking and writing
column2: Spanish is a great plus

column1: • Permanent employment contract• Health insurance and supplementary pension fund • Life-long learning • Development and empowerment paths• Corporate welfare for better work-life balance (parenting support, daycare, extra parental leave etc…)• Benefits with dedicated offers and conventions (meal vouchers, travel, transport, sports, culture, energy etc...)
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Selection Process

This opportunity is open to all candidates, we care about everyone unicity since a diverse workforce is an innovation lever.Our selection process is customized for each role and includes an interview with our recruiters and/or an attitudinal assessment and a meeting with our business line colleagues for a technical evaluation. If you are in line with the job description, the recruiting team will contact you, providing you with additional information about the recruiting process. We are looking for people who embody our values: Trust, Respect, Innovation, Proactivity and Flexibility. Are you ready to make a difference and grow with us? Apply now and join us in leading the energy transition within the Customer Intelligence team!

Enel SpaWe’re a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.We’re engaged in ensuring ever-more efficient, resilient, and digitalized electrical grids, with the highest service standards, by managing a network spanning 1.9 million kilometers and investing in storage systems to integrate renewable production, stabilize the electrical system, and allow for the management of the intermittency of renewable sources.Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.With an installed capacity of over 86 GW – 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.Curious about us? Explore here www.enel.com

If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a “Business Data Analyst” to join our “Customer Intelligence” team!

Who You’ll work with

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.What You’ll do• Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.• Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.• Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.• Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.• Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.• Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.

What You’ll bring

Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:• Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.• Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.• Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over • Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.• Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.• Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.• Curiosity and continuous learning.• Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights. • Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.• Degree in an
column2: <span>economic or&nbsp
column3: quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).• A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus. • 4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist• Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.• Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.• Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).• Advanced experience with SQL.• Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.• Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.Fluent English, speaking and writing
column4:
Spanish is a great plus

Why join us?

• Permanent employment contract• Health insurance and supplementary pension fund • Life-long learning • Development and empowerment paths• Corporate welfare for better work-life balance (parenting support, daycare, extra parental leave etc…)• Benefits with dedicated offers and conventions (meal vouchers, travel, transport, sports, culture, energy etc...)

Location: Rome (Italy)

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Selection Process

This opportunity is open to all candidates, we care about everyone unicity since a diverse workforce is an innovation lever.Our selection process is customized for each role and includes an interview with our recruiters and/or an attitudinal assessment and a meeting with our business line colleagues for a technical evaluation. If you are in line with the job description, the recruiting team will contact you, providing you with additional information about the recruiting process. We are looking for people who embody our values: Trust, Respect, Innovation, Proactivity and Flexibility. Are you ready to make a difference and grow with us? Apply now and join us in leading the energy transition within the Customer Intelligence team!

Who we are

Enel SpaWe’re a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.We’re engaged in ensuring ever-more efficient, resilient, and digitalized electrical grids, with the highest service standards, by managing a network spanning 1.9 million kilometers and investing in storage systems to integrate renewable production, stabilize the electrical system, and allow for the management of the intermittency of renewable sources.Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.With an installed capacity of over 86 GW – 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.Curious about us? Explore here www.enel.com

✨ Su di noi: Benvenuto/a in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.
🎯 La tua sfida: sei curioso/a di partecipare con noi e contribuire al cambiamento digitale di SIAE? Hai la passione per i progetti tecnologici e per la semplificazione dei processi?
Il candidato che stiamo cercando ha maturato almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst in organizzazioni strutturate
column2: avrà una solida mentalità analitica, una profonda comprensione dei dati e la capacità di tradurre informazioni complesse e dati grezzi in insights utili per guidare le decisioni strategiche dell’azienda.

column1: La risorsa verrà inserita nell’U.O. Management Accounting & Segment Reporting, all’interno della Direzione Planning and Control e sarà chiamato a supportare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali attraverso lo svolgimento delle seguenti attività:

Analisi dati: raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati aziendali e da fonti esterne, sviluppare e implementare database per consentire l’analisi delle performance aziendali e la definizione di obiettivi.
Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attività di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.

Controllo di gestione: supportare il monitoraggio e la valutazione delle performance aziendali rispetto ai budget e ai forecast e la conseguente analisi degli scostamenti rispetto ai risultati attesi. Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonché nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.
Reportistica: supportare lo sviluppo e l’implementazione di report e dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi e facilitare la presa di decisioni da parte dei responsabili.
Data Modeling: creare modelli e strumenti di analisi predittiva per supportare la previsione delle tendenze e la valutazione degli impatti delle decisioni aziendali.
Collaborazione interfunzionale: essere in grado di interfacciarsi con le diverse strutture aziendali per comprenderne di supporto analitico e le esigenze informative del management.
Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunità per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.
Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Data Science, Economia/Finanza o campo correlato
Esperienza nell’analisi ed interpretazione dei dati
Interesse e predisposizione all’approfondimento di tematiche contabili e finanziarie
Conoscenza avanzata di SQL. Nice to have conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione (e.g. Python)
Esperienza nell'utilizzo di software di business intelligence e data analytics (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau)
Capacità di comunicare in modo efficace e presentare i risultati in modo chiaro
Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati. Attenzione al dettaglio e capacità di problem-solving
Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione
Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”
Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese
Borse di Studio per i figli

4242956137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-organizational-analyst-at-tim-4242956137?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=m6cRbbgSmW6x9YGQpxo3NA%3D%3D,DATA & ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYST,TIM,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Per una delle nostre Competence Development Area della sede di Roma ricerchiamo una persona con Laurea Magistrale in Economia, Statistica o Ingegneria Gestionale.

La persona si occuperà di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.
In particolare, tale attività dovrà essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.
Le competenze tecniche richieste sono le seguenti:
Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point

Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacità di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattività, propensione a lavorare in team, capacità di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.
Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.
Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all’opportunità di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.

4263441255,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-enel-x-4263441255?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=Lf51n7nme%2BFpCqm8akhhDw%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,Enel X,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Description And Requirements
If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a “Business Data Analyst” to join our “Customer Intelligence” team!

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.
Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.
Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.
Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.
Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.
Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.

Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.
Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:
Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.
Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.
Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over
Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.
Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.
Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.
Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights.
Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.
Degree in an economic or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).
A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus.
4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist
Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.
Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.
Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.
Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.

column2: Spanish is a great plus

column1: Health insurance and supplementary pension fund
Corporate welfare for better work-life balance (parenting support, daycare, extra parental leave etc…)
Benefits with dedicated offers and conventions (meal vouchers, travel, transport, sports, culture, energy etc...)
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Selection Process
This opportunity is open to all candidates, we care about everyone unicity since a diverse workforce is an innovation lever.

Our selection process is customized for each role and includes an interview with our recruiters and/or an attitudinal assessment and a meeting with our business line colleagues for a technical evaluation. If you are in line with the job description, the recruiting team will contact you, providing you with additional information about the recruiting process.
We are looking for people who embody our values: Trust, Respect, Innovation, Proactivity and Flexibility.
Are you ready to make a difference and grow with us? Apply now and join us in leading the energy transition within the Customer Intelligence team!
We’re a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.

We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.

We’re engaged in ensuring ever-more efficient, resilient, and digitalized electrical grids, with the highest service standards, by managing a network spanning 1.9 million kilometers and investing in storage systems to integrate renewable production, stabilize the electrical system, and allow for the management of the intermittency of renewable sources.

Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.

With an installed capacity of over 86 GW – 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.
Curious about us? Explore here www.enel.com

Description And Requirements

If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a “Business Data Analyst” to join our “Customer Intelligence” team!

Who You’ll Work With

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.

What You’ll do

  • Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.
  • Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.
  • Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.
  • Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.
  • Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.
  • Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.

What You’ll Bring

Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:

  • Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.
  • Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.
  • Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over
  • Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.
  • Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.
  • Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.
  • Curiosity and continuous learning.
  • Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights.
  • Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.
  • Degree in an economic or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).
  • A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus.
  • 4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist
  • Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.
  • Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.
  • Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
  • Advanced experience with SQL.
  • Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.
  • Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.

Fluent English, speaking and writing
column2:
Spanish is a great plus

Why join us?

  • Permanent employment contract
  • Health insurance and supplementary pension fund
  • Life-long learning
  • Development and empowerment paths
  • Corporate welfare for better work-life balance (parenting support, daycare, extra parental leave etc…)
  • Benefits with dedicated offers and conventions (meal vouchers, travel, transport, sports, culture, energy etc...)

Location: Rome (Italy)

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Selection Process

This opportunity is open to all candidates, we care about everyone unicity since a diverse workforce is an innovation lever.

Our selection process is customized for each role and includes an interview with our recruiters and/or an attitudinal assessment and a meeting with our business line colleagues for a technical evaluation. If you are in line with the job description, the recruiting team will contact you, providing you with additional information about the recruiting process.

We are looking for people who embody our values: Trust, Respect, Innovation, Proactivity and Flexibility.

Are you ready to make a difference and grow with us? Apply now and join us in leading the energy transition within the Customer Intelligence team!

Who We Are

Enel Spa

We’re a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.

We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.

We’re engaged in ensuring ever-more efficient, resilient, and digitalized electrical grids, with the highest service standards, by managing a network spanning 1.9 million kilometers and investing in storage systems to integrate renewable production, stabilize the electrical system, and allow for the management of the intermittency of renewable sources.

Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.

With an installed capacity of over 86 GW – 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.

Curious about us? Explore here www.enel.com

4240143422,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-msx-international-4240143422?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=E6ObgH7l3B8ZfcHONXBqzA%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,MSX International,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Company Description
With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:
Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.
To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world
To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,
and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility
Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you’re ready to make an impact and contribute to our company’s success, apply now!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

  • Consumer Engagement
  • Parts, Accessories &

    Job Description

    Business Data Analyst

    Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

    The Role

    Responsibilities

    As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:

    • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
    • Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
    • Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

    Qualifications

    About you

    About

    We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:

    • 3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
    • Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
    • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities

4270052686,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-consultant-data-analyst-intern-at-kpmg-italy-4270052686?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=DX39GdC8WPnmPFKgldkYhg%3D%3D,Junior Consultant Data Analyst (Intern),KPMG Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.
La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Disegno di basi dati con finalità analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entità/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics
Hai sviluppato la capacità di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL
column2: la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

column1: Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column2: knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

column1: Your Future With Us - What you’ll find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better – Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data &
column2:
Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Disegno di basi dati con finalità analitiche
  • Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
  • Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
  • Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
  • Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:

  • Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica
column3:
• Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entità/relazioni, DBMS)
  • Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data &
column4: Analytics
column5: • Hai sviluppato la capacità di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati
column6:
• Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
  • Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
column7: • Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL
column8:
la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
column9: • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
column10: • Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
column11: • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
column12: • Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
column13:
• Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.

    • Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

    Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

    Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

    Unisciti a noi!

    I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

    KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità

    At KPMG - no secrets with big data

    We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

    Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

    Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

    Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data &
column14:
analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:

  • Designing databases for analytical purposes
  • Analyzing and integrating data sources
  • Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
  • Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
  • Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.

Skills

 Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:

  • You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
  • You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
  • You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data &
column15:
Analytics.
  • You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling
column16: • You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad
column17: • You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column18:
knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

Your Future With Us - What you’ll find at KPMG

  • An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
  • A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
  • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
  • Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
  • International mindset and innovative projects.
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.

Together for Better – Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Se hai appena concluso, o stai concludendo, i tuoi studi e sei alla ricerca di un'opportunità per far emergere il tuo potenziale, allora sei nell’Azienda giusta. Sarai affiancato dai migliori professionisti per continuare ad apprendere. Il tuo successo è il nostro obiettivo comune!
