4270692196,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-lottomatica-4270692196?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=TeuDiZs5eZOYuA35abLpMw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Lottomatica,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.
Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Operations & Technology come Data Scientist.
Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
Contribuire allo sviluppo e all’evoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidarietà, pragmaticità, efficacia e affiatamento.
Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.
Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell’elaborazione di dati e nell’applicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).

Capacità di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn…
Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
Capacità di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacità di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG
Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills

Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione. In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo. Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinché il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.
We are looking for a profile to join the Operations & Technology Department as Data Scientist.
• Design, engineer, implement, and document new AI solutions to support business processes.
• Contribute to the development and evolution of the Data Platform in terms of technological, organizational, and process aspects.
• Contribute to the growth of the company's data assets.
• Collaborate with other team members to foster a group organizational culture based on principles of solidarity, pragmatism, effectiveness, and teamwork.
• Maintain, develop, and evolve models currently in production, assuming full management in collaboration with the team.
• Design, implementation, industrialization, maintenance, and monitoring of machine learning pipelines and virtual agents capable of supporting the transformation of business processes.
• Direct contact with internal customers to evaluate results and gather development requirements.
• Degree or diploma in science/computer science/statistics, or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/machine learning models.
• In-depth knowledge of machine learning and AI algorithms (LLM, tree models, NLP, clustering, neural networks, time series, etc.).
• Knowledge of data analysis and preprocessing mechanisms and feature engineering for machine learning projects (streaming and batch).

• Coding and debugging skills in Pyspark and Python, and therefore knowledge of the main machine learning libraries and frameworks, especially Spark and MLib, as well as MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, etc.
• Expertise in data modeling, statistical experiment modeling, and general knowledge of quantitative methods.
• Proven experience designing, implementing, and industrializing integrated AI solutions.
• Ability to analyze business problems, data, and context. Ability to perform hypothesis testing, model comparison, and result interpretation and validation.
• Git for code versioning and basic devops
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience from 43K.

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.


Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Operations &
column2:
Technology come Data Scientist.


Principali attività:

  • Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
  • Contribuire allo sviluppo e all’evoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
  • Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
  • Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidarietà, pragmaticità, efficacia e affiatamento.
  • Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
  • Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
  • Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell’elaborazione di dati e nell’applicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
  • Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
  • Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).
  • Capacità di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn…
  • Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
  • Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
  • Capacità di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacità di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Sono considerati requisiti preferenziali:

  • Conoscenza Databricks
  • Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
  • Conoscenza servizi Azure
  • Conoscenza Power BI
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo degli LLM open


Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

  • Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo

4264704255,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-engie-italia-4264704255?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=CKgzcWm40tdLvan5r1j%2Ftg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,ENGIE Italia,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Energy Management (EM) is responsible for the management of the ENGIE Group's assets, ensuring competitive energy for customers while optimizing created value, within a consistent risk framework.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its Global Business Unit Supply & Energy Management (S&EM) who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

15,000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our +120,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEM Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).

EM IS team provides new solutions or system integration and support to simplify and automize the business’ daily activities. We have a multi cloud platform, with all the applications and classic DWH projects are hosted as a PaaS architecture in Azure while there is a data lake hosted in AWS and several Machine learning projects are being migrated in this platform.
Based on its perimeter defined by IS Cloud & Data Science Manager, the candidate will learn have the following responsibilities:
Analyze and manage large volumes of data using SQL and data engineering tools.
Implement and scale solutions on AWS cloud for model training and inference.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to support strategic decisions.
Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders to understand business needs and propose data-driven solutions.
Integrate models with external systems through the development or use of RESTful APIs.
Ensure data quality and robustness of developed models.
Develop and maintain data ingestion and ETL systems.
Develop and optimize machine learning models for time series forecasting in the energy sector.
The ideal profile matches with the followings prerequisites:
Bachelor's degree in STEM disciplines (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related fields)
Excellent knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis and modeling.
At least 2 years of experience in Data Science roles, with a focus on time series forecasting using Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques.
Experience in developing and implementing solutions on AWS (e.g., Lambda, S3, SageMaker, Redshift, etc.).
Knowledge of energy market dynamics, with particular reference to spot markets and energy commodities.
Experience in developing reinforcement learning models for automated trading applications.
Experience with MLOps frameworks and CI/CD for model deployment.
The Data Engineer for EM strives to provide the highest possible quality of services such as the analysis, development and deployment of innovative solutions to the GEMS users.
Excellent command of written and spoken English for working in international contexts.
Interactive behavior: Active Listening and verbal and written communication skills.
Problem solving: Issues perception, analyzing, practical thinking, creativity, innovation.
Personal effectiveness: Facilitation skills, pragmatism and pro-activity, taking initiative.
Ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders through dashboards and reports.
Local contract according to Italian labor law.

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 170,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.
Recognized for 2025 by Sole24Ore as a leading company in diversity & inclusion, the ISO 30415:2021 and UNI PDR 125:2022 certifications are further proof of our commitment.

4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=uvjtu2QvjMQoAX5V6MeTEw%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings

Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions
Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.

column2: can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders

column1: Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column2: ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions

column1: Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges

column1: Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.

column1: You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients’ biggest challenges.
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data &
column2:
Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:

  • Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content
  • Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
  • Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
  • Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
  • Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
  • Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
  • Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
  • Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
  • Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
  • Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
  • Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
  • Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research &
column3:
Advisory provide excellent service delivery
  • Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
  • Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

    • What you will need:

    • Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
    • Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
    • Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
    • Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
    • Demonstrate executive presence
column4:
can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
  • Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
  • Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column5:
ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
  • Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column6:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
  • Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
  • Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
  • Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
  • Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
  • Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

    • Who you are:

    • You came from a Data &
column7:
Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
  • You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
  • You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column8:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
  • You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
  • You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
  • You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
  • You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
  • You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.

    • What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?

    • You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
    • You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.
    • You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
    • You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients’ biggest challenges.

    Who are we?

    At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

    Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

    Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

    What makes Gartner a great place to work?

    Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

    We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

    Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

    We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

    What do we offer?

    Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

    In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

    Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

    The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

    Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

    Job Requisition ID:97651

    By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Reporting directly to the Chief Data & AI Officer you will be responsible to:
Design and implement innovative BI solutions on SAP S4 and SAP Datasphere, integrating data for a complete view of the business.
Create stunning reporting and solutions that will guide decisions based on strategic Business data.
Experiment with the latest SAP BI technologies, such as SAP Datasphere and SAP Business Data Cloud, to keep Bulgari at the forefront of BI Innovation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our data solutions are flawless, from delivery to operations.
Maintain & Evolve existing and new solutions.

La Service Line Advacend Techologies & Innovation è alla ricerca di un Computer Vision Engineer per ampliare e rafforzare il proprio team.

La persona selezionata avrà l'opportunità di lavorare su progetti innovativi e stimolanti in un ambiente altamente internazionale nell'ambito Computer Vision e Robotica e di accrescere le competenze in questo ambito grazie all'affiancamento con professionisti nel settore.
Non è indispensabile avere esperienze lavorative pregresse, cerchiamo persone curiose e motivate che abbiano voglia di imparare e crescere insieme al team.
Partecipazione a riunioni di natura tecnica e ai meeting progettuali
Partecipazione allo sviluppo di componenti software legate al mondo della computer vision e della robotica
Contribuzione alle fasi di progettazione e implementazione
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica, Data Science (è gradita una esperienza rilevante nel campo della AI o Robotica)
Buona conoscenza dei concetti di Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare per quanto riguarda le tecniche di Computer Vision
Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come C/C++, Python, e conoscenza del framework ROS
Forte passione per l'innovazione e il mondo della tecnologia
Sedi di Lavoro: Milano, Roma - Modalità di lavoro ibrida
Come società Global Top Employer abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità.
Crediamo nel talento e nell’evoluzione professionale, supportati da: formazione continua, programmi di apprendimento avanzati e piani di crescita personalizzati.

Facciamo parte di NTT Group, che investe oltre 3,6 miliardi di dollari ogni anno in ricerca e sviluppo per aiutare organizzazioni e società a muoversi con fiducia e sostenibilità verso il futuro digitale.
Siamo presenti in Italia con oltre 6000 dipendenti a Milano, Roma, Torino, Genova, Bologna, Treviso, Pisa, Napoli, Cosenza, Bari e Salerno.

La Service Line Advacend Techologies &
column2:
Innovation è alla ricerca di un Computer Vision Engineer per ampliare e rafforzare il proprio team.

La persona selezionata avrà l'opportunità di lavorare su progetti innovativi e stimolanti in un ambiente altamente internazionale nell'ambito Computer Vision e Robotica e di accrescere le competenze in questo ambito grazie all'affiancamento con professionisti nel settore.

Non è indispensabile avere esperienze lavorative pregresse, cerchiamo persone curiose e motivate che abbiano voglia di imparare e crescere insieme al team.

Responsabilità

  • Partecipazione a riunioni di natura tecnica e ai meeting progettuali
  • Partecipazione allo sviluppo di componenti software legate al mondo della computer vision e della robotica
  • Contribuzione alle fasi di progettazione e implementazione
  • Preparazione di reportistica e documentazione


Requisiti

  • Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica, Data Science (è gradita una esperienza rilevante nel campo della AI o Robotica)
  • Buona conoscenza dei concetti di Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare per quanto riguarda le tecniche di Computer Vision
  • Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come C/C++, Python, e conoscenza del framework ROS
  • Ottima padronanza della lingua inglese
  • Forte passione per l'innovazione e il mondo della tecnologia
  • Approccio proattivo e curioso
  • Predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo
  • Orientamento al risultato.

4235896310,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-business-analyst-area-marketing-sales-services-at-ey-4235896310?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=QPR5pEKQYBY924iYnvbAhg%3D%3D,AI Business Analyst - Area Marketing & Sales Services,EY,"Rome, Latium, Italy","AI Business Analyst – Area Marketing & Sales Services
Unisciti al nostro team Marketing, Sales & Service a Roma e dai una svolta alla tua carriera entrando in EY.

EY è una delle società Big 4 della consulenza. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende è la possibilità di trasformare il business e il modo di lavorare dei nostri clienti, che siano grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese o pubbliche amministrazioni. La nostra cultura del lavoro si basa sulla fiducia, l’autonomia e il rispetto tra le persone, ed è incentrata sul raggiungimento dei risultati attraverso una modalità di lavoro ibrida.
Questi sono i fattori più influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci nel 2024!
Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all’anno di formazione per ciascuna persona
Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si è vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera
Salary e Benefits: con un’ampia gamma di convenzioni aziendali, dalla palestra allo shopping, fino a servizi gratuiti di telemedicina e supporto psicologico
Mobilità e opportunità internazionali, compresa la possibilità di lavorare dall’estero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta
Smart working senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.
Qual è il team di riferimento?
Entrerai a far parte della divisione Business Consulting di EY all’interno del gruppo di lavoro denominato Marketing, Sales & Service.
Il tuo ruolo sarà quello di Business Analyst. La modalità di lavoro è ibrida con sede di riferimento Roma nella nostra splendida sede in Via Aurora 43.
Di cosa ti occuperai nel Team Marketing, Sales & Service?
All'interno del gruppo supporterai piccole, medie o grandi aziende di diversi settori industriali (es. infrastrutture, trasporti, logistica, multiutilities) verso attività quali:
Supporto alla transizione verso AI-driven company
Raccolta requisiti di business e project management di progettualità legate all’AI, in particolare volte all’adozione di strumenti come Copilot e altri tool di AI generativa
Definizione e prioritizzazione degli use case di AI da implementare secondo roadmap impatto/beneficio
Analisi di mercato e benchmark rispetto ai competitor del settore di riferimento
Revisione ed ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali esistenti
Redazione dei documenti di progetto su Business & Operating Modeling
Supporto alla realizzazione di presentazione per il cliente in base alle modifiche effettuate ai comparti aziendali.
1-2 anni di esperienza in primarie società di consulenza o in ruoli affini in ambito business
Esperienza o forte curiosità verso il mondo dell’intelligenza artificiale applicata al business
Laureate in percorsi magistrali in Ingegneria o Economia in tutte le sue declinazioni (Business Administration, Management etc)
Un mindset analitico, flessibilità e spirito di squadra
Una buona conoscenza del pacchetto Office e della lingua inglese
Sarà considerato un plus la conoscenza di strumenti di AI generativa (es. Copilot M365, Gemini, ChatGPT, etc)
Progetti di ogni tipo per clienti di ogni settore
+ 450.000 ore di formazione erogate per accrescere le tue competenze tecniche e il tuo talento personale
Un Counselor che ti supporterà nel tuo percorso professionale
Policy di smart working flessibile e possibilità di lavorare dall’estero
Benefits e programmi di welfare aziendale diversificati.

EY promuove la diversità, l’equità e l’inclusione, valorizzando l’unicità, indipendentemente da età, genere, abilità, esperienza, cultura, orientamento sessuale, religione, disabilità e background socio-economico. Tutte le nostre offerte di lavoro si rivolgono allo stesso modo a persone con disabilità, in conformità con la legge italiana L. 68/99. Il nostro obiettivo è creare un ambiente di lavoro equo e accessibile

Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!


What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:

  • Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
  • Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
  • Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.


Why Join the AI Community?

  • Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
  • Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
  • Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!


Basic Requirement and Assessment:

  • Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
  • An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
  • Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.


Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

Bulgari is looking for a talented BI Expert to join its Data & AI Product Unit within the Corporate IT in Rome. Reporting directly to the Chief Data & AI Officer you will be responsible to:
Design and implement innovative BI solutions on SAP S4 and SAP Datasphere, integrating data for a complete view of the business.
Create stunning reporting and solutions that will guide decisions based on strategic Business data.
Experiment with the latest SAP BI technologies, such as SAP Datasphere and SAP Business Data Cloud, to keep Bulgari at the forefront of BI Innovation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our data solutions are flawless, from delivery to operations.
Maintain & Evolve existing and new solutions.
A graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
A professional with at least 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and Data Analysis.
A guru of S4 Embedded Analytics (CDS/VDM, AFO, Fiori) and SAP Datashpere.
A wizard of SQL/ABAP and data modeling techniques.
An effective communicator, capable of presenting complex data to a diverse audience.
A problem solver with a results-oriented approach.

A collaborative and agile team-member / team-leader able to put in place strong and effective collaborations with all the people involved in the many initiatives and projects she/he will be involved in.
A Business Intelligence technologist very interested in innovation and in learning new tools/platforms (e.g. PowerBI, Databricks, etc.) also sharing her/his knowledge within the team.
The opportunity to work for a multinational / multicultural brand leader in the luxury market.
A stimulating and dynamic work environment where innovation and collaboration is at the heart of everything.
The opportunity to grow professionally and make a tangible contribution to Bulgari's success.

Posizione

Responsibilities

    • A Business Intelligence technologist very interested in innovation and in learning new tools/platforms (e.g. PowerBI, Databricks, etc.) also sharing her/his knowledge within the team.

4270952152,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-product-manager-at-autorola-group-%C2%B7-global-4270952152?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=EgWXJ3QEBTOwdzSLZQs81Q%3D%3D,AI Product Manager,Autorola Group · Global,"Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","Own the future of AI-powered automotive products

We’re looking for an AI Product Manager to turn cutting-edge machine learning into real business impact. At Indicata – part of Autorola Group – you’ll lead the product journey for our Data Science & Engineering squad and bring our next-generation Dynamic Pricing Engine to life.
If you’re passionate about applied AI, product leadership, and building data-driven tools the market actually needs, this is your chance to make a real dent in the automotive industry.

Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing, automotive IT, and business intelligence solutions tailored for used vehicles and professional fleet management. Through our three business units – Marketplace, Solutions, and Indicata – we deliver innovative, digital tools that empower our clients to optimize every step of the vehicle lifecycle.

With more than 20 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific, our platform connects OEMs, leasing companies, banks, and dealers, enabling seamless trade and data-driven decisions in real time.
In this role, you will join Indicata as our new AI Product Manager and bridge the gap between deep tech and commercial impact.

Indicata is the leading real-time analytics platform turning 14 million daily data points into smarter decisions for OEMs, dealer groups, and fleet owners. As part of the global Autorola Group, we help customers price better, sell faster, and optimize operations.

With the industry moving rapidly toward a data-first future, our AI-powered tools are more critical than ever. Already Europe’s most trusted used-car valuation engine, we’re now scaling intelligent pricing, stock-turn, and auction-strategy products into new markets.
We have world-class data scientists and a central AI Centre of Excellence - but we’ve found the need to manage backlogs and herd stakeholders. That’s where you come in.

As AI Product Manager, you’ll be the connective tissue between data, development, and the business. You’ll act as Product Owner for our Data Science and Data Engineering squad, align closely with our Software Development POs, and use your Product Management skills to ensure that commercial opportunities turn into real, AI-powered product value.

This role blends strategic product thinking with a strong grasp of AI and stakeholder alignment. You’ll drive the end-to-end process - from identifying opportunities to launching impactful machine learning features - while making sure we build what works, not just what’s possible. Therefore, your responsibilities will include:
Build AI-driven product features that enhance or expand our portfolio
Frame opportunities in terms of LLMs, fine-tuning, RAG, agents—or know when not to
Design and maintain an evaluation system for model quality, safety, and performance
Champion explainability, ethical AI, and bias checks to win trust with customers and regulators
Own and groom the backlog for the DS/DE squad
column2: set clear Product Goals

column1: Turn insights from sales, customers, and data into crisp stories and acceptance criteria
Facilitate agile rituals, align with other Product Owners, and report progress to C-level
Foster strong collaboration across AI, DEV, and commercial stakeholders
What success looks like in your first 12 months
Launch v1 of our ML‑driven Dynamic Pricing Engine in 5 pilot markets
Lift predictive accuracy by ≥10pp vs our current rule-based model
Reduce false-positive price suggestions by 30% via robust model evaluation
Establish a smooth sprint cadence with <5% open-defect rate at release
Build trusted relationships across AI, DEV, and commercial leadership
What you bring to the table
3-5 years in product management, with at least 2 years shipping AI/ML features
Product Owner experience in agile environments: backlog management, stakeholder alignment, sharp requirements
Conceptual understanding of ML: transformers, fine-tuning, XAI, retrieval pipelines
Hands-on data mindset—you can explore notebooks and dashboards comfortably

column2: you bridge tech, business, and UX

column1: This is your chance to own AI products end-to-end in a global company with proven customers, rich datasets, and the budget to build. You’ll work in a flat, outcome-focused culture—where ideas turn into prototypes quickly and user feedback is just a phone call away.

Our headquarters are located right by the train station at Skibhusvej 52A, 5000 Odense C, and we offer a good lunch arrangement, fitness room, pension scheme, health insurance, and social events (including a Friday bar to wrap up the week).

We’re looking to fill this position as soon as possible. If you’re excited by the mix of AI, product strategy, and hands-on execution, we’d love to hear from you—even if you don’t tick every single box.
We review applications continuously and may close the posting once we’ve found the right candidate.
For questions about the role, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, Autorola Group, at csg@autorola.com.

Own the future of AI-powered automotive products
We’re looking for an AI Product Manager to turn cutting-edge machine learning into real business impact. At Indicata – part of Autorola Group – you’ll lead the product journey for our Data Science &
column2:

If you’re passionate about applied AI, product leadership, and building data-driven tools the market actually needs, this is your chance to make a real dent in the automotive industry.

About Autorola Group

Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing, automotive IT, and business intelligence solutions tailored for used vehicles and professional fleet management. Through our three business units – Marketplace, Solutions, and Indicata – we deliver innovative, digital tools that empower our clients to optimize every step of the vehicle lifecycle.

With more than 20 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific, our platform connects OEMs, leasing companies, banks, and dealers, enabling seamless trade and data-driven decisions in real time.

In this role, you will join Indicata as our new AI Product Manager and bridge the gap between deep tech and commercial impact.

About Indicata

Indicata is the leading real-time analytics platform turning 14 million daily data points into smarter decisions for OEMs, dealer groups, and fleet owners. As part of the global Autorola Group, we help customers price better, sell faster, and optimize operations.

With the industry moving rapidly toward a data-first future, our AI-powered tools are more critical than ever. Already Europe’s most trusted used-car valuation engine, we’re now scaling intelligent pricing, stock-turn, and auction-strategy products into new markets.

AI meets Product Leadership

We have world-class data scientists and a central AI Centre of Excellence - but we’ve found the need to manage backlogs and herd stakeholders. That’s where you come in.

As AI Product Manager, you’ll be the connective tissue between data, development, and the business. You’ll act as Product Owner for our Data Science and Data Engineering squad, align closely with our Software Development POs, and use your Product Management skills to ensure that commercial opportunities turn into real, AI-powered product value.

This role blends strategic product thinking with a strong grasp of AI and stakeholder alignment. You’ll drive the end-to-end process - from identifying opportunities to launching impactful machine learning features - while making sure we build what works, not just what’s possible. Therefore, your responsibilities will include:

AI-focused responsibilities:

  • Build AI-driven product features that enhance or expand our portfolio
  • Frame opportunities in terms of LLMs, fine-tuning, RAG, agents—or know when not to
  • Design and maintain an evaluation system for model quality, safety, and performance
  • Champion explainability, ethical AI, and bias checks to win trust with customers and regulators

Classic Product/PO responsibilities:

  • Own and groom the backlog for the DS/DE squad
column3:
set clear Product Goals
  • Turn insights from sales, customers, and data into crisp stories and acceptance criteria
  • Facilitate agile rituals, align with other Product Owners, and report progress to C-level
  • Foster strong collaboration across AI, DEV, and commercial stakeholders

    • What success looks like in your first 12 months

    • Launch v1 of our ML‑driven Dynamic Pricing Engine in 5 pilot markets

    • Reduce false-positive price suggestions by 30% via robust model evaluation
    • Establish a smooth sprint cadence with <
column4:
5% open-defect rate at release
  • Build trusted relationships across AI, DEV, and commercial leadership

    • What you bring to the table

    • Product Owner experience in agile environments: backlog management, stakeholder alignment, sharp requirements
    • Conceptual understanding of ML: transformers, fine-tuning, XAI, retrieval pipelines
    • Hands-on data mindset—you can explore notebooks and dashboards comfortably
    • Strong storytelling and influencing skills
column5:
you bridge tech, business, and UX

Why join us?

This is your chance to own AI products end-to-end in a global company with proven customers, rich datasets, and the budget to build. You’ll work in a flat, outcome-focused culture—where ideas turn into prototypes quickly and user feedback is just a phone call away.

Our headquarters are located right by the train station at Skibhusvej 52A, 5000 Odense C, and we offer a good lunch arrangement, fitness room, pension scheme, health insurance, and social events (including a Friday bar to wrap up the week).

Ready to apply?

We’re looking to fill this position as soon as possible. If you’re excited by the mix of AI, product strategy, and hands-on execution, we’d love to hear from you—even if you don’t tick every single box.

We review applications continuously and may close the posting once we’ve found the right candidate.

For questions about the role, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, Autorola Group, at csg@autorola.com.

Provide ad hoc support around office as needed
Strong interpersonal, customer service and communication skills

The ideal candidate will exhibit high standards, excellent communication skills, and have an ability to take initiative, and prioritize daily tasks. A strong ability to take charge and meet tight deadlines will ensure your success in this multi-faceted role.

  • Ensure file organization based on office protocol
  • Provide ad hoc support around office as needed

4257152989,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/customer-and-event-coordinator-at-nabogo-4257152989?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=T01UODEte5%2FeTf9KQWxDww%3D%3D,Customer and Event Coordinator,nabogo,"Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","Vi leder efter en Customer and Event Coordinator med overskud, overblik og en roll-up under armen
Fuldtid · Odense (alternativt Vejle, København eller Aarhus - ansøg dog gerne ligemeget lokation)

Er du god til at skabe relationer, koordinere kampagner og stå i front ved events? Og kan du samtidig small-talke med en borgmester og jonglere lykkehjul og roll-ups på en travl onsdag? Så er det dig, vi leder efter.

Som Customer and Event Coordinator bliver du bindeleddet mellem vores samarbejdspartnere (kommuner, regioner og virksomheder) og de konkrete aktiviteter, der skaber værdi og resultater i vores partnerskaber. Du får ansvar for at planlægge og eksekvere synlighedsaktiviteter og kampagner og sikre, at vores samarbejder bliver en succes – både i tal og i menneskelig kontakt.
Planlægge og afholde lancering events, kampagner og synlighedsaktiviteter - fra idé til afvikling
Opbygge og vedligeholde relationer til lokale kontaktpersoner
Følge op på mål og data i samarbejde med kunder og kolleger
Koordinere og sparre med vores studenterteam og eksterne partnere
Sikre lokal tilstedeværelse og engagement i alle vores kundeområder
Levere resultater - det vil sige: få folk til at samkøre!
Du er struktureret, løsningsorienteret og god til at tage ansvar
Du trives i en hverdag med mange bolde i luften og har evnen til at gribe dem uden at miste overblikket
Du elsker at møde mennesker og kan tale med både studerende og kommunale samarbejdspartnere
Du har interesse i at blive en fantastisk kommunikatør - og tør stå foran en forsamling
Du kan arbejde selvstændigt, men ved også hvornår du skal gribe telefonen og sparre
Du skal trives i at arbejde med deadlines og flere sideløbende opgaver
En hverdag med masser af ansvar, fleksibilitet og tillid
Et job hvor du både står med fingrene i jorden og blikket på målet
Mulighed for at sætte dit eget præg på rollen og udvikle dig i takt med virksomheden
Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med kolleger, der hepper på hinanden
En grøn mission, der giver mening

Nabogo er en app-baseret scaleup-virksomhed med 17 fuldtidsansatte fordelt på kontorer i Danmark, Holland og Norge. Vi inspirerer tusindvis af mennesker til at dele bilen ved at gøre samkørsel til det naturlige valg i hverdagen. Særligt uden for byerne og som supplement til kollektiv transport. I tætte samarbejder med vores kunder – kommuner og regioner – leverer vi samkørsel, der har værdi for samfundet. Det lykkes vi med i lokale partnerskaber med virksomheder og uddannelsesinstitutioner.

Så skal du ikke tøve med at søge! Det vigtigste er ikke, hvor meget erfaring du har, men at du har gåpåmod, nysgerrighed og et naturligt overblik. Vi sørger for, at du bliver godt klædt på til opgaven – og vi går op i, at du lykkes.
Stillingen er fuldtid og med base i Odense – men vi er fleksible ift. kontorplads for den rigtige kandidat (Vejle, København eller Aarhus kan også være en mulighed)
Der vil være rejseaktivitet i Danmark ifm. kampagner og events
Så send os din motiveret ansøgning og CV senest d. 6./8 til Heidi@nabogo.com
Første samtaler finder sted i uge 33.

Vi leder efter en Customer and Event Coordinator med overskud, overblik og en roll-up under armen


Fuldtid · Odense (alternativt Vejle, København eller Aarhus - ansøg dog gerne ligemeget lokation)


Er du god til at skabe relationer, koordinere kampagner og stå i front ved events? Og kan du samtidig small-talke med en borgmester og jonglere lykkehjul og roll-ups på en travl onsdag? Så er det dig, vi leder efter.



Hvad skal du lave?

Som

column3:

Du vil:

  • Planlægge og afholde lancering events, kampagner og synlighedsaktiviteter - fra idé til afvikling
  • Opbygge og vedligeholde relationer til lokale kontaktpersoner
  • Følge op på mål og data i samarbejde med kunder og kolleger
  • Koordinere og sparre med vores studenterteam og eksterne partnere

  • Levere resultater - det vil sige: få folk til at samkøre!



Hvem er du?

  • Du er struktureret, løsningsorienteret og god til at tage ansvar
  • Du trives i en hverdag med mange bolde i luften og har evnen til at gribe dem uden at miste overblikket
  • Du elsker at møde mennesker og kan tale med både studerende og kommunale samarbejdspartnere
  • Du har interesse i at blive en fantastisk kommunikatør - og tør stå foran en forsamling
  • Du kan arbejde selvstændigt, men ved også hvornår du skal gribe telefonen og sparre
  • Du skal trives i at arbejde med deadlines og flere sideløbende opgaver


Hvad tilbyder vi?

  • En hverdag med masser af ansvar, fleksibilitet og tillid
  • Et job hvor du både står med fingrene i jorden og blikket på målet
  • Mulighed for at sætte dit eget præg på rollen og udvikle dig i takt med virksomheden
  • Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med kolleger, der hepper på hinanden
  • En grøn mission, der giver mening


Hvem er vi?

Nabogo er en app-baseret scaleup-virksomhed med 17 fuldtidsansatte fordelt på kontorer i Danmark, Holland og Norge. Vi inspirerer tusindvis af mennesker til at dele bilen ved at gøre samkørsel til det naturlige valg i hverdagen. Særligt uden for byerne og som supplement til kollektiv transport. I tætte samarbejder med vores kunder – kommuner og regioner – leverer vi samkørsel, der har værdi for samfundet. Det lykkes vi med i lokale partnerskaber med virksomheder og uddannelsesinstitutioner.


Er du nyuddannet?

Så skal du ikke tøve med at søge! Det vigtigste er ikke, hvor meget erfaring du har, men at du har gåpåmod, nysgerrighed og et naturligt overblik. Vi sørger for, at du bliver godt klædt på til opgaven – og vi går op i, at du lykkes.


Praktisk

  • Stillingen er

4262450521,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketingansvarlig-at-dansk-markedsf%C3%B8ring-danish-marketing-association-4262450521?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=zvAekkEVMAdB7rb8RPQGhA%3D%3D,Marketingansvarlig,Dansk Markedsføring (Danish Marketing Association),"Middelfart, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2025
Marketingansvarlig med flair for digital synlighed og kreativ kommunikation

Er du en stærk formidler, som mestrer at skabe engagement og resultater gennem content marketing, digitale kampagner og events? Brænder du for at gøre en forskel i en branche i udvikling – og vil du stå i spidsen for markedsføringen af HUSET Middelfart og Byggecentrum? Så er det dig, vi leder efter!

Som marketingansvarlig får du ansvar for markedsføringen af HUSET Middelfart og Byggecentrum – to stærke brands. Du bliver den drivende kraft bag vores digitale tilstedeværelse og brandfortælling, og du skal sikre både konferencegæster, besøgende og leads til vores sælgere via målrettede og kreative kampagner.
Producere skarpt og engagerende indhold – tekst, video og billeder – til SoMe, website og e-mail
Tiltrække relevante MQL/SQL-leads gennem betalte og organiske digitale kanaler
Drive kampagner og aktiviteter, der skaber opmærksomhed og trafik til vores byggeudstilling
Udvikle og eksekvere marketingstrategier og go-to-market-planer i samarbejde med CMO
Være sparringspartner for vores Digitale Marketing Manager og lede en deltidsmedarbejder i Middelfart
Være i tæt dialog med vores udstillere
Om dig – den stærke kommunikatør og strateg

Du er både kreativ og kommercielt tænkende – og har dokumenteret erfaring med at skabe resultater gennem content marketing og digitale medier. Du har måske erfaring fra et contentbureau eller en lignende rolle, hvor du har lært at kombinere brandopbygning med datadrevet leadgenerering.
Har mindst 5 års erfaring med contentproduktion og digital marketing
Er skarp til både Paid Social og Email Marketing – og vant til at arbejde med data og optimering
Har en relevant uddannelse inden for kommunikation eller marketing
Tænker strategisk, arbejder struktureret og trives med både frihed og ansvar
Er performance-orienteret og drives af at skabe resultater som kan aflæses på bundlinjen
Produktion af content: tekst, billeder og video
Udvikling og eksekvering af marketingstrategier og go-to-market-planer
E-mail marketing: strategi, indhold og automation
Eventmarkedsføring og kommunikation omkring særarrangementer i Byggecentrum
En spændende hverdag i en ambitiøs, men uformel organisation i vækst
En central rolle i en dynamisk branche, hvor du virkelig kan gøre en forskel
Stor indflydelse på dine opgaver – og mulighed for at præge retningen
Løn efter kvalifikationer, frokostordning og sundhedsforsikring
Stillingen er på fuldtid med base i HUSET Middelfart.
Ansøgning: Send din motiverede ansøgning, eksempler på tidligere arbejde og dit CV til
Ansøgningsfrist: 7. august. Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.
Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte
CMO Peter Holm på phn@molio.dk eller 53 52 88 00

HUSET Middelfart og Byggecentrum er en del af Molio. Molio er det samlende videnscenter for den danske bygge- og anlægsbranche. Det er branchens fælles og uafhængige sted for udvikling og etablering af fælles værktøjer, standarder og viden. Molio arbejder for digitalisering og bæredygtighed i branchen.
HUSET Middelfart er et moderne konferencecenter med 30.000 gæster årligt, hvor ca. 40 procent af gæsterne kommer fra byggebranchen.
Byggecentrum er Danmarks største byggeudstilling – 28.000 kvm inde og ude med ca. 140 udstillere og 100.000 årlige besøgende.

4251869123,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/global-head-of-aftersales-at-vitrolife-group-4251869123?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=rLNxf9JNRNya7ITA4P7cyQ%3D%3D,Global Head of Aftersales,Vitrolife Group,"Viby, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","At the Vitrolife Group, we work every day to unlock the full potential of science and technology to reduce the barriers towards building a family. Together we help our customers and their patients to fulfill the dream of having a baby.

Vitrolife Group is seeking a visionary and hands-on leader to shape the future of global Aftersales Services across our medtech and digital solutions portfolio. This role is your opportunity to unify and elevate a fragmented service landscape — spanning medical devices, SaaS platforms, and EMR integrations — into a world-class, customer-centric capability.
If you’re energized by complexity, passionate about continuous improvement, and driven to deliver value beyond the sale — this is your moment to lead transformation at scale.

As Global Head of Aftersales, you will lead the strategic redesign and operational execution of our end-to-end service offering. You’ll define how we install, support, and evolve mission-critical systems for fertility clinics and healthcare providers — ensuring that service becomes a differentiator, not a cost center.

You will report to the SVP Consumables & Technologies and collaborate closely with global leaders across Sales, R&D, Quality, and Product to deliver seamless, value-added experiences for our customers worldwide.
Design and execute a unified global service strategy covering equipment installation, SaaS onboarding, and EMR data integration.
Define clear global-to-local workflows — balancing cost, responsiveness, and regulatory needs.
Standardize operating models across business lines to improve transparency and accountability.
Consolidate tools into a unified service management platform — enabling real-time SLA tracking, work order management, spare parts ordering, and customer dashboards.
Define and monitor KPIs such as customer satisfaction, mean time between failure, and integration success rates.
Embed lean practices and data-driven service improvements across regions.
Streamline all support touchpoints (chat, phone, portals) into a single, tiered helpdesk model.
Launch regular satisfaction surveys and feedback loops to identify friction points and drive enhancements.
Elevate service into a commercial asset by supporting renewal conversations and value-add offerings.
Structure and scale a high-performing global team: field engineers, tech support specialists, integration consultants, and regional managers.
Define role expectations, develop technical competencies, and cultivate a culture of accountability and continuous learning.
Channel field insights to R&D and Product teams to drive proactive roadmap improvements.
Partner with Sales and Marketing to deliver service performance data, support renewals, and identify upsell opportunities.
Lead budget planning and cost optimization across global service operations.
Identify synergies, automation opportunities, and operational efficiencies.
10+ years in global aftersales or service operations within high-tech or medtech environments.
Deep experience across hardware servicing, SaaS lifecycle support, and system integration.
Proven track record in building and scaling international teams with P&L responsibility.
Strong technical and analytical acumen — confident working with service platforms, dashboards, and KPI frameworks.
A customer-first mindset — with experience launching support models that improve satisfaction and retention.
Excellent collaboration, influence, and change leadership skills.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.

column2: additional languages are a plus.

column1: Vitrolife Group is a global provider of medical devices and genetic services. Based on science and advanced research capabilities, we develop services and products for personalised genetic information and medical device products. We support our customers by improving their clinical practice for the patient's outcome of a fertility treatment.We are currently approximately 1 100 colleagues worldwide, with headquarters in Gothenburg, Sweden.

Vitrolife Group's products and services are available in more than 125 countries through our own presence in 25 countries and a network of distributors. Vitrolife Group is a sustainable market leader and aims to be the preferred partner for IVF-clinics by providing superior products and services with the vision of fulfilling the dream of having a baby. The Vitrolife share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
